28 #include "../../include/fem/fem_geometry_structure.hpp"
29 #include "../../include/geometry/primal_grid/CPrimalGridFEM.hpp"
30 #include "../../include/geometry/primal_grid/CPrimalGridBoundFEM.hpp"
31 #include "../../include/adt/CADTElemClass.hpp"
32 #include "../../include/adt/CADTPointsOnlyClass.hpp"
33 
34 /* Prototypes for Lapack functions, if MKL or LAPACK is used. */
35 #if defined (HAVE_MKL) || defined(HAVE_LAPACK)
36 extern "C" void dpotrf_(char *, int*, passivedouble*, int*, int*);
37 extern "C" void dpotri_(char *, int*, passivedouble*, int*, int*);
38 #endif
39 
40 bool CLong3T::operator<(const CLong3T &other) const {
41  if(long0 != other.long0) return (long0 < other.long0);
42  if(long1 != other.long1) return (long1 < other.long1);
43  if(long2 != other.long2) return (long2 < other.long2);
44 
45  return false;
46 }
47 
48 CReorderElements::CReorderElements(const unsigned long val_GlobalElemID,
49  const unsigned short val_TimeLevel,
50  const bool val_CommSolution,
51  const unsigned short val_VTK_Type,
52  const unsigned short val_nPolySol,
53  const bool val_JacConstant) {
54 
55  /* Copy the global elment ID, time level and whether or not this element
56  must be communicated. */
57  globalElemID = val_GlobalElemID;
58  timeLevel = val_TimeLevel;
59  commSolution = val_CommSolution;
60 
61  /* Create the element type used in this class, which stores information of
62  the VTK type, the polynomial degree of the solution and whether or not the
63  Jacobian of the transformation is constant. As it is possible that the
64  polynomial degree of the solution is zero, this convention is different
65  from the convention used in the SU2 grid file. */
66  elemType = val_VTK_Type + 100*val_nPolySol;
67  if( !val_JacConstant ) elemType += 50;
68 }
69 
70 bool CReorderElements::operator< (const CReorderElements &other) const {
71 
72  /* Elements with the lowest time level are stored first. */
73  if(timeLevel != other.timeLevel) return timeLevel < other.timeLevel;
74 
75  /* Next comparison is whether or not the element must communicate its
76  solution data to other ranks. Elements which do not need to do this
77  are stored first. */
78  if(commSolution != other.commSolution) return other.commSolution;
79 
80  /* Elements of the same element type must be stored as contiguously as
81  possible to allow for the simultaneous treatment of elements in the
82  matrix multiplications. */
83  if(elemType != other.elemType) return elemType < other.elemType;
84 
85  /* The final comparison is based on the global element ID. */
86  return globalElemID < other.globalElemID;
87 }
88 
89 bool CSortFaces::operator()(const CFaceOfElement &f0,
90  const CFaceOfElement &f1) {
91 
92  /*--- Comparison in case both faces are boundary faces. ---*/
93  if(f0.faceIndicator >= 0 && f1.faceIndicator >= 0) {
94 
95  /* Both faces are boundary faces. The first comparison is the boundary
96  marker, which is stored in faceIndicator. */
97  if(f0.faceIndicator != f1.faceIndicator) return f0.faceIndicator < f1.faceIndicator;
98 
99  /* Both faces belong to the same boundary marker. The second comparison is
100  based on the on the local volume ID's of the adjacent elements. As the
101  volumes are sorted according to the time levels for time accurate
102  local stepping, there is no need to do this check seperately here. */
103  unsigned long ind0 = f0.elemID0 < nVolElemTot ? f0.elemID0 : f0.elemID1;
104  unsigned long ind1 = f1.elemID0 < nVolElemTot ? f1.elemID0 : f1.elemID1;
105 
106  return ind0 < ind1;
107  }
108 
109  /*--- Comparison in case both faces are internal faces. ---*/
110  if(f0.faceIndicator == -1 && f1.faceIndicator == -1) {
111 
112  /* Both faces are internal faces. First determine the minimum and maximum
113  ID of its adjacent elements. */
114  unsigned long elemIDMin0 = min(f0.elemID0, f0.elemID1);
115  unsigned long elemIDMax0 = max(f0.elemID0, f0.elemID1);
116 
117  unsigned long elemIDMin1 = min(f1.elemID0, f1.elemID1);
118  unsigned long elemIDMax1 = max(f1.elemID0, f1.elemID1);
119 
120  /* Determine the situation. */
121  if(elemIDMax0 < nVolElemTot && elemIDMax1 < nVolElemTot) {
122 
123  /* Both faces are matching internal faces. Determine whether or not these
124  faces are local faces, i.e. faces between locally owned elements. */
125  const bool face0IsLocal = elemIDMax0 < nVolElemOwned;
126  const bool face1IsLocal = elemIDMax1 < nVolElemOwned;
127 
128  /* Check if both faces have the same status, i.e. either local or
129  not local. */
130  if(face0IsLocal == face1IsLocal) {
131 
132  /* Both faces are either local or not local. Determine the time level
133  of the faces, which is the minimum value of the adjacent volume
134  elements. */
135  const unsigned short timeLevel0 = min(volElem[elemIDMin0].timeLevel,
136  volElem[elemIDMax0].timeLevel);
137  const unsigned short timeLevel1 = min(volElem[elemIDMin1].timeLevel,
138  volElem[elemIDMax1].timeLevel);
139 
140  /* Internal faces with the same status are first sorted according to
141  their time level. Faces with the smallest time level are numbered
142  first. Note this is only relevant for time accurate local time
143  stepping. */
144  if(timeLevel0 != timeLevel1) return timeLevel0 < timeLevel1;
145 
146  /* The faces belong to the same time level. They are sorted according
147  to their element ID's in order to increase cache performance. */
148  if(elemIDMin0 != elemIDMin1) return elemIDMin0 < elemIDMin1;
149  return elemIDMax0 < elemIDMax1;
150  }
151  else {
152 
153  /* One face is a local face and the other is not. Make sure that
154  the local faces are numbered first. */
155  if( face0IsLocal ) return true;
156  else return false;
157  }
158  }
159  else if(elemIDMax0 >= nVolElemTot && elemIDMax1 >= nVolElemTot) {
160 
161  /* Both faces are non-matching internal faces. Sort them according to
162  their relevant element ID. The time level is not taken into account
163  yet, because non-matching faces are not possible at the moment with
164  time accurate local time stepping. */
165  return elemIDMin0 < elemIDMin1;
166  }
167  else {
168 
169  /* One face is a matching internal face and the other face is a
170  non-matching internal face. Make sure that the non-matching face
171  is numbered after the matching face. This is accomplished by comparing
172  the maximum element ID's. */
173  return elemIDMax0 < elemIDMax1;
174  }
175  }
176 
177  /*--- One face is a boundary face and the other face is an internal face.
178  Make sure that the boundary face is numbered first. This can be
179  accomplished by using the > operator for faceIndicator. ---*/
180  return f0.faceIndicator > f1.faceIndicator;
181 }
182 
183 bool CSortBoundaryFaces::operator()(const CSurfaceElementFEM &f0,
184  const CSurfaceElementFEM &f1) {
185 
186  /* First sorting criterion is the index of the standard element. The
187  boundary faces should be sorted per standard element. Note that the
188  time level is not taken into account here, because it is assumed that
189  the surface elements to be sorted belong to one time level. */
190  if(f0.indStandardElement != f1.indStandardElement)
191  return f0.indStandardElement < f1.indStandardElement;
192 
193  /* The standard elements are the same. The second criterion is the
194  corresponding volume IDs of the surface elements. */
195  return f0.volElemID < f1.volElemID;
196 }
197 
198 bool CPointFEM::operator< (const CPointFEM &other) const {
199  if(periodIndexToDonor != other.periodIndexToDonor)
200  return periodIndexToDonor < other.periodIndexToDonor;
201  return globalID < other.globalID;
202  }
203 
204 bool CPointFEM::operator==(const CPointFEM &other) const {
205  return (globalID == other.globalID &&
206  periodIndexToDonor == other.periodIndexToDonor);
207 }
208 
209 void CVolumeElementFEM::GetCornerPointsAllFaces(unsigned short &numFaces,
210  unsigned short nPointsPerFace[],
211  unsigned long faceConn[6][4]) {
212 
213  /*--- Get the corner connectivities of the faces, local to the element. ---*/
214  CPrimalGridFEM::GetLocalCornerPointsAllFaces(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, nDOFsGrid,
215  numFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
216 
217  /*--- Convert the local values of faceConn to global values. ---*/
218  for(unsigned short i=0; i<numFaces; ++i) {
219  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j) {
220  unsigned long nn = faceConn[i][j];
221  faceConn[i][j] = nodeIDsGrid[nn];
222  }
223  }
224 }
225 
226 bool CInternalFaceElementFEM::operator<(const CInternalFaceElementFEM &other) const {
227 
228  /* First comparison is the standard element, such that elements with
229  the same same standard elements are grouped together. */
230  if(indStandardElement != other.indStandardElement)
231  return indStandardElement < other.indStandardElement;
232 
233  /* The second comparison is the element ID on side 0. */
234  if(elemID0 != other.elemID0) return elemID0 < other.elemID0;
235 
236  /* The final comparison is the element ID on side 1. */
237  return elemID1 < other.elemID1;
238 }
239 
240 void CSurfaceElementFEM::GetCornerPointsFace(unsigned short &nPointsPerFace,
241  unsigned long faceConn[]) {
242 
243  /*--- Get the corner connectivities of the face, local to the element. ---*/
244  CPrimalGridBoundFEM::GetLocalCornerPointsFace(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, nDOFsGrid,
245  nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
246 
247  /*--- Convert the local values of faceConn to global values. ---*/
248  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nPointsPerFace; ++j) {
249  unsigned long nn = faceConn[j];
250  faceConn[j] = nodeIDsGrid[nn];
251  }
252 }
253 
254 CMeshFEM::CMeshFEM(CGeometry *geometry, CConfig *config) {
255 
256  /*--- Allocate the memory for blasFunctions. ---*/
257  blasFunctions = new CBlasStructure;
258 
259  /*--- The new FEM mesh class has the same problem dimension/zone. ---*/
260  nDim = geometry->GetnDim();
261  nZone = geometry->GetnZone();
262 
263  /*--- Determine the number of variables stored per DOF. ---*/
264  /*--- This is specifically taylored towards perfect gas computations ---*/
265  /*--- and must be generalized later. As this number is also needed ---*/
266  /*--- in the solver, it is worthwhile to create a separate function ---*/
267  /*--- for this purpose. ---*/
268  MAIN_SOLVER Kind_Solver = config->GetKind_Solver();
269  const bool compressible = (Kind_Solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_EULER) ||
270  (Kind_Solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_NAVIER_STOKES) ||
271  (Kind_Solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_RANS) ||
272  (Kind_Solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_LES);
273 
274  unsigned short nVar;
275  if( compressible ) nVar = nDim + 2;
276  else nVar = nDim + 1;
277 
278  /*--- Determine a mapping from the global point ID to the local index
279  of the points. ---*/
280  map<unsigned long,unsigned long> globalPointIDToLocalInd;
281  for(unsigned long i=0; i<geometry->GetnPoint(); ++i)
282  globalPointIDToLocalInd[geometry->nodes->GetGlobalIndex(i)] = i;
283 
284  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
285  /*--- Step 1: Communicate the elements and the boundary elements to the ---*/
286  /*--- ranks where they will be stored during the computation. ---*/
287  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
288 
289  /*--- Determine the ranks to which I have to send my elements. ---*/
290  vector<int> sendToRank(size, 0);
291 
292  for(unsigned long i=0; i<geometry->GetnElem(); ++i) {
293  sendToRank[geometry->elem[i]->GetColor()] = 1;
294  }
295 
296  map<int,int> rankToIndCommBuf;
297  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
298  if( sendToRank[i] ) {
299  int ind = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
300  rankToIndCommBuf[i] = ind;
301  }
302  }
303 
304  /*--- Definition of the communication buffers, used to send the element data
305  to the correct ranks. ---*/
306  int nRankSend = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
307  vector<vector<short> > shortSendBuf(nRankSend, vector<short>(0));
308  vector<vector<long> > longSendBuf(nRankSend, vector<long>(0));
309  vector<vector<su2double> > doubleSendBuf(nRankSend, vector<su2double>(0));
310 
311  /*--- The first element of longSendBuf will contain the number of elements, which
312  are stored in the communication buffers. Initialize this value to 0. ---*/
313  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) longSendBuf[i].push_back(0);
314 
315  /*--- Determine the number of ranks, from which this rank will receive elements. ---*/
316  int nRankRecv = nRankSend;
317 
318 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
319  vector<int> sizeRecv(size, 1);
320 
321  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(),
322  MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
323 #endif
324 
325  /*--- Loop over the local elements to fill the communication buffers with element data. ---*/
326  for(unsigned long i=0; i<geometry->GetnElem(); ++i) {
327  int ind = (int)geometry->elem[i]->GetColor();
328  map<int,int>::const_iterator MI = rankToIndCommBuf.find(ind);
329  ind = MI->second;
330 
331  ++longSendBuf[ind][0]; /* The number of elements in the buffers must be incremented. */
332 
333  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetVTK_Type());
334  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNPolyGrid());
335  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNPolySol());
336  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNDOFsGrid());
337  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNDOFsSol());
338  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetnFaces());
339  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetTimeLevel());
340  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back( (short) geometry->elem[i]->GetJacobianConsideredConstant());
341 
342  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetGlobalElemID());
343  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetGlobalOffsetDOFsSol());
344 
345  for(unsigned short j=0; j<geometry->elem[i]->GetNDOFsGrid(); ++j)
346  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNode(j));
347 
348  for(unsigned short j=0; j<geometry->elem[i]->GetnFaces(); ++j)
349  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNeighbor_Elements(j));
350 
351  for(unsigned short j=0; j<geometry->elem[i]->GetnFaces(); ++j) {
352  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetPeriodicIndex(j));
353  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back( (short) geometry->elem[i]->GetJacobianConstantFace(j));
354  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back( (short) geometry->elem[i]->GetOwnerFace(j));
355  }
356 
357  doubleSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetLengthScale());
358  }
359 
360  /*--- Determine for each rank to which I have to send elements the data of
361  the corresponding nodes. ---*/
362  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
363 
364  /*--- Determine the vector with node IDs in the connectivity
365  of the elements for this rank. ---*/
366  vector<long> nodeIDs;
367 
368  unsigned long indL = 3;
369  unsigned long indS = 3;
370  for(long j=0; j<longSendBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
371  short nDOFsGrid = shortSendBuf[i][indS], nFaces = shortSendBuf[i][indS+2];
372  indS += 3*nFaces+8;
373 
374  for(short k=0; k<nDOFsGrid; ++k, ++indL)
375  nodeIDs.push_back(longSendBuf[i][indL]);
376  indL += nFaces+2;
377  }
378 
379  /*--- Sort nodeIDs in increasing order and remove the double entities. ---*/
380  sort(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
381  vector<long>::iterator lastNodeID = unique(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
382  nodeIDs.erase(lastNodeID, nodeIDs.end());
383 
384  /*--- Add the number of node IDs and the node IDs itself to longSendBuf[i]. ---*/
385  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nodeIDs.size());
386  longSendBuf[i].insert(longSendBuf[i].end(), nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
387 
388  /*--- Copy the coordinates to doubleSendBuf. ---*/
389  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nodeIDs.size(); ++j) {
390  map<unsigned long,unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
391  LMI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(nodeIDs[j]);
392 
393  if(LMI == globalPointIDToLocalInd.end())
394  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in map", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
395 
396  unsigned long ind = LMI->second;
397  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nDim; ++l)
398  doubleSendBuf[i].push_back(geometry->nodes->GetCoord(ind, l));
399  }
400  }
401 
402  /*--- Loop over the boundaries to send the boundary data to the appropriate rank. ---*/
403  nMarker = geometry->GetnMarker();
404  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
405 
406  /* Store the current indices in the longSendBuf, which are used to store the
407  number of boundary elements sent to this rank. Initialize this value to 0. */
408  vector<long> indLongBuf(nRankSend);
409  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
410  indLongBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i].size();
411  longSendBuf[i].push_back(0);
412  }
413 
414  /* Loop over the local boundary elements in geometry for this marker. */
415  for(unsigned long i=0; i<geometry->GetnElem_Bound(iMarker); ++i) {
416 
417  /* Determine the local ID of the corresponding domain element. */
418  unsigned long elemID = geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetDomainElement()
419  - geometry->beg_node[rank];
420 
421  /* Determine to which rank this boundary element must be sent.
422  That is the same as its corresponding domain element.
423  Update the corresponding index in longSendBuf. */
424  int ind = (int)geometry->elem[elemID]->GetColor();
425  map<int,int>::const_iterator MI = rankToIndCommBuf.find(ind);
426  ind = MI->second;
427 
428  ++longSendBuf[ind][indLongBuf[ind]];
429 
430  /* Get the donor information for the wall function treatment. */
431  const unsigned short nDonors = geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNDonorsWallFunctions();
432  const unsigned long *donors = geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetDonorsWallFunctions();
433 
434  /* Store the data for this boundary element in the communication buffers. */
435  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetVTK_Type());
436  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNPolyGrid());
437  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNDOFsGrid());
438  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(nDonors);
439 
440  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetDomainElement());
441  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetGlobalElemID());
442 
443  for(unsigned short j=0; j<geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNDOFsGrid(); ++j)
444  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNode(j));
445 
446  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDonors; ++j)
447  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(donors[j]);
448  }
449  }
450 
451  /*--- Definition of the communication buffers, used to receive
452  the element data from the other correct ranks. ---*/
453  vector<vector<short> > shortRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<short>(0));
454  vector<vector<long> > longRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<long>(0));
455  vector<vector<su2double> > doubleRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<su2double>(0));
456 
457  /*--- Communicate the data to the correct ranks. Make a distinction
458  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
459  map<int,int>::const_iterator MI;
460 
461 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
462 
463  /*--- Parallel mode. Send all the data using non-blocking sends. ---*/
464  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> commReqs(3*nRankSend);
465  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
466 
467  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
468 
469  int dest = MI->first;
470  SU2_MPI::Isend(shortSendBuf[i].data(), shortSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_SHORT,
471  dest, dest, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[3*i]);
472  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
473  dest, dest+1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[3*i+1]);
474  SU2_MPI::Isend(doubleSendBuf[i].data(), doubleSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
475  dest, dest+2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[3*i+2]);
476  }
477 
478  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data. */
479  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
480 
481  /* Block until a message with shorts arrives from any processor.
482  Determine the source and the size of the message. */
483  SU2_MPI::Status status;
484  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
485  int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
486 
487  int sizeMess;
488  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_SHORT, &sizeMess);
489 
490  /* Allocate the memory for the short receive buffer and receive the message. */
491  shortRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
492  SU2_MPI::Recv(shortRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_SHORT,
493  source, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
494 
495  /* Block until the corresponding message with longs arrives, determine
496  its size, allocate the memory and receive the message. */
497  SU2_MPI::Probe(source, rank+1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
498  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
499  longRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
500 
501  SU2_MPI::Recv(longRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
502  source, rank+1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
503 
504  /* Idem for the message with doubles. */
505  SU2_MPI::Probe(source, rank+2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
506  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_DOUBLE, &sizeMess);
507  doubleRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
508 
509  SU2_MPI::Recv(doubleRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_DOUBLE,
510  source, rank+2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
511  }
512 
513  /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
514  SU2_MPI::Waitall(3*nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
515 
516  /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
517  so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
518  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
519 
520 #else
521 
522  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffers. ---*/
523  shortRecvBuf[0] = shortSendBuf[0];
524  longRecvBuf[0] = longSendBuf[0];
525  doubleRecvBuf[0] = doubleSendBuf[0];
526 
527 #endif
528 
529  /*--- Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all
530  the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. ---*/
531  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
532  vector<short>().swap(shortSendBuf[i]);
533  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
534  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleSendBuf[i]);
535  }
536 
537  /*--- Allocate the memory for the number of elements for every boundary
538  marker and initialize them to zero. ---*/
539  nElem_Bound = new unsigned long[nMarker];
540  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nMarker; ++i)
541  nElem_Bound[i] = 0;
542 
543  /*--- Determine the global element ID's of the elements stored on this rank.
544  Sort them in increasing order, such that an easy search can be done.
545  In the same loop determine the upper bound for the local nodes (without
546  halos) and the number of boundary elements for every marker. ---*/
547  nElem = nPoint = 0;
548  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) nElem += longRecvBuf[i][0];
549 
550  vector<unsigned long> globalElemID;
551  globalElemID.reserve(nElem);
552 
553  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
554  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0;
555  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
556  globalElemID.push_back(longRecvBuf[i][indL]);
557 
558  unsigned short nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
559  unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+5];
560  indS += 3*nFaces + 8;
561  indL += nDOFsGrid + nFaces + 2;
562  }
563 
564  long nNodesThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
565  nPoint += nNodesThisRank;
566  indL += nNodesThisRank+1;
567 
568  for(unsigned iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
569  long nBoundElemThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL]; ++indL;
570  nElem_Bound[iMarker] += nBoundElemThisRank;
571 
572  for(long j=0; j<nBoundElemThisRank; ++j) {
573  short nDOFsBoundElem = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+2];
574  short nDonorsWallFunction = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
575  indS += 4;
576  indL += nDOFsBoundElem + nDonorsWallFunction + 2;
577  }
578  }
579  }
580 
581  sort(globalElemID.begin(), globalElemID.end());
582 
583  /*--- Determine the global element ID's of the halo elements. A vector of
584  CUnsignedLong2T is used for this purpose, such that a possible periodic
585  transformation can be taken into account. Neighbors with a periodic
586  transformation will always become a halo element, even if the element
587  is stored on this rank. Furthermore a vector of CReorderElements
588  is created for the owned elements to be able to reorder the elements,
589  see step 2 below. ---*/
590  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> haloElements;
591  vector<CReorderElements> ownedElements;
592  unsigned short maxTimeLevelLoc = 0;
593 
594  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
595  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0;
596  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
597  unsigned long globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
598  unsigned short VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS];
599  unsigned short nPolySol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+2];
600  unsigned short nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
601  unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+5];
602  unsigned short timeLevel = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+6];
603  bool JacConstant = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS+7];
604  bool commSol = false;
605 
606  /* If the integration rule for constant and non-constant Jacobian
607  elements is the same, simply set JacConstant to false, such that
608  the elements with constant and non-constant Jacobians are
609  considered the same. */
610  if( JacConstant ) {
611  const unsigned short orderExactStraight =
612  (unsigned short) ceil(nPolySol*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Straight());
613  const unsigned short orderExactCurved =
614  (unsigned short) ceil(nPolySol*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Curved());
615  if(orderExactStraight == orderExactCurved) JacConstant = false;
616  }
617 
618  /* Update the local value of the maximum time level. */
619  maxTimeLevelLoc = max(maxTimeLevelLoc, timeLevel);
620 
621  /*--- Loop over the faces of this element to determine the halo elements
622  and the information needed to reorder the owned elements. ---*/
623  indS += 8;
624  indL += nDOFsGrid + 2;
625  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nFaces; ++k, indS+=3, ++indL) {
626 
627  if(longRecvBuf[i][indL] != -1) { /* -1 indicates a boundary face. */
628 
629  /* Check if the neighbor of the face is also an owned element.
630  Per definition an element for which a periodic transformation
631  is carried out, is a halo element, even if the parent element
632  is stored locally. */
633  bool neighborIsInternal = false;
634  if(shortRecvBuf[i][indS] == -1) { /* -1 indicates no periodic transformation. */
635  neighborIsInternal = binary_search(globalElemID.begin(),
636  globalElemID.end(),
637  longRecvBuf[i][indL]);
638  }
639 
640  /* Check if this neighbor is not internal and if the element owns the face. */
641  if( !neighborIsInternal ) {
642  if( shortRecvBuf[i][indS+2] ) {
643 
644  /* The face is owned by this element. As the neighboring element
645  is not owned, this implies that a halo element must be created. */
646  haloElements.push_back(CUnsignedLong2T(longRecvBuf[i][indL],
647  shortRecvBuf[i][indS]+1)); /* The +1, because haloElements */
648  } /* are unsigned longs. */
649  else {
650 
651  /* The face is not owned by this element and therefore it is owned
652  by the neighboring element on a different rank. Consequently the
653  solution of this element must be communicated. */
654  commSol = true;
655  }
656  }
657  }
658  }
659 
660  /* Store the required data for this element in ownedElements. */
661  ownedElements.push_back(CReorderElements(globalID, timeLevel, commSol,
662  VTK_Type, nPolySol, JacConstant));
663  }
664 
665  /* Skip the part with the node numbers. */
666  long nNodesThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
667  indL += nNodesThisRank+1;
668 
669  /* Loop over the boundary markers. */
670  for(unsigned iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
671  long nBoundElemThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL]; ++indL;
672 
673  /* Loop over the boundary elements coming from this rank. */
674  for(long j=0; j<nBoundElemThisRank; ++j) {
675  short nDOFsBoundElem = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+2];
676  short nDonorsWallFunctions = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
677  indS += 4;
678  indL += nDOFsBoundElem + 2;
679 
680  /* Loop over the donors for the wall functions. */
681  for(short k=0; k<nDonorsWallFunctions; ++k, ++indL) {
682 
683  /* Check for an external donor. If external, store it in
684  haloElements with no periodic transformation. */
685  if( !binary_search(globalElemID.begin(), globalElemID.end(),
686  longRecvBuf[i][indL]) )
687  haloElements.push_back(CUnsignedLong2T(longRecvBuf[i][indL], 0));
688  }
689  }
690  }
691  }
692 
693  /* Sort the halo elements in increasing order and remove the double entities. */
694  sort(haloElements.begin(), haloElements.end());
695  vector<CUnsignedLong2T>::iterator lastHalo = unique(haloElements.begin(), haloElements.end());
696  haloElements.erase(lastHalo, haloElements.end());
697 
698  /* Determine the maximum global time level and possibly reset the number
699  of time levels in config. */
700  unsigned short maxTimeLevelGlob = maxTimeLevelLoc;
701 
702 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
703  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&maxTimeLevelLoc, &maxTimeLevelGlob,
704  1, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MPI_MAX, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
705 #endif
706 
707  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = maxTimeLevelGlob+1;
708  config->SetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS(nTimeLevels);
709 
710  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
711  /*--- Step 2: Find out on which rank the halo elements are stored. ---*/
712  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
713 
714  /* Determine the number of owned elements and the total number of
715  elements stored on this rank. */
716  nVolElemOwned = globalElemID.size();
717  nVolElemTot = nVolElemOwned + haloElements.size();
718 
719  /* Determine the map from the global element ID to the current storage
720  sequence of ownedElements. */
721  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> mapGlobalElemIDToInd;
722  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
723  mapGlobalElemIDToInd[ownedElements[i].GetGlobalElemID()] = i;
724 
725  /* Determine the number of elements per rank of the originally partitioned grid
726  stored in cumulative storage format. */
727  vector<unsigned long> nElemPerRankOr(size+1);
728 
729  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) nElemPerRankOr[i] = geometry->beg_node[i];
730  nElemPerRankOr[size] = geometry->end_node[size-1];
731 
732  /* Determine to which ranks I have to send messages to find out the information
733  of the halos stored on this rank. */
734  sendToRank.assign(size, 0);
735 
736  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloElements.size(); ++i) {
737 
738  /* Determine the rank where this halo element was originally stored. */
739  vector<unsigned long>::iterator low;
740  low = lower_bound(nElemPerRankOr.begin(), nElemPerRankOr.end(),
741  haloElements[i].long0);
742  unsigned long rankHalo = low - nElemPerRankOr.begin();
743  if(*low > haloElements[i].long0) --rankHalo;
744 
745  sendToRank[rankHalo] = 1;
746  }
747 
748  rankToIndCommBuf.clear();
749  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
750  if( sendToRank[i] ) {
751  int ind = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
752  rankToIndCommBuf[i] = ind;
753  }
754  }
755 
756  /* Resize the first index of the long send buffers for the communication of
757  the halo data. */
758  nRankSend = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
759  longSendBuf.resize(nRankSend);
760 
761  /* Determine the number of ranks, from which this rank will receive elements. */
762  nRankRecv = nRankSend;
763 
764 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
765  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(),
766  MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
767 #endif
768 
769  /* Loop over the local halo elements to fill the communication buffers. */
770  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloElements.size(); ++i) {
771 
772  /* Determine the rank where this halo element was originally stored. */
773  vector<unsigned long>::iterator low;
774  low = lower_bound(nElemPerRankOr.begin(), nElemPerRankOr.end(),
775  haloElements[i].long0);
776  unsigned long ind = low - nElemPerRankOr.begin();
777  if(*low > haloElements[i].long0) --ind;
778 
779  /* Convert this rank to the index in the send buffer. */
780  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.find((int)ind);
781  ind = MI->second;
782 
783  /* Store the global element ID and the periodic index in the long buffer.
784  The subtraction of 1 is there to obtain the correct periodic index.
785  In haloElements a +1 is added, because this variable is of unsigned long,
786  which cannot handle negative numbers. */
787  long perIndex = haloElements[i].long1 -1;
788 
789  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(haloElements[i].long0);
790  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(perIndex);
791  }
792 
793  /* Define a second set of long receive buffers, because the information from
794  the first set is still needed later on. Also define the vector to
795  store the ranks from which the message came. */
796  vector<vector<long> > longSecondRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<long>(0));
797  vector<int> sourceRank(nRankRecv);
798 
799  /*--- Communicate the data to the correct ranks. Make a distinction
800  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
801 
802 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
803 
804  /* Parallel mode. Send all the data using non-blocking sends. */
805  commReqs.resize(nRankSend);
806  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
807 
808  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
809  int dest = MI->first;
810  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
811  dest, dest, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[i]);
812  }
813 
814  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data. */
815  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
816 
817  /* Block until a message with longs arrives from any processor.
818  Determine the source and the size of the message and receive it. */
819  SU2_MPI::Status status;
820  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
821  sourceRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
822 
823  int sizeMess;
824  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
825 
826  longSecondRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
827  SU2_MPI::Recv(longSecondRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
828  sourceRank[i], rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
829  }
830 
831  /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
832  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
833 
834 #else
835 
836  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffer, if present at all. ---*/
837  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i)
838  longSecondRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
839 
840 #endif
841 
842  /*--- Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all the memory
843  is deleted, the swap function is used. Afterwards resize the first index
844  of the send buffers to nRankRecv, because this number of messages must
845  be sent back to the sending ranks with halo information. ---*/
846  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
847  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
848  }
849 
850  longSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
851 
852 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
853  /* Resize the vector of the communication requests to the number of messages
854  to be sent by this rank. Only in parallel node. */
855  commReqs.resize(nRankRecv);
856 #endif
857 
858  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to fill and send the send buffers again. ---*/
859  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
860 
861  /* Determine the number of elements present in longSecondRecvBuf[i] and
862  reserve the memory for the send buffer. */
863  const long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size()/2;
864  longSendBuf[i].reserve(3*nElemBuf);
865 
866  /* Loop over the elements stored in the receive buffer. */
867  for(long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
868 
869  /* Get the global element ID and periodic index from the receive buffer. */
870  const long globalID = longSecondRecvBuf[i][2*j];
871  const long perInd = longSecondRecvBuf[i][2*j+1];
872 
873  /* Determine the local index of the element in the original partitioning.
874  Check if the index is valid. */
875  const long localID = globalID - geometry->beg_node[rank];
876  if(localID < 0 || localID >= (long) geometry->nPointLinear[rank]) {
877  ostringstream message;
878  message << localID << " " << geometry->nPointLinear[rank] << endl;
879  message << "Invalid local element ID";
880  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
881  }
882 
883  /* Determine which rank owns this element and store everything in the
884  send buffer. */
885  longSendBuf[i].push_back(globalID);
886  longSendBuf[i].push_back(perInd);
887  longSendBuf[i].push_back(geometry->elem[localID]->GetColor());
888  }
889 
890  /* Release the memory of this receive buffer. */
891  vector<long>().swap(longSecondRecvBuf[i]);
892 
893  /*--- Send the send buffer back to the calling rank.
894  Only in parallel mode of course. ---*/
895 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
896  int dest = sourceRank[i];
897  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
898  dest, dest+1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[i]);
899 #endif
900  }
901 
902  /*--- Resize the first index of the receive buffers to nRankSend, such that
903  the requested halo information can be received. ---*/
904  longSecondRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
905 
906  /*--- Receive the communication data from the correct ranks. Make a distinction
907  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
908 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
909 
910  /* Parallel mode. Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data
911  in the return communication, i.e. nRankSend. */
912  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
913 
914  /* Block until a message with longs arrives from any processor.
915  Determine the source and the size of the message. */
916  SU2_MPI::Status status;
917  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank+1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
918  int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
919 
920  int sizeMess;
921  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
922 
923  /* Allocate the memory for the long receive buffer and receive the message. */
924  longSecondRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
925  SU2_MPI::Recv(longSecondRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
926  source, rank+1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
927  }
928 
929  /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the ranks, because
930  wild cards have been used. */
931  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankRecv, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
932  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
933 
934 #else
935 
936  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffer, if present at all. ---*/
937  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i)
938  longSecondRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
939 
940 #endif
941 
942  /* Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all
943  the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. */
944  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i)
945  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
946 
947  /* Copy the data from the receive buffers into a class of CLong3T, such that
948  it can be sorted in increasing order. Note that the rank of the element
949  is stored first, followed by its global ID and last the periodic index. */
950  vector<CLong3T> haloData;
951  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
952  const long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size()/3;
953 
954  for(long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
955  const long j3 = 3*j;
956  haloData.push_back(CLong3T(longSecondRecvBuf[i][j3+2], longSecondRecvBuf[i][j3],
957  longSecondRecvBuf[i][j3+1]));
958  }
959 
960  /* Release the memory of this receive buffer. */
961  vector<long>().swap(longSecondRecvBuf[i]);
962  }
963 
964  /* Sort halo data in increasing order. */
965  sort(haloData.begin(), haloData.end());
966 
967  /* Determine the number of halo elements per rank in cumulative storage.
968  The first element of this vector is nVolElemOwned, such that this vector
969  contains the starting position in the vector volElem. */
970  vector<unsigned long> nHaloElemPerRank(size+1, 0);
971  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloData.size(); ++i)
972  ++nHaloElemPerRank[haloData[i].long0+1];
973 
974  nHaloElemPerRank[0] = nVolElemOwned;
975  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i)
976  nHaloElemPerRank[i+1] += nHaloElemPerRank[i];
977 
978  if(nHaloElemPerRank[size] != nVolElemTot)
979  SU2_MPI::Error("Inconsistency in total number of volume elements",
980  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
981 
982  /* Determine the number of ranks to which I have to send data in this cycle. */
983  sendToRank.assign(size, 0);
984  rankToIndCommBuf.clear();
985  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
986  if(nHaloElemPerRank[i+1] > nHaloElemPerRank[i]) {
987  sendToRank[i] = 1;
988  int ind = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
989  rankToIndCommBuf[i] = ind;
990  }
991  }
992 
993  nRankSend = (int)rankToIndCommBuf.size();
994 
995  /* Store the value of nRankSend for later use. */
996  const int nRankSendHaloInfo = nRankSend;
997 
998  /* Determine the number of ranks, from which this rank will receive elements. */
999  nRankRecv = nRankSend;
1000 
1001 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1002  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(),
1003  MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1004 #endif
1005 
1006  /* Copy the data to be sent to the send buffers. */
1007  longSendBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1008  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
1009 
1010  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
1011  int dest = MI->first;
1012  for(unsigned long j=nHaloElemPerRank[dest]; j<nHaloElemPerRank[dest+1]; ++j) {
1013  const unsigned long jj = j - nVolElemOwned;
1014  longSendBuf[i].push_back(haloData[jj].long1);
1015  longSendBuf[i].push_back(haloData[jj].long2);
1016  }
1017  }
1018 
1019  /* Resize the first index of the long receive buffer. */
1020  longSecondRecvBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1021 
1022  /*--- Communicate the data to the correct ranks. Make a distinction
1023  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
1024 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1025 
1026  /* Parallel mode. Send all the data using non-blocking sends. */
1027  commReqs.resize(nRankSend);
1028  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
1029 
1030  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
1031  int dest = MI->first;
1032  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
1033  dest, dest, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[i]);
1034  }
1035 
1036  /* Resize the vector to store the ranks from which the message came. */
1037  sourceRank.resize(nRankRecv);
1038 
1039  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data. */
1040  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1041 
1042  /* Block until a message with longs arrives from any processor.
1043  Determine the source and the size of the message and receive it. */
1044  SU2_MPI::Status status;
1045  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1046  sourceRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1047 
1048  int sizeMess;
1049  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
1050 
1051  longSecondRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1052  SU2_MPI::Recv(longSecondRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
1053  sourceRank[i], rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1054  }
1055 
1056  /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the ranks,
1057  because wild cards have been used. */
1058  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1059  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1060 
1061 #else
1062 
1063  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffer, if present at all. ---*/
1064  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i)
1065  longSecondRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
1066 
1067 #endif
1068 
1069  /* Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all the memory
1070  is deleted, the swap function is used. */
1071  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1072  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
1073  }
1074 
1075  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to flag the locally owned elements for
1076  communication. Although the face information has already been used to
1077  do this when ownedElements are constructed, elements that are donors
1078  for the wall function treatment and are not direct neighbors may
1079  have been missed. ---*/
1080  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1081 
1082  const unsigned long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size()/2;
1083  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
1084  const unsigned long elemID = longSecondRecvBuf[i][2*j];
1085 
1086  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(elemID);
1087  if(MMI == mapGlobalElemIDToInd.end())
1088  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapGlobalElemIDToInd", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1089 
1090  ownedElements[MMI->second].SetCommSolution(true);
1091  }
1092  }
1093 
1094  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1095  /*--- Step 3: Determine the numbering of the owned elements. The following ---*/
1096  /*--- criteria are used for the owned elements. ---*/
1097  /*--- - Time level of the element: elements with the smallest time ---*/
1098  /*--- level are number first, etc. ---*/
1099  /*--- - For each time level the elements that do not need to send ---*/
1100  /*--- their data are numbered first, followed by the elements ---*/
1101  /*--- that must send their data to other ranks. Note that not ---*/
1102  /*--- sending the solution does not mean that the residual can ---*/
1103  /*--- be built without communication. It is possible that a face ---*/
1104  /*--- is owned by a local element, but it is adjacent to an ---*/
1105  /*--- element owned by a different rank. In that case the data ---*/
1106  /*--- from the neighboring element is communicated and stored in ---*/
1107  /*--- a halo element. However, the residual of these internal ---*/
1108  /*--- elements do not receive a contribution computed on a ---*/
1109  /*--- different rank. ---*/
1110  /*--- - Some of the elements that do not need to send their data ---*/
1111  /*--- to other ranks may still be put in that part to increase ---*/
1112  /*--- the efficiency when treating element simultaneously, see ---*/
1113  /*--- next point. ---*/
1114  /*--- - Elements of the same type are put contiguously in memory ---*/
1115  /*--- as much as possible to facilitate the simultaneous ---*/
1116  /*--- treatment in the matrix multiplications to increase ---*/
1117  /*--- performance. ---*/
1118  /*--- - A reverse Cuthill McKee renumbering takes place to obtain ---*/
1119  /*--- better cache performance for the face residuals. ---*/
1120  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1121 
1122  /* Determine the number of elements/faces that are treated simultaneously */
1123  /* in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
1124  const unsigned short nElemSimul = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding()/nVar;
1125 
1126  /* Determine the number of different element types present. */
1127  map<unsigned short, unsigned short> mapElemTypeToInd;
1128  for(vector<CReorderElements>::iterator OEI =ownedElements.begin();
1129  OEI!=ownedElements.end(); ++OEI) {
1130  const unsigned short elType = OEI->GetElemType();
1131 
1132  if(mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType) == mapElemTypeToInd.end()) {
1133  const unsigned short ind = mapElemTypeToInd.size();
1134  mapElemTypeToInd[elType] = ind;
1135  }
1136  }
1137 
1138  /* Determine the number of elements per element type per time level.
1139  Make a distinction between internal elements (elements that are not
1140  communicated) and elements that are communicated. Later on these vectors
1141  will be put in cumulative storage format, which explains the +1 for
1142  the second index. */
1143  vector<vector<unsigned long> > nInternalElem(nTimeLevels,
1144  vector<unsigned long>(mapElemTypeToInd.size()+1));
1145  vector<vector<unsigned long> > nCommElem(nTimeLevels,
1146  vector<unsigned long>(mapElemTypeToInd.size()+1));
1147  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
1148  {
1149  for(unsigned long j=0; j<=mapElemTypeToInd.size(); ++j) {
1150  nInternalElem[i][j] = 0;
1151  nCommElem[i][j] = 0;
1152  }
1153  }
1154 
1155  for(vector<CReorderElements>::iterator OEI =ownedElements.begin();
1156  OEI!=ownedElements.end(); ++OEI) {
1157  const unsigned short elType = OEI->GetElemType();
1158  map<unsigned short, unsigned short>::const_iterator MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1159  unsigned short ind = MI->second +1;
1160 
1161  if( OEI->GetCommSolution() )
1162  ++nCommElem[OEI->GetTimeLevel()][ind];
1163  else
1164  ++nInternalElem[OEI->GetTimeLevel()][ind];
1165  }
1166 
1167  /* Loop again over the owned elements and check if elements, which do not
1168  have to send their solution, should be flagged as such in order to improve
1169  the gemm performance. */
1170  for(vector<CReorderElements>::iterator OEI =ownedElements.begin();
1171  OEI!=ownedElements.end(); ++OEI) {
1172 
1173  /* Check for an internal element, i.e. an element for which the solution
1174  does not need to be communicated. */
1175  if( !OEI->GetCommSolution() ) {
1176 
1177  /* Determine the time level and the index of the element type. */
1178  const unsigned short tLev = OEI->GetTimeLevel();
1179 
1180  const unsigned short elType = OEI->GetElemType();
1181  map<unsigned short, unsigned short>::const_iterator MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1182  const unsigned short ind = MI->second +1;
1183 
1184  /* Determine whether or not this element must be moved from internal to
1185  comm elements to improve performance. Change the appropriate data
1186  when this must happen. */
1187  if(nInternalElem[tLev][ind]%nElemSimul && nCommElem[tLev][ind]%nElemSimul) {
1188  OEI->SetCommSolution(true);
1189  --nInternalElem[tLev][ind];
1190  ++nCommElem[tLev][ind];
1191  }
1192  }
1193  }
1194 
1195  /* Check whether there are enough elements in every partition for every
1196  time level to guarantee a good gemm performance. */
1197  unsigned long nFullChunks = 0, nPartialChunks = 0;
1198  for(unsigned short tLev=0; tLev<nTimeLevels; ++tLev) {
1199  for(unsigned long j=1; j<nInternalElem[tLev].size(); ++j) {
1200  nFullChunks += nInternalElem[tLev][j]/nElemSimul;
1201  if(nInternalElem[tLev][j]%nElemSimul) ++nPartialChunks;
1202  }
1203 
1204  for(unsigned long j=1; j<nCommElem[tLev].size(); ++j) {
1205  nFullChunks += nCommElem[tLev][j]/nElemSimul;
1206  if(nCommElem[tLev][j]%nElemSimul) ++nPartialChunks;
1207  }
1208  }
1209 
1210  unsigned long tooManyPartChunksLoc = 0;
1211  if(5*nPartialChunks >= (nPartialChunks+nFullChunks)) tooManyPartChunksLoc = 1;
1212 
1213  /* Determine the number of ranks which contain too many partial chunks.
1214  The result only needs to be known on the master node. */
1215  unsigned long nRanksTooManyPartChunks = tooManyPartChunksLoc;
1216 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1217  SU2_MPI::Reduce(&tooManyPartChunksLoc, &nRanksTooManyPartChunks, 1,
1218  MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1219 #endif
1220 
1221  if((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (nRanksTooManyPartChunks != 0) && (size > 1)) {
1222  cout << endl << " WARNING" << endl;
1223  cout << "There are " << nRanksTooManyPartChunks << " partitions for which "
1224  << " the simultaneous treatment of volume elements is not optimal." << endl;
1225  cout << "This could lead to a significant load imbalance." << endl;
1226  }
1227 
1228  /* Put nInternalElem and nCommElem in cumulative storage format. */
1229  for(unsigned short tLev=0; tLev<nTimeLevels; ++tLev) {
1230  if( tLev ) nInternalElem[tLev][0] = nCommElem[tLev-1].back();
1231  for(unsigned long j=1; j<nInternalElem[tLev].size(); ++j)
1232  nInternalElem[tLev][j] += nInternalElem[tLev][j-1];
1233 
1234  nCommElem[tLev][0] = nInternalElem[tLev].back();
1235  for(unsigned long j=1; j<nCommElem[tLev].size(); ++j)
1236  nCommElem[tLev][j] += nCommElem[tLev][j-1];
1237  }
1238 
1239  /* In the solver only the number of elements per time level is needed.
1240  The number of owned elements, nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel, is stored in
1241  cumulative storage format and can be retrieved easily from nCommElem.
1242  The number of internal elements per time level is stored normally and
1243  can be retrieved from nInternalElem. */
1244  nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels+1);
1245  nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
1246 
1247  nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0] = 0;
1248  for(unsigned short tLev=0; tLev<nTimeLevels; ++tLev) {
1249  nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[tLev+1] = nCommElem[tLev].back();
1250  nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[tLev] = nInternalElem[tLev].back()
1251  - nInternalElem[tLev][0];
1252  }
1253 
1254  /* Sort the elements of ownedElements in increasing order. */
1255  sort(ownedElements.begin(), ownedElements.end());
1256 
1257  /* At the moment the elements are sorted per time level and element type. */
1258  /* This is in principle enough to make to code work with the simultaneous */
1259  /* treatment for volume elements. Below follows a renumbering within the */
1260  /* time level and element type (Reverse Cuthill-McKee), such that a better */
1261  /* cache performance is obtained for the surface elements. For high order */
1262  /* elements this effect is probably marginal. */
1263 
1264  /* Determine the map from the global element ID to the current storage
1265  sequence of ownedElements. */
1266  mapGlobalElemIDToInd.clear();
1267  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
1268  mapGlobalElemIDToInd[ownedElements[i].GetGlobalElemID()] = i;
1269 
1270  /*--- Create the graph of local elements. The halo elements are ignored. ---*/
1271  vector<vector<unsigned long> > neighElem(nVolElemOwned, vector<unsigned long>(0));
1272 
1273  nRankRecv = (int) longRecvBuf.size();
1274  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1275  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0;
1276  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1277  unsigned long globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
1278  unsigned short nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
1279  unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+5];
1280 
1281  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(globalID);
1282  unsigned long ind = MMI->second;
1283 
1284  indS += 8;
1285  indL += nDOFsGrid + 2;
1286  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nFaces; ++k, indS+=3, ++indL) {
1287  if((longRecvBuf[i][indL] != -1) && (shortRecvBuf[i][indS] == -1)) { // Check for internal owned node.
1288 
1289  MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(longRecvBuf[i][indL]);
1290  if(MMI != mapGlobalElemIDToInd.end()) neighElem[ind].push_back(MMI->second);
1291  }
1292  }
1293  }
1294  }
1295 
1296  /* Sort the neighbors of each element in increasing order. */
1297  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
1298  sort(neighElem[i].begin(), neighElem[i].end());
1299 
1300  /* Define the vector, which contains the new numbering of the owned elements
1301  w.r.t. to the numbering currently stored in ownedElements. Note that signed
1302  longs are used for this purpose, because the vector is initialized with -1
1303  to indicate that no new number has been assigned yet. */
1304  vector<long> oldElemToNewElem(nVolElemOwned, -1);
1305 
1306  /*--- While loop to carry out the renumbering. A while loop is present,
1307  because the local partition may not be contiguous. ---*/
1308  unsigned long nElemRenumbered = 0;
1309  while (nElemRenumbered < nVolElemOwned) {
1310 
1311  /* Determine the first element in the list that has not been renumbered. */
1312  unsigned long indBeg;
1313  for(indBeg=0; indBeg<nVolElemOwned; ++indBeg)
1314  if(oldElemToNewElem[indBeg] == -1) break;
1315 
1316  /* Determine the time level and element type of the element indBeg and
1317  determine the element range in which the starting element for the
1318  renumbering must be sought. */
1319  unsigned short timeLevel = ownedElements[indBeg].GetTimeLevel();
1320  unsigned short elType = ownedElements[indBeg].GetElemType();
1321 
1322  map<unsigned short, unsigned short>::const_iterator MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1323  unsigned short ind = MI->second;
1324 
1325  unsigned long indEnd;
1326  if( ownedElements[indBeg].GetCommSolution() )
1327  indEnd = nCommElem[timeLevel][ind+1];
1328  else
1329  indEnd = nInternalElem[timeLevel][ind+1];
1330 
1331  /* Determine the element in the range [indBeg,indEnd) with the least number
1332  of neighbors that has not been renumbered yet. This is the starting
1333  element for the current renumbering round. */
1334  for(unsigned long i=(indBeg+1); i<indEnd; ++i) {
1335  if((oldElemToNewElem[i] == -1) &&
1336  (neighElem[i].size() < neighElem[indBeg].size())) indBeg = i;
1337  }
1338 
1339  /* Start of the Reverse Cuthil McKee renumbering. */
1340  vector<unsigned long> frontElements(1, indBeg);
1341  while( frontElements.size() ) {
1342 
1343  /* Vector, which stores the front for the next round. */
1344  vector<unsigned long> frontElementsNew;
1345 
1346  /* Loop over the elements of the current front. */
1347  for(unsigned long i=0; i<frontElements.size(); ++i) {
1348 
1349  /* Carry out the renumbering for this element. */
1350  const unsigned long iFront = frontElements[i];
1351 
1352  timeLevel = ownedElements[iFront].GetTimeLevel();
1353  elType = ownedElements[iFront].GetElemType();
1354  MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1355  ind = MI->second;
1356 
1357  if( ownedElements[iFront].GetCommSolution() )
1358  oldElemToNewElem[iFront] = nCommElem[timeLevel][ind]++;
1359  else
1360  oldElemToNewElem[iFront] = nInternalElem[timeLevel][ind]++;
1361 
1362  /* Store the neighbors that have not been renumbered yet in the front
1363  for the next round. Set its index to -2 to indicate that the element
1364  is already on the new front. */
1365  for(unsigned long j=0; j<neighElem[iFront].size(); ++j) {
1366  if(oldElemToNewElem[neighElem[iFront][j]] == -1) {
1367  frontElementsNew.push_back(neighElem[iFront][j]);
1368  oldElemToNewElem[neighElem[iFront][j]] = -2;
1369  }
1370  }
1371  }
1372 
1373  /* Update the counter nElemRenumbered. */
1374  nElemRenumbered += frontElements.size();
1375 
1376  /* Sort frontElementsNew in increasing order. */
1377  sort(frontElementsNew.begin(), frontElementsNew.end());
1378 
1379  /* Store the new front elements in frontElements for the next round. */
1380  frontElements = frontElementsNew;
1381  }
1382  }
1383 
1384  if(nElemRenumbered != nVolElemOwned)
1385  SU2_MPI::Error("Something went wrong in the renumbering", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1386 
1387  /* Determine the final mapping from the global element number to the local
1388  entry for the owned elements. First clear mapGlobalElemIDToInd before
1389  it can be used to store its correct content. */
1390  mapGlobalElemIDToInd.clear();
1391  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
1392  mapGlobalElemIDToInd[ownedElements[i].GetGlobalElemID()] = oldElemToNewElem[i];
1393 
1394  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1395  /*--- Step 4: Store the elements, nodes and boundary elements in the data ---*/
1396  /*--- structures used by the FEM solver. ---*/
1397  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1398 
1399  /*--- Check in parallel mode for empty partitions. If present, print a warning.
1400  The solver is capable of handling empty partitions, but it may not be
1401  efficient. ---*/
1402 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1403  unsigned long thisPartitionEmpty = nVolElemOwned ? 0 : 1;
1404  unsigned long nEmptyPartitions = 0;
1405 
1406  SU2_MPI::Reduce(&thisPartitionEmpty, &nEmptyPartitions, 1,
1407  MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1408 
1409  if(rank == MASTER_NODE && nEmptyPartitions) {
1410  cout << endl << " WARNING" << endl;
1411  cout << "There are " << nEmptyPartitions << " empty partitions present." << endl;
1412  cout << "SU2 is able to handle this, but it may be inefficient." << endl << endl;
1413  }
1414 #endif
1415 
1416  /*--- Allocate the memory for the volume elements, the nodes
1417  and the surface elements of the boundaries. ---*/
1418  volElem.resize(nVolElemTot);
1419  meshPoints.reserve(nPoint);
1420 
1421  boundaries.resize(nMarker);
1422  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1423  boundaries[iMarker].markerTag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
1424  boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary = config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == PERIODIC_BOUNDARY;
1425  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.reserve(nElem_Bound[iMarker]);
1426  }
1427 
1428  /*--- Copy the data from the communication buffers. ---*/
1429  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1430 
1431  /* The data for the volume elements. Loop over these elements in the buffer. */
1432  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0, indD = 0;
1433  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1434 
1435  /* Determine the location in volElem where this data must be stored. */
1436  unsigned long elemID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1437  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(elemID);
1438  unsigned long ind = MMI->second;
1439 
1440  /* Store the data. */
1441  volElem[ind].elemIsOwned = true;
1442  volElem[ind].rankOriginal = rank;
1443  volElem[ind].periodIndexToDonor = -1;
1444 
1445  volElem[ind].VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1446  volElem[ind].nPolyGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1447  volElem[ind].nPolySol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1448  volElem[ind].nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1449  volElem[ind].nDOFsSol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1450  volElem[ind].nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1451  volElem[ind].timeLevel = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1452 
1453  volElem[ind].JacIsConsideredConstant = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1454 
1455  volElem[ind].elemIDGlobal = elemID;
1456  volElem[ind].offsetDOFsSolGlobal = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1457 
1458  volElem[ind].nodeIDsGrid.resize(volElem[ind].nDOFsGrid);
1459  volElem[ind].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant.resize(volElem[ind].nFaces);
1460  volElem[ind].ElementOwnsFaces.resize(volElem[ind].nFaces);
1461 
1462  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[ind].nDOFsGrid; ++k)
1463  volElem[ind].nodeIDsGrid[k] = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1464 
1465  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[ind].nFaces; ++k) {
1466  long neighBorID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1467 
1468  ++indS; // At this location the periodic index of the face is stored in
1469  // shortRecvBuf, which is not stored in volElem.
1470  volElem[ind].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[k] = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1471  volElem[ind].ElementOwnsFaces[k] = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1472 
1473  if(neighBorID == -1)
1474  volElem[ind].ElementOwnsFaces[k] = true; // Boundary faces are always owned.
1475  }
1476 
1477  volElem[ind].lenScale = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1478  }
1479 
1480  /* The data for the nodes. Loop over these nodes in the buffer and store
1481  them in meshPoints. */
1482  unsigned long nNodesThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1483  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nNodesThisRank; ++j) {
1484  CPointFEM thisPoint;
1485  thisPoint.globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1486  thisPoint.periodIndexToDonor = -1;
1487  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDim; ++k)
1488  thisPoint.coor[k] = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1489 
1490  meshPoints.push_back(thisPoint);
1491  }
1492 
1493  /* The data for the boundary markers. Loop over them. */
1494  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1495 
1496  unsigned long nElemThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1497  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nElemThisRank; ++j) {
1498  CSurfaceElementFEM thisSurfElem;
1499 
1500  thisSurfElem.VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1501  thisSurfElem.nPolyGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1502  thisSurfElem.nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1503  const short nDonors = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1504 
1505  thisSurfElem.volElemID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1506  thisSurfElem.boundElemIDGlobal = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1507 
1508  thisSurfElem.nodeIDsGrid.resize(thisSurfElem.nDOFsGrid);
1509  for(unsigned short k=0; k<thisSurfElem.nDOFsGrid; ++k)
1510  thisSurfElem.nodeIDsGrid[k] = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1511 
1512  indL += nDonors;
1513 
1514  /* Convert the global volume element ID to the local one.
1515  It is essential to do this before the sorting. */
1516  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI;
1517  MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(thisSurfElem.volElemID);
1518  thisSurfElem.volElemID = MMI->second;
1519 
1520  /* Store the surface element in the data structure for this boundary. */
1521  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.push_back(thisSurfElem);
1522  }
1523  }
1524  }
1525 
1526  /* Sort meshPoints in increasing order and remove the double entities. */
1527  sort(meshPoints.begin(), meshPoints.end());
1528  vector<CPointFEM>::iterator lastPoint = unique(meshPoints.begin(), meshPoints.end());
1529  meshPoints.erase(lastPoint, meshPoints.end());
1530 
1531  /* Clear the contents of the map globalPointIDToLocalInd and fill
1532  it with the information present in meshPoints. */
1533  globalPointIDToLocalInd.clear();
1534  for(unsigned long i=0; i<meshPoints.size(); ++i)
1535  globalPointIDToLocalInd[meshPoints[i].globalID] = i;
1536 
1537  /*--- All the data from the receive buffers has been copied in the local
1538  data structures. Release the memory of the receive buffers. To make
1539  sure that all the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. ---*/
1540  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1541  vector<short>().swap(shortRecvBuf[i]);
1542  vector<long>().swap(longRecvBuf[i]);
1543  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleRecvBuf[i]);
1544  }
1545 
1546  /*--- Sort the surface elements of the boundaries in increasing order. ---*/
1547  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker)
1548  sort(boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.begin(), boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.end());
1549 
1550  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1551  /*--- Step 5: Obtain the information of the halo elements, which are ---*/
1552  /*--- sorted per time level and afterwards per rank, where the ---*/
1553  /*--- sequence is determined by the numbering on the sending rank. ---*/
1554  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1555 
1556  /*--- Resize the first index of the send buffers to nRankRecv, because this
1557  number of messages must be sent back to the sending ranks with halo
1558  information. ---*/
1559  nRankRecv = (int) longSecondRecvBuf.size();
1560  shortSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1561  longSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1562  doubleSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1563 
1564 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1565  /* Resize the vector of the communication requests to the number of messages
1566  to be sent by this rank. Only in parallel node. */
1567  commReqs.resize(3*nRankRecv);
1568 #endif
1569 
1570  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to fill the send buffers again. ---*/
1571  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1572 
1573  /* Loop over the elements in this receive buffer to determine the local
1574  index on this rank. Note that also the periodic index must be stored,
1575  hence use an CUnsignedLong2T for this purpose. As -1 cannot be stored
1576  for an unsigned long a 1 is added to the periodic transformation. */
1577  const unsigned long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size()/2;
1578  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> elemBuf(nElemBuf);
1579 
1580  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
1581  const unsigned long j2 = 2*j;
1582 
1583  const unsigned long elemID = longSecondRecvBuf[i][j2];
1584  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(elemID);
1585  if(MMI == mapGlobalElemIDToInd.end())
1586  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapGlobalElemIDToInd", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1587 
1588  elemBuf[j].long0 = MMI->second;
1589  elemBuf[j].long1 = longSecondRecvBuf[i][j2+1] + 1;
1590  }
1591 
1592  /* Release the memory of the long receive buffer via the swap function
1593  and sort elemBuf in increasing order. */
1594  vector<long>().swap(longSecondRecvBuf[i]);
1595 
1596  sort(elemBuf.begin(), elemBuf.end());
1597 
1598  /* Store the number of elements in the first element of the long send buffer. */
1599  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nElemBuf);
1600 
1601  /* Vector with node IDs that must be returned to this calling rank.
1602  Note that also the periodic index must be stored, hence use an
1603  CUnsignedLong2T for this purpose. */
1604  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> nodeIDs;
1605 
1606  /* Loop over the elements to fill the send buffers. */
1607  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
1608 
1609  /* Store the global element ID in the long buffer,
1610  the periodic index in the short send buffer and
1611  the length scale in the double send buffer. */
1612  const unsigned long indV = elemBuf[j].long0;
1613  longSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].elemIDGlobal);
1614 
1615  const short perIndex = (short) elemBuf[j].long1 -1; // Note the -1.
1616  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(perIndex);
1617 
1618  doubleSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].lenScale);
1619 
1620  /* Store the other relevant information of this element in the short
1621  and long communication buffers. Also store the node IDs and the
1622  periodic transformation in nodeIDs. */
1623  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].VTK_Type);
1624  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nPolyGrid);
1625  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nPolySol);
1626  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid);
1627  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nDOFsSol);
1628  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nFaces);
1629  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].timeLevel);
1630 
1631  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid; ++k) {
1632  longSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid[k]);
1633  nodeIDs.push_back(CUnsignedLong2T(volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid[k],
1634  elemBuf[j].long1));
1635  }
1636 
1637  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[indV].nFaces; ++k)
1638  shortSendBuf[i].push_back((short) volElem[indV].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[k]);
1639  }
1640 
1641  /* Sort nodeIDs in increasing order and remove the double entities. */
1642  sort(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
1643  vector<CUnsignedLong2T>::iterator lastNodeID = unique(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
1644  nodeIDs.erase(lastNodeID, nodeIDs.end());
1645 
1646  /* Add the number of node IDs and the node IDs itself to longSendBuf[i]
1647  and the periodix index to shortSendBuf. Note again the -1 for the
1648  periodic index, because an unsigned long cannot represent -1, the
1649  value for the periodic index when no peridicity is present. */
1650  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nodeIDs.size());
1651  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nodeIDs.size(); ++j) {
1652  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nodeIDs[j].long0);
1653  shortSendBuf[i].push_back( (short) nodeIDs[j].long1-1);
1654  }
1655 
1656  /*--- Copy the coordinates to doubleSendBuf. ---*/
1657  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nodeIDs.size(); ++j) {
1658  map<unsigned long,unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
1659  LMI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(nodeIDs[j].long0);
1660 
1661  if(LMI == globalPointIDToLocalInd.end())
1662  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in map", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1663 
1664  unsigned long ind = LMI->second;
1665  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nDim; ++l)
1666  doubleSendBuf[i].push_back(meshPoints[ind].coor[l]);
1667  }
1668 
1669  /*--- Send the communication buffers back to the calling rank.
1670  Only in parallel mode of course. ---*/
1671 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1672  int dest = sourceRank[i];
1673  SU2_MPI::Isend(shortSendBuf[i].data(), shortSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_SHORT,
1674  dest, dest+1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[3*i]);
1675  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
1676  dest, dest+2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[3*i+1]);
1677  SU2_MPI::Isend(doubleSendBuf[i].data(), doubleSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
1678  dest, dest+3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[3*i+2]);
1679 #endif
1680  }
1681 
1682  /*--- Resize the first index of the receive buffers to nRankSendHaloInfo,
1683  such that the requested halo information can be received. ---*/
1684  nRankSend = nRankSendHaloInfo;
1685  shortRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1686  longRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1687  doubleRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1688 
1689  /* Resize the vector to store the ranks from which the message came. */
1690  sourceRank.resize(nRankSend);
1691 
1692  /*--- Receive the communication data from the correct ranks. Make a distinction
1693  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
1694 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1695 
1696  /* Parallel mode. Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data
1697  in the return communication, i.e. nRankSend. */
1698  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1699 
1700  /* Block until a message with shorts arrives from any processor.
1701  Determine the source and the size of the message. */
1702  SU2_MPI::Status status;
1703  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank+1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1704  sourceRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1705 
1706  int sizeMess;
1707  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_SHORT, &sizeMess);
1708 
1709  /* Allocate the memory for the short receive buffer and receive the message. */
1710  shortRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1711  SU2_MPI::Recv(shortRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_SHORT,
1712  sourceRank[i], rank+1, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1713 
1714  /* Block until the corresponding message with longs arrives, determine
1715  its size, allocate the memory and receive the message. */
1716  SU2_MPI::Probe(sourceRank[i], rank+2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1717  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
1718  longRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1719 
1720  SU2_MPI::Recv(longRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
1721  sourceRank[i], rank+2, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1722 
1723  /* Idem for the message with doubles. */
1724  SU2_MPI::Probe(sourceRank[i], rank+3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1725  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_DOUBLE, &sizeMess);
1726  doubleRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1727 
1728  SU2_MPI::Recv(doubleRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_DOUBLE,
1729  sourceRank[i], rank+3, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
1730  }
1731 
1732  /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
1733  SU2_MPI::Waitall(3*nRankRecv, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1734 
1735  /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
1736  so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
1737  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
1738 
1739 #else
1740 
1741  /* Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffers. Note that nRankSend is at most 1. */
1742  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1743  sourceRank[i] = i;
1744  shortRecvBuf[i] = shortSendBuf[i];
1745  longRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
1746  doubleRecvBuf[i] = doubleSendBuf[i];
1747  }
1748 
1749 #endif
1750 
1751  /*--- Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all
1752  the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. ---*/
1753  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1754  vector<short>().swap(shortSendBuf[i]);
1755  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
1756  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleSendBuf[i]);
1757  }
1758 
1759  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1760  /*--- Step 6: Build the layer of halo elements from the information in the ---*/
1761  /*--- receive buffers shortRecvBuf, longRecvBuf and doubleRecvBuf. ---*/
1762  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1763 
1764  /*--- The halo elements must be sorted first based on the time level, followed
1765  by the rank and finally the index in the receive buffers (which represents
1766  the sequence on the sending rank. This sorting can be accomplished by
1767  using a vector of CLong3T. The contents of this vector is build below. ---*/
1768  vector<CLong3T> haloElemInfo;
1769  haloElemInfo.reserve(nVolElemTot - nVolElemOwned);
1770 
1771  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1772  unsigned long indS = 0;
1773 
1774  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1775  const unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+6];
1776  haloElemInfo.push_back(CLong3T(shortRecvBuf[i][indS+7], sourceRank[i], j));
1777  indS += nFaces + 8;
1778  }
1779  }
1780 
1781  sort(haloElemInfo.begin(), haloElemInfo.end());
1782 
1783  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to store the information of the
1784  halo elements and the halo points. ---*/
1785  vector<CPointFEM> haloPoints;
1786  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1787 
1788  /* Initialization of the indices in the communication buffers. */
1789  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0, indD = 0;
1790 
1791  /* Loop over the halo elements received from this rank. */
1792  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1793 
1794  /* Create an object of CLong3T and search for its position
1795  in haloElemInfo to determine the index in volElem, where
1796  this element is stored. */
1797  CLong3T thisElem(shortRecvBuf[i][indS+7], sourceRank[i], j);
1798  vector<CLong3T>::iterator low;
1799  low = lower_bound(haloElemInfo.begin(), haloElemInfo.end(), thisElem);
1800 
1801  unsigned long indV = low - haloElemInfo.begin();
1802  indV += nVolElemOwned;
1803 
1804  /* Retrieve the data from the communication buffers. */
1805  volElem[indV].elemIDGlobal = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1806  volElem[indV].rankOriginal = sourceRank[i];
1807 
1808  volElem[indV].periodIndexToDonor = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1809  volElem[indV].VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1810  volElem[indV].nPolyGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1811  volElem[indV].nPolySol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1812  volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1813  volElem[indV].nDOFsSol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1814  volElem[indV].nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1815  volElem[indV].timeLevel = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1816 
1817  volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid.resize(volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid);
1818  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid; ++k)
1819  volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid[k] = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1820 
1821  volElem[indV].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant.resize(volElem[indV].nFaces);
1822  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[indV].nFaces; ++k)
1823  volElem[indV].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[k] = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1824 
1825  /* Give the member variables that are not obtained via communication their
1826  values. Some of these variables are not used for halo elements. */
1827  volElem[indV].elemIsOwned = false;
1828  volElem[indV].JacIsConsideredConstant = false;
1829  volElem[indV].offsetDOFsSolGlobal = ULONG_MAX;
1830 
1831  /* Halo elements do not own a face per definition. */
1832  volElem[indV].ElementOwnsFaces.assign(volElem[indV].nFaces, false);
1833 
1834  /* Get the length scale from the double receive buffer.*/
1835  volElem[indV].lenScale = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1836  }
1837 
1838  /* Store the information of the points in haloPoints. */
1839  const long nPointsThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1840  for(long j=0; j<nPointsThisRank; ++j) {
1841  CPointFEM thisPoint;
1842  thisPoint.globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1843  thisPoint.periodIndexToDonor = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1844  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nDim; ++l)
1845  thisPoint.coor[l] = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1846 
1847  haloPoints.push_back(thisPoint);
1848  }
1849 
1850  /* The communication buffers from this rank are not needed anymore.
1851  Delete them using the swap function. */
1852  vector<short>().swap(shortRecvBuf[i]);
1853  vector<long>().swap(longRecvBuf[i]);
1854  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleRecvBuf[i]);
1855  }
1856 
1857  /* Remove the duplicate entries from haloPoints. */
1858  sort(haloPoints.begin(), haloPoints.end());
1859  lastPoint = unique(haloPoints.begin(), haloPoints.end());
1860  haloPoints.erase(lastPoint, haloPoints.end());
1861 
1862  /* Initialization of some variables to sort the halo points. */
1863  Global_nPoint = geometry->GetGlobal_nPoint();
1864  unsigned long InvalidPointID = Global_nPoint + 10;
1865  short InvalidPerInd = SHRT_MAX;
1866 
1867  /*--- Search for the nonperiodic halo points in the local points to see
1868  if these points are already stored on this rank. If this is the
1869  case invalidate this halo and decrease the number of halo points.
1870  Afterwards remove the invalid halos from the vector. ---*/
1871  unsigned long nHaloPoints = haloPoints.size();
1872  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloPoints.size(); ++i) {
1873  if(haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor != -1) break; // Test for nonperiodic.
1874 
1875  if( binary_search(meshPoints.begin(), meshPoints.end(), haloPoints[i]) ) {
1876  haloPoints[i].globalID = InvalidPointID;
1877  haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor = InvalidPerInd;
1878  --nHaloPoints;
1879  }
1880  }
1881 
1882  sort(haloPoints.begin(), haloPoints.end());
1883  haloPoints.resize(nHaloPoints);
1884
