1885  /* Increase the capacity of meshPoints, such that the halo points can be
1886  stored in there as well. Note that in case periodic points are present
1887  this is an upper bound. Add the non-periodic halo points to meshPoints. */
1888  meshPoints.reserve(meshPoints.size() + nHaloPoints);
1889 
1890  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloPoints.size(); ++i) {
1891  if(haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor != -1) break; // Test for nonperiodic.
1892 
1893  meshPoints.push_back(haloPoints[i]);
1894  }
1895 
1896  /* Create a map from the global point ID and periodic index to the local
1897  index in the vector meshPoints. First store the points already present
1898  in meshPoints. */
1899  map<CUnsignedLong2T, unsigned long> mapGlobalPointIDToInd;
1900  for(unsigned long i=0; i<meshPoints.size(); ++i) {
1901  CUnsignedLong2T globIndAndPer;
1902  globIndAndPer.long0 = meshPoints[i].globalID;
1903  globIndAndPer.long1 = meshPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor+1; // Note the +1 again.
1904 
1905  mapGlobalPointIDToInd[globIndAndPer] = i;
1906  }
1907 
1908  /*--- Convert the global indices in the boundary connectivities to local ones.
1909  Note that the volume ID's already contain the local number. ---*/
1910  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1911  for(unsigned long i=0; i<boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size(); ++i) {
1912 
1913  /* Convert the global node ID's to local values. Note that for these node
1914  ID's no periodic transformation can be present. */
1915  for(unsigned short j=0; j<boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[i].nDOFsGrid; ++j) {
1916  CUnsignedLong2T searchItem(boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j], 0);
1917  map<CUnsignedLong2T, unsigned long>::const_iterator LLMI;
1918  LLMI = mapGlobalPointIDToInd.find(searchItem);
1919  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j] = LLMI->second;
1920  }
1921  }
1922  }
1923 
1924  /*--- The only halo points that must be added to meshPoints are the periodic
1925  halo points. It must be checked whether or not the periodic points in
1926  haloPoints match with points in meshPoints. This is done below. ---*/
1927  for(unsigned long iLow=0; iLow<haloPoints.size(); ) {
1928 
1929  /* Determine the upper index for this periodic transformation. */
1930  unsigned long iUpp;
1931  for(iUpp=iLow+1; iUpp<haloPoints.size(); ++iUpp)
1932  if(haloPoints[iUpp].periodIndexToDonor != haloPoints[iLow].periodIndexToDonor) break;
1933 
1934  /* Check for a true periodic index. */
1935  short perIndex = haloPoints[iLow].periodIndexToDonor;
1936  if(perIndex != -1) {
1937 
1938  /* Easier storage of the surface elements. */
1939  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[perIndex].surfElem;
1940 
1941  /*--- In the loop below the coordinates of the points of this local
1942  periodic boundary as well as a matching tolerance are determined.
1943  A vector of point ID's is also created, which is needed later on
1944  when it is checked whether or not a matching point is already
1945  stored in meshPoints. ---*/
1946  vector<long> indInPoints(meshPoints.size(), -1);
1947  vector<unsigned long> IDsPoints;
1948  vector<su2double> coordPoints;
1949  vector<su2double> tolPoints;
1950 
1951  for(unsigned long j=0; j<surfElem.size(); ++j) {
1952 
1953  /* Determine the tolerance for equal points, which is a small value
1954  times the length scale of the adjacent volume element. */
1955  const su2double tolElem = 1.e-2*volElem[surfElem[j].volElemID].lenScale;
1956 
1957  /* Loop over the nodes of this surface grid and update the points on
1958  this periodic boundary. */
1959  for(unsigned short k=0; k<surfElem[j].nDOFsGrid; ++k) {
1960  unsigned long nn = surfElem[j].nodeIDsGrid[k];
1961 
1962  if(indInPoints[nn] == -1) {
1963 
1964  /* Point is not stored yet in pointsBoundary. Do so now. */
1965  indInPoints[nn] = IDsPoints.size();
1966  IDsPoints.push_back(nn);
1967  tolPoints.push_back(tolElem);
1968 
1969  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nDim; ++l)
1970  coordPoints.push_back(meshPoints[nn].coor[l]);
1971  }
1972  else {
1973 
1974  /* Point is already stored. Update the tolerance. */
1975  nn = indInPoints[nn];
1976  tolPoints[nn] = min(tolPoints[nn], tolElem);
1977  }
1978  }
1979  }
1980 
1981  /* Create a local ADT of the points on the periodic boundary. */
1982  CADTPointsOnlyClass periodicADT(nDim, IDsPoints.size(), coordPoints.data(),
1983  IDsPoints.data(), false);
1984 
1985  /* Get the data for the periodic transformation to the donor. */
1986  auto center = config->GetPeriodicRotCenter(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(perIndex));
1987  auto angles = config->GetPeriodicRotAngles(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(perIndex));
1988  auto trans = config->GetPeriodicTranslation(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(perIndex));
1989 
1990  /*--- Compute the rotation matrix and translation vector for the
1991  transformation from the donor. This is the transpose of the
1992  transformation to the donor. ---*/
1993 
1994  /* Store (center-trans) as it is constant and will be added on. */
1995  su2double translation[] = {center[0] - trans[0],
1996  center[1] - trans[1],
1997  center[2] - trans[2]};
1998 
1999  /* Store angles separately for clarity. Compute sines/cosines. */
2000  su2double theta = angles[0];
2001  su2double phi = angles[1];
2002  su2double psi = angles[2];
2003 
2004  su2double cosTheta = cos(theta), cosPhi = cos(phi), cosPsi = cos(psi);
2005  su2double sinTheta = sin(theta), sinPhi = sin(phi), sinPsi = sin(psi);
2006 
2007  /* Compute the rotation matrix. Note that the implicit
2008  ordering is rotation about the x-axis, y-axis, then z-axis. */
2009  su2double rotMatrix[3][3];
2010  rotMatrix[0][0] = cosPhi*cosPsi;
2011  rotMatrix[0][1] = cosPhi*sinPsi;
2012  rotMatrix[0][2] = -sinPhi;
2013 
2014  rotMatrix[1][0] = sinTheta*sinPhi*cosPsi - cosTheta*sinPsi;
2015  rotMatrix[1][1] = sinTheta*sinPhi*sinPsi + cosTheta*cosPsi;
2016  rotMatrix[1][2] = sinTheta*cosPhi;
2017 
2018  rotMatrix[2][0] = cosTheta*sinPhi*cosPsi + sinTheta*sinPsi;
2019  rotMatrix[2][1] = cosTheta*sinPhi*sinPsi - sinTheta*cosPsi;
2020  rotMatrix[2][2] = cosTheta*cosPhi;
2021 
2022  /* Loop over the halo points for this periodic transformation. */
2023  for(unsigned long i=iLow; i<iUpp; ++i) {
2024 
2025  /* Apply the periodic transformation to the coordinates
2026  stored in this halo point. */
2027  su2double dx = haloPoints[i].coor[0] - center[0];
2028  su2double dy = haloPoints[i].coor[1] - center[1];
2029  su2double dz = nDim == 3 ? haloPoints[i].coor[2] - center[2] : su2double(0.0);
2030 
2031  haloPoints[i].coor[0] = rotMatrix[0][0]*dx + rotMatrix[0][1]*dy
2032  + rotMatrix[0][2]*dz + translation[0];
2033  haloPoints[i].coor[1] = rotMatrix[1][0]*dx + rotMatrix[1][1]*dy
2034  + rotMatrix[1][2]*dz + translation[1];
2035  haloPoints[i].coor[2] = rotMatrix[2][0]*dx + rotMatrix[2][1]*dy
2036  + rotMatrix[2][2]*dz + translation[2];
2037 
2038  /* Search for the nearest coordinate in the ADT. */
2039  su2double dist;
2040  unsigned long pointID;
2041  int rankID;
2042 
2043  periodicADT.DetermineNearestNode(haloPoints[i].coor, dist,
2044  pointID, rankID);
2045 
2046  /* Check whether the distance is less equal to the tolerance for
2047  a matching point. */
2048  const unsigned long nn = indInPoints[pointID];
2049  if(dist <= tolPoints[nn]) {
2050 
2051  /* The distance to the nearest point is less than the tolerance,
2052  hence this periodically transformed point is present on the
2053  boundary. Store it as such in the map mapGlobalPointIDToInd. */
2054  CUnsignedLong2T globIndAndPer;
2055  globIndAndPer.long0 = haloPoints[i].globalID;
2056  globIndAndPer.long1 = haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor+1; // Note the +1 again.
2057 
2058  mapGlobalPointIDToInd[globIndAndPer] = pointID;
2059  }
2060  else {
2061 
2062  /* The distance to the nearest point is larger than the tolerance,
2063  hence this periodically transformed point is not present yet on
2064  this rank. Store it in the mapping to the local points and
2065  create it in meshPoints. */
2066  CUnsignedLong2T globIndAndPer;
2067  globIndAndPer.long0 = haloPoints[i].globalID;
2068  globIndAndPer.long1 = haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor+1; // Note the +1 again.
2069 
2070  mapGlobalPointIDToInd[globIndAndPer] = meshPoints.size();
2071  meshPoints.push_back(haloPoints[i]);
2072  }
2073  }
2074  }
2075 
2076  /* Set iLow to iUpp for the next periodic transformation. */
2077  iLow = iUpp;
2078  }
2079 
2080  /*--- Convert the global node numbering in the elements to a local numbering and
2081  determine the value of factTimeLevel. This is the number of local time steps
2082  of the element relative to the largest time step of an element in the mesh.
2083  This value can only differ from 1 when time accurate local time stepping is
2084  used. ---*/
2085  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
2086  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[i].nDOFsGrid; ++j) {
2087  CUnsignedLong2T searchItem(volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j],
2088  volElem[i].periodIndexToDonor+1); // Again the +1.
2089  map<CUnsignedLong2T, unsigned long>::const_iterator LLMI;
2090  LLMI = mapGlobalPointIDToInd.find(searchItem);
2091  volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j] = LLMI->second;
2092  }
2093 
2094  const unsigned short diffTimeLevel = nTimeLevels - 1 - volElem[i].timeLevel;
2095  volElem[i].factTimeLevel = pow(2, diffTimeLevel);
2096  }
2097 
2098  /* Determine the number of halo elements per time level in cumulative
2099  storage format. */
2100  nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel.assign(nTimeLevels+1, 0);
2101  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i)
2102  ++nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[volElem[i].timeLevel+1];
2103 
2104  nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[0] = nVolElemOwned;
2105  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
2106  nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[i+1] += nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[i];
2107 }
2108 
2109 void CMeshFEM::ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(const unsigned short nIntegration,
2110  const unsigned short nDOFs,
2111  const su2double *matDerBasisInt,
2112  const unsigned long *DOFs,
2113  su2double *derivCoor,
2114  CConfig *config) {
2115 
2116  /* Allocate the memory to store the values of dxdr, dydr, etc. */
2117  vector<su2double> helpDxdrVec(nIntegration*nDim*nDim);
2118  su2double *dxdrVec = helpDxdrVec.data();
2119 
2120  /* Determine the gradients of the Cartesian coordinates w.r.t. the
2121  parametric coordinates. */
2122  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nIntegration, nDOFs, matDerBasisInt, DOFs,
2123  dxdrVec, config);
2124 
2125  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D to compute the derivatives drdx,
2126  drdy, etc. */
2127  switch( nDim ) {
2128  case 2: {
2129  /* 2D computation. Store the offset between the r and s derivatives. */
2130  const unsigned short off = 2*nIntegration;
2131 
2132  /* Loop over the integration points. */
2133  unsigned short ii = 0;
2134  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nIntegration; ++j) {
2135 
2136  /* Retrieve the values of dxdr, dydr, dxds and dyds from dxdrVec
2137  in this integration point. */
2138  const unsigned short jx = 2*j; const unsigned short jy = jx+1;
2139  const su2double dxdr = dxdrVec[jx], dydr = dxdrVec[jy];
2140  const su2double dxds = dxdrVec[jx+off], dyds = dxdrVec[jy+off];
2141 
2142  /* Compute the inverse relations drdx, drdy, dsdx, dsdy. */
2143  const su2double Jinv = 1.0/(dxdr*dyds - dxds*dydr);
2144 
2145  derivCoor[ii++] = dyds*Jinv; // drdx
2146  derivCoor[ii++] = -dxds*Jinv; // drdy
2147  derivCoor[ii++] = -dydr*Jinv; // dsdx
2148  derivCoor[ii++] = dxdr*Jinv; // dsdy
2149  }
2150  break;
2151  }
2152 
2153  case 3: {
2154  /* 3D computation. Store the offset between the r and s and r and t derivatives. */
2155  const unsigned short offS = 3*nIntegration, offT = 6*nIntegration;
2156 
2157  /* Loop over the integration points. */
2158  unsigned short ii = 0;
2159  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nIntegration; ++j) {
2160 
2161  /* Retrieve the values of dxdr, dydr, dzdr, dxds, dyds, dzds, dxdt, dydt
2162  and dzdt from dxdrVec in this integration point. */
2163  const unsigned short jx = 3*j; const unsigned short jy = jx+1, jz = jx+2;
2164  const su2double dxdr = dxdrVec[jx], dydr = dxdrVec[jy], dzdr = dxdrVec[jz];
2165  const su2double dxds = dxdrVec[jx+offS], dyds = dxdrVec[jy+offS], dzds = dxdrVec[jz+offS];
2166  const su2double dxdt = dxdrVec[jx+offT], dydt = dxdrVec[jy+offT], dzdt = dxdrVec[jz+offT];
2167 
2168  /* Compute the inverse relations drdx, drdy, drdz, dsdx, dsdy, dsdz,
2169  dtdx, dtdy, dtdz. */
2170  const su2double Jinv = 1.0/(dxdr*(dyds*dzdt - dzds*dydt)
2171  - dxds*(dydr*dzdt - dzdr*dydt)
2172  + dxdt*(dydr*dzds - dzdr*dyds));
2173 
2174  derivCoor[ii++] = (dyds*dzdt - dzds*dydt)*Jinv; // drdx
2175  derivCoor[ii++] = (dzds*dxdt - dxds*dzdt)*Jinv; // drdy
2176  derivCoor[ii++] = (dxds*dydt - dyds*dxdt)*Jinv; // drdz
2177 
2178  derivCoor[ii++] = (dzdr*dydt - dydr*dzdt)*Jinv; // dsdx
2179  derivCoor[ii++] = (dxdr*dzdt - dzdr*dxdt)*Jinv; // dsdy
2180  derivCoor[ii++] = (dydr*dxdt - dxdr*dydt)*Jinv; // dsdz
2181 
2182  derivCoor[ii++] = (dydr*dzds - dzdr*dyds)*Jinv; // dtdx
2183  derivCoor[ii++] = (dzdr*dxds - dxdr*dzds)*Jinv; // dtdy
2184  derivCoor[ii++] = (dxdr*dyds - dydr*dxds)*Jinv; // dtdz
2185  }
2186 
2187  break;
2188  }
2189  }
2190 }
2191 
2192 void CMeshFEM::ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(const unsigned short nIntegration,
2193  const unsigned short nDOFs,
2194  const su2double *matDerBasisInt,
2195  const unsigned long *DOFs,
2196  su2double *derivCoor,
2197  CConfig *config) {
2198 
2199  /* Allocate the memory to store the coordinates as right hand side. */
2200  vector<su2double> vecRHS(nDOFs*nDim);
2201 
2202  /* Loop over the grid DOFs of the element and copy the coordinates in
2203  vecRHS in row major order. */
2204  unsigned long ic = 0;
2205  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFs; ++j) {
2206  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDim; ++k, ++ic)
2207  vecRHS[ic] = meshPoints[DOFs[j]].coor[k];
2208  }
2209 
2210  /* Carry out the matrix matrix product The last argument is NULL, such
2211  that this gemm call is ignored in the profiling. Replace by config if
2212  if should be included. */
2213  blasFunctions->gemm(nDim*nIntegration, nDim, nDOFs, matDerBasisInt,
2214  vecRHS.data(), derivCoor, nullptr);
2215 }
2216 
2217 void CMeshFEM::ComputeNormalsFace(const unsigned short nIntegration,
2218  const unsigned short nDOFs,
2219  const su2double *dr,
2220  const su2double *ds,
2221  const unsigned long *DOFs,
2222  su2double *normals) {
2223 
2224  /* Initialize the counter ii to 0. ii is the index in normals where the
2225  information is stored. */
2226  unsigned int ii = 0;
2227 
2228  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. */
2229  switch( nDim ) {
2230  case 2: {
2231  /* 2D computation. Loop over the integration points of the face. */
2232  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nIntegration; ++j) {
2233 
2234  /*--- Loop over the number of DOFs of the face to compute dxdr
2235  and dydr. ---*/
2236  const su2double *drr = &dr[j*nDOFs];
2237  su2double dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0;
2238  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k) {
2239  dxdr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[0];
2240  dydr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[1];
2241  }
2242 
2243  /* Determine the length of the tangential vector (dxdr, dydr), which
2244  is also the length of the corresponding normal vector. Also compute
2245  the inverse of the length. Make sure that a division by zero is
2246  avoided, although this is most likely never active. */
2247  const su2double lenNorm = sqrt(dxdr*dxdr + dydr*dydr);
2248  const su2double invLenNorm = lenNorm < su2double(1.e-35) ? su2double(1.e+35) : 1.0/lenNorm;
2249 
2250  /* Store the corresponding unit normal vector and its length. The
2251  direction of the normal vector is such that it is outward pointing
2252  for the element on side 0 of the face. */
2253  normals[ii++] = dydr*invLenNorm;
2254  normals[ii++] = -dxdr*invLenNorm;
2255  normals[ii++] = lenNorm;
2256  }
2257 
2258  break;
2259  }
2260 
2261  case 3: {
2262  /* 3D computation. Loop over the integration points of the face. */
2263  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nIntegration; ++j) {
2264 
2265  /*--- Loop over the number of DOFs of the face to compute dxdr,
2266  dxds, dydr, dyds, dzdr and dzds. ---*/
2267  const su2double *drr = &dr[j*nDOFs], *dss = &ds[j*nDOFs];
2268  su2double dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0, dzdr = 0.0,
2269  dxds = 0.0, dyds = 0.0, dzds = 0.0;
2270  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k) {
2271  dxdr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[0];
2272  dydr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[1];
2273  dzdr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[2];
2274 
2275  dxds += dss[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[0];
2276  dyds += dss[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[1];
2277  dzds += dss[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[2];
2278  }
2279 
2280  /* Compute the vector product dxdr X dxds, where x is the coordinate
2281  vector (x,y,z). Compute the length of this vector, which is an area,
2282  as well as the inverse. Make sure that a division by zero is
2283  avoided, although this is most likely never active. */
2284  const su2double nx = dydr*dzds - dyds*dzdr;
2285  const su2double ny = dxds*dzdr - dxdr*dzds;
2286  const su2double nz = dxdr*dyds - dxds*dydr;
2287 
2288  const su2double lenNorm = sqrt(nx*nx + ny*ny + nz*nz);
2289  const su2double invLenNorm = lenNorm < su2double(1.e-35) ? su2double(1.e+35) : 1.0/lenNorm;
2290 
2291  /* Store the components of the unit normal as well as its length in the
2292  normals. Note that the current direction of the normal is pointing
2293  into the direction of the element on side 0 of the face. However,
2294  in the actual computation of the integral over the faces, it is
2295  assumed that the vector points in the opposite direction.
2296  Hence the normal vector must be reversed. */
2297  normals[ii++] = -nx*invLenNorm;
2298  normals[ii++] = -ny*invLenNorm;
2299  normals[ii++] = -nz*invLenNorm;
2300  normals[ii++] = lenNorm;
2301  }
2302  break;
2303  }
2304  }
2305 }
2306 
2307 void CMeshFEM::MetricTermsBoundaryFaces(CBoundaryFEM *boundary,
2308  CConfig *config) {
2309 
2310  /* Determine whether or not the viscous terms are needed. */
2311  const bool viscousTerms = (config->GetKind_Solver() != MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_EULER && config->GetKind_Solver() != MAIN_SOLVER::DISC_ADJ_FEM_EULER);
2312 
2313  /*--- Loop over the boundary faces stored on this rank. ---*/
2314  for(unsigned long i=0; i<boundary->surfElem.size(); ++i) {
2315 
2316  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2317  /*--- Step 1: Allocate the memory for the face metric terms. ---*/
2318  /*--- Depending on the case, not all of this memory is needed. ---*/
2319  /*--- - Unit normals + area (nDim+1 per integration point) ---*/
2320  /*--- - drdx, dsdx, etc. (nDim*nDim per integration point) ---*/
2321  /*--- - grid velocities in the integration points. ---*/
2322  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2323 
2324  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
2325  relevant information from it. */
2326  const unsigned short ind = boundary->surfElem[i].indStandardElement;
2327  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
2328 
2329  /*--- Allocate the several metric terms. ---*/
2330  boundary->surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace.resize(nInt*(nDim+1));
2331 
2332  if( viscousTerms )
2333  boundary->surfElem[i].metricCoorDerivFace.resize(nInt*nDim*nDim);
2334 
2335  /* Allocate the memory for the grid velocities and initialize them to the
2336  default value of zero. */
2337  boundary->surfElem[i].gridVelocities.assign(nInt*nDim, 0.0);
2338 
2339  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2340  /*--- Step 2: Determine the actual metric data in the integration points ---*/
2341  /*--- of the faces. ---*/
2342  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2343 
2344  /* Call the function ComputeNormalsFace to compute the unit normals and
2345  its corresponding area in the integration points. */
2346  unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsFace();
2347  const su2double *dr = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetDrBasisFaceIntegration();
2348  const su2double *ds = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetDsBasisFaceIntegration();
2349 
2350  ComputeNormalsFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr, ds, boundary->surfElem[i].DOFsGridFace.data(),
2351  boundary->surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace.data());
2352 
2353  /* Compute the derivatives of the parametric coordinates w.r.t. the
2354  Cartesian coordinates, i.e. drdx, drdy, etc. in the integration points
2355  of the face, if needed. */
2356  if( viscousTerms ) {
2357  nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsElem();
2358  dr = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisElemIntegration();
2359 
2360  ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr,
2361  boundary->surfElem[i].DOFsGridElement.data(),
2362  boundary->surfElem[i].metricCoorDerivFace.data(),
2363  config);
2364  }
2365  }
2366 }
2367 
2368 void CMeshFEM::SetPositive_ZArea(CConfig *config) {
2369 
2370  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2371  /*--- Step 1: Determine the local contribution to the positive z area. ---*/
2372  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2373 
2374  /* Loop over the boundary markers. */
2375  su2double PositiveZArea = 0.0;
2376  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
2377 
2378  /* Determine whether or not this boundary contributes. */
2379  const unsigned short Boundary = config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker);
2380  const unsigned short Monitoring = config->GetMarker_All_Monitoring(iMarker);
2381 
2382  if( ((Boundary == EULER_WALL) ||
2383  (Boundary == HEAT_FLUX) ||
2384  (Boundary == ISOTHERMAL) ||
2385  (Boundary == LOAD_BOUNDARY) ||
2386  (Boundary == DISPLACEMENT_BOUNDARY)) && (Monitoring == YES) ) {
2387 
2388  /* Easier storage of the surface elements for this marker. */
2389  const vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
2390 
2391  /* Loop over the surface elements. */
2392  for(unsigned long i=0; i<surfElem.size(); ++i) {
2393 
2394  /* Determine the number of integration points and their weights via
2395  the corresponding standard element. */
2396  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[i].indStandardElement;
2397  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2398  const su2double *weights = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
2399 
2400  /* Loop over the integration points for this element and update PositiveZArea
2401  if the normal has a negative z-component. In that case it will give a
2402  positive contribution to PositiveZArea as this must take the normal pointing
2403  into the element into account. */
2404  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
2405 
2406  /* Store the normal data for this integration point a bit easier and update
2407  PositiveZArea, if needed. */
2408  const su2double *normal = &surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace[j*(nDim+1)];
2409  if(normal[nDim-1] < 0.0)
2410  PositiveZArea -= weights[j]*normal[nDim-1]*normal[nDim];
2411  }
2412  }
2413  }
2414  }
2415 
2416  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2417  /*--- Step 2: Perform an Allreduce such that the global value of ---*/
2418  /*--- PositiveZArea is known on all ranks. ---*/
2419  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2420 
2421 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2422  su2double locArea = PositiveZArea;
2423  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&locArea, &PositiveZArea, 1, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
2424 #endif
2425 
2426  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2427  /*--- Step 3: Set the reference area, if this was not specified and write ---*/
2428  /*--- a message about the projected area if I am the master. ---*/
2429  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2430 
2431  if (config->GetRefArea() == 0.0)
2432  config->SetRefArea(PositiveZArea);
2433 
2434  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
2435  if (nDim == 2) cout << "Area projection in the y-plane = "<< PositiveZArea << "." << endl;
2436  else cout << "Area projection in the z-plane = "<< PositiveZArea << "." << endl;
2437  }
2438 }
2439 
2440 CMeshFEM_DG::CMeshFEM_DG(CGeometry *geometry, CConfig *config)
2441  : CMeshFEM(geometry, config) {
2442 }
2443 
2444 void CMeshFEM_DG::SetGlobal_to_Local_Point(void) {
2445  Global_to_Local_Point.clear();
2446  unsigned long ii = 0;
2447  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
2448  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[i].nDOFsSol; ++j, ++ii) {
2449  Global_to_Local_Point[volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolGlobal+j] = ii;
2450  }
2451  }
2452 }
2453 
2454 void CMeshFEM_DG::CoordinatesIntegrationPoints(void) {
2455 
2456  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2457  /*--- Step 1: The integration points of the owned volume elements. ---*/
2458  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2459 
2460  /*--- Loop over the owned elements to compute the coordinates
2461  in the integration points. ---*/
2462  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
2463 
2464  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2465  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
2466  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2467  const su2double *lag = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetBasisFunctionsIntegration();
2468 
2469  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the integration points. */
2470  volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.resize(nDim*nInt);
2471 
2472  /* Store the grid DOFs of this element a bit easier. */
2473  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsGrid;
2474  const unsigned long *DOFs = volElem[l].nodeIDsGrid.data();
2475 
2476  /*--- Loop over the integration points of this element and compute
2477  the coordinates of the integration points. */
2478  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
2479 
2480  su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
2481  const unsigned short jj = i*nDOFs;
2482  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDim; ++j) {
2483  coor[j] = 0.0;
2484  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
2485  coor[j] += lag[jj+k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[j];
2486  }
2487  }
2488  }
2489 
2490  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2491  /*--- Step 2: The integration points of the internal matching faces. ---*/
2492  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2493 
2494  /*--- Loop over the internal matching faces to compute the coordinates
2495  in the integration points. ---*/
2496  for(unsigned long l=0; l<matchingFaces.size(); ++l) {
2497 
2498  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2499  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[l].indStandardElement;
2500  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2501  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
2502  const su2double *lag = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
2503 
2504  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the integration points. */
2505  matchingFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.resize(nDim*nInt);
2506 
2507  /* Store the grid DOFs of this face a bit easier. */
2508  const unsigned long *DOFs = matchingFaces[l].DOFsGridFaceSide0.data();
2509 
2510  /*--- Loop over the integration points of this face and compute
2511  the coordinates of the integration points. */
2512  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
2513 
2514  su2double *coor = matchingFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
2515  const unsigned short jj = i*nDOFs;
2516  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDim; ++j) {
2517  coor[j] = 0.0;
2518  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
2519  coor[j] += lag[jj+k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[j];
2520  }
2521  }
2522  }
2523 
2524  /*-------------------------------------------------------------*/
2525  /*--- Step 3: The integration points of the boundary faces. ---*/
2526  /*-------------------------------------------------------------*/
2527 
2528  /*--- Loop over the boundary markers. Make sure to exclude the periodic
2529  boundaries, because these are not physical. ---*/
2530  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<boundaries.size(); ++iMarker) {
2531  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
2532 
2533  /* Abbreviate the surface elements a bit easier. */
2534  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
2535 
2536  /* Loop over the boundary faces and determine the coordinates
2537  in the integration points. */
2538  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
2539 
2540  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2541  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
2542  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2543  const unsigned short nDOFs = surfElem[l].nDOFsGrid;
2544  const su2double *lag = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegration();
2545 
2546  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the integration points. */
2547  surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.resize(nDim*nInt);
2548 
2549  /* Store the grid DOFs of this face a bit easier. */
2550  const unsigned long *DOFs = surfElem[l].DOFsGridFace.data();
2551 
2552  /*--- Loop over the integration points of this face and compute
2553  the coordinates of the integration points. */
2554  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
2555 
2556  su2double *coor = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
2557  const unsigned short jj = i*nDOFs;
2558  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDim; ++j) {
2559  coor[j] = 0.0;
2560  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
2561  coor[j] += lag[jj+k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[j];
2562  }
2563  }
2564  }
2565  }
2566  }
2567 }
2568 
2569 void CMeshFEM_DG::CoordinatesSolDOFs(void) {
2570 
2571  /*--- Loop over the owned elements to compute the coordinates
2572  of the solution DOFs. ---*/
2573  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
2574 
2575  /* Store the grid DOFs and the number of solDOFS a bit easier. */
2576  const unsigned short nDOFsGrid = volElem[l].nDOFsGrid;
2577  const unsigned short nDOFsSol = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
2578  const unsigned long *DOFsGrid = volElem[l].nodeIDsGrid.data();
2579 
2580  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2581  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
2582  const su2double *lag = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetBasisFunctionsSolDOFs();
2583 
2584  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the solution DOFs. */
2585  volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.resize(nDim*nDOFsSol);
2586 
2587  /*--- Loop over the solution DOFs of this element and compute the
2588  coordinates. Note that in case the polynomial degree of the grid
2589  and solution is the same the grid DOFs and solution DOFs coincide
2590  and the interpolation boils down to a copy of the coordinates. ---*/
2591  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsSol; ++i) {
2592 
2593  su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
2594  const unsigned short jj = i*nDOFsGrid;
2595  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDim; ++j) {
2596  coor[j] = 0.0;
2597  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFsGrid; ++k)
2598  coor[j] += lag[jj+k]*meshPoints[DOFsGrid[k]].coor[j];
2599  }
2600  }
2601  }
2602 }
2603 
2604 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateFaces(CConfig *config) {
2605 
2606  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2607  /*--- Step 1: Determine the faces of the locally stored part of the grid. ---*/
2608  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2609 
2610  /*--- Loop over the volume elements stored on this rank, including the halos. ---*/
2611  vector<CFaceOfElement> localFaces;
2612 
2613  for(unsigned long k=0; k<nVolElemTot; ++k) {
2614 
2615  /* Determine the corner points of all the faces of this element. */
2616  unsigned short nFaces;
2617  unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
2618  unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
2619 
2620  volElem[k].GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
2621 
2622  /* Loop over the faces of this element, set the appropriate information,
2623  create a unique numbering and add the faces to localFaces. */
2624  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nFaces; ++i) {
2625  CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2626  thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[i];
2627  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j)
2628  thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[i][j];
2629 
2630  /* Copy the data from the volume element. */
2631  thisFace.elemID0 = k;
2632  thisFace.nPolyGrid0 = volElem[k].nPolyGrid;
2633  thisFace.nPolySol0 = volElem[k].nPolySol;
2634  thisFace.nDOFsElem0 = volElem[k].nDOFsSol;
2635  thisFace.elemType0 = volElem[k].VTK_Type;
2636  thisFace.faceID0 = i;
2637  thisFace.faceIndicator = -2; // Initialized to an invalid face.
2638 
2639  thisFace.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = volElem[k].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[i];
2640  thisFace.elem0IsOwner = volElem[k].ElementOwnsFaces[i];
2641 
2642  /* Determine whether or not the integration rule for straight and curved
2643  faces is the same. If that is the case, the value of JacFaceIsConsideredConstant
2644  is set to false. Hence it is only needed to carry out this check for faces
2645  with a constant Jacobian. This is done to reduce the number of standard elements. */
2646  if( thisFace.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant ) {
2647 
2648  unsigned short orderExactStraight =
2649  (unsigned short) ceil(thisFace.nPolyGrid0*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Straight());
2650  unsigned short orderExactCurved =
2651  (unsigned short) ceil(thisFace.nPolyGrid0*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Curved());
2652 
2653  if(orderExactStraight == orderExactCurved) {
2654  orderExactStraight =
2655  (unsigned short) ceil(thisFace.nPolySol0*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Straight());
2656  orderExactCurved =
2657  (unsigned short) ceil(thisFace.nPolySol0*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Curved());
2658  if(orderExactStraight == orderExactCurved)
2659  thisFace.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = false;
2660  }
2661  }
2662 
2663  /* Renumber the corner points of the face, but keep the orientation.
2664  Afterwards, add it to localFaces. */
2665  thisFace.CreateUniqueNumberingWithOrientation();
2666 
2667  localFaces.push_back(thisFace);
2668  }
2669  }
2670 
2671  /*--- Sort the the local faces in increasing order. ---*/
2672  sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
2673 
2674  /*--- Loop over the faces to merge the matching faces. ---*/
2675  for(unsigned long i=1; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2676 
2677  /* Check for a matching face with the previous face in the vector.
2678  Note that the == operator only checks the node IDs. */
2679  if(localFaces[i] == localFaces[i-1]) {
2680 
2681  /* Faces are matching. Check if it should be kept, i.e. if one
2682  of the elements owns the face. */
2683  if(localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner || localFaces[i-1].elem0IsOwner) {
2684 
2685  /* Store the data for this matching face in faces[i-1]. */
2686  if(localFaces[i].elemID0 < nVolElemTot) {
2687  localFaces[i-1].elemID0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
2688  localFaces[i-1].nPolyGrid0 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0;
2689  localFaces[i-1].nPolySol0 = localFaces[i].nPolySol0;
2690  localFaces[i-1].nDOFsElem0 = localFaces[i].nDOFsElem0;
2691  localFaces[i-1].elemType0 = localFaces[i].elemType0;
2692  localFaces[i-1].faceID0 = localFaces[i].faceID0;
2693  localFaces[i-1].elem0IsOwner = localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner;
2694  }
2695  else {
2696  localFaces[i-1].elemID1 = localFaces[i].elemID1;
2697  localFaces[i-1].nPolyGrid1 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1;
2698  localFaces[i-1].nPolySol1 = localFaces[i].nPolySol1;
2699  localFaces[i-1].nDOFsElem1 = localFaces[i].nDOFsElem1;
2700  localFaces[i-1].elemType1 = localFaces[i].elemType1;
2701  localFaces[i-1].faceID1 = localFaces[i].faceID1;
2702  }
2703 
2704  /* Adapt the boolean to indicate whether or not the face has a constant
2705  Jacobian of the transformation, although in principle this info
2706  should be the same for both faces. */
2707  if( !(localFaces[i-1].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant &&
2708  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant) ) {
2709  localFaces[i-1].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = false;
2710  }
2711 
2712  /* Set this face indicator to -1 to indicate an internal face
2713  and set elem0IsOwner for localFaces[i] to false. */
2714  localFaces[i-1].faceIndicator = -1;
2715  localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = false;
2716  }
2717  }
2718  }
2719 
2720  /*--- Loop over the boundary markers and its boundary elements to search for
2721  the corresponding faces in localFaces. These faces should be found.
2722  Note that periodic boundaries are skipped, because these are treated
2723  via the halo elements, which are already in place. ---*/
2724  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
2725  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
2726 
2727  for(unsigned long k=0; k<boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size(); ++k) {
2728 
2729  /* Determine the corner points of the face of this element. */
2730  unsigned short nPointsPerFace;
2731  unsigned long faceConn[4];
2732 
2733  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[k].GetCornerPointsFace(nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
2734 
2735  /* Create an object of CFaceOfElement to carry out the search. */
2736  CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2737  thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace;
2738  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nPointsPerFace; ++j)
2739  thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[j];
2740  thisFace.CreateUniqueNumberingWithOrientation();
2741 
2742  /* Search for thisFace in localFaces. It must be found. */
2743  vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
2744  low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
2745 
2746  bool thisFaceFound = false;
2747  if(low != localFaces.end()) {
2748  if( !(thisFace < *low) ) thisFaceFound = true;
2749  }
2750 
2751  if( thisFaceFound ) {
2752  low->faceIndicator = iMarker;
2753 
2754  /* A few additional checks. */
2755  bool side0IsBoundary = low->elemID0 < nVolElemTot;
2756  unsigned long elemID = side0IsBoundary ? low->elemID0 : low->elemID1;
2757  unsigned short nPoly = side0IsBoundary ? low->nPolyGrid0 : low->nPolyGrid1;
2758 
2759  if(elemID != boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[k].volElemID ||
2760  nPoly != boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[k].nPolyGrid)
2761  SU2_MPI::Error(string("Element ID and/or polynomial degree do not match ") +
2762  string("for this boundary element. This should not happen."),
2763  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2764  }
2765  else
2766  SU2_MPI::Error("Boundary face not found in localFaces. This should not happen.",
2767  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2768  }
2769  }
2770  }
2771 
2772  /*--- It is possible that owned non-matching faces are present in the list.
2773  These faces are indicated by an owned face and a faceIndicator of -2.
2774  To avoid that these faces are removed afterwards, set their
2775  faceIndicator to -1. ---*/
2776  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2777  if(localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -2 && localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner)
2778  localFaces[i].faceIndicator = -1;
2779  }
2780 
2781  /*--- Remove the invalid faces. This is accomplished by giving the face four
2782  points and global node ID's that are larger than the largest local point
2783  ID in the grid. In this way the sorting operator puts these faces at the
2784  end of the vector, see also the < operator of CFaceOfElement. ---*/
2785  unsigned long nFacesLoc = localFaces.size();
2786  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2787  if(localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -2) {
2788  unsigned long invalID = meshPoints.size();
2789  localFaces[i].nCornerPoints = 4;
2790  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = invalID;
2791  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = invalID;
2792  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = invalID;
2793  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[3] = invalID;
2794  --nFacesLoc;
2795  }
2796  }
2797 
2798  sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
2799  localFaces.resize(nFacesLoc);
2800 
2801  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2802  /*--- Step 2: Preparation of the localFaces vector, such that the info ---*/
2803  /*--- stored in this vector can be separated in a contribution ---*/
2804  /*--- from the internal faces and a contribution from the faces ---*/
2805  /*--- that belong to physical boundaries. ---*/
2806  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2807 
2808  /* Sort localFaces again, but now such that the boundary faces are numbered
2809  first, followed by the matching faces and at the end of localFaces the
2810  non-matching faces are stored. In order to carry out this sorting the
2811  functor CSortFaces is used for comparison. Within the categories
2812  the sorting depends on the time levels of the adjacent volume elements
2813  of the face. */
2814  sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(),
2815  CSortFaces(nVolElemOwned, nVolElemTot, volElem.data()));
2816 
2817  /*--- Carry out a possible swap of side 0 and side 1 of the faces. This is
2818  done for the following reasons (in order of importance).
2819  1: The element on side 0 must always be an owned element.
2820  2: The VTK type of the element on side 0 must be less than or equal
2821  to the VTK type of the element on side 1. This is done to reduce
2822  the number of standard elements for the matching faces.
2823  3: For the same VTK types the element on side 0 must be the smallest.
2824 
2825  Furthermore, make sure that for boundary faces and non-matching faces
2826  the corresponding element is always on side 0. ---*/
2827  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2828 
2829  /* Determine whether or not the ajacent elements must be swapped. */
2830  bool swapElements;
2831  if(localFaces[i].elemID0 < nVolElemTot &&
2832  localFaces[i].elemID1 < nVolElemTot) {
2833 
2834  /* This is an internal matching face. First check if one of the adjacent
2835  elements is not an owned element. */
2836  if(localFaces[i].elemID0 >= nVolElemOwned ||
2837  localFaces[i].elemID1 >= nVolElemOwned) {
2838 
2839  /* One of the element is not owned. Make sure that the owned element
2840  is on side 0. */
2841  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemID0 > localFaces[i].elemID1;
2842  }
2843  else if(localFaces[i].elemType0 == localFaces[i].elemType1) {
2844 
2845  /* The same element type on both sides. Make sure that the element
2846  with the smallest ID is stored on side 0 of the face. */
2847  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemID0 > localFaces[i].elemID1;
2848  }
2849  else {
2850  /* Different element types. Make sure that the lowest element
2851  type will be stored on side 0 of the face. */
2852  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemType0 > localFaces[i].elemType1;
2853  }
2854  }
2855  else {
2856 
2857  /* Either a boundary face or a non-matching face. It must be swapped
2858  if the element is currently on side 1 of the face. */
2859  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemID1 < nVolElemTot;
2860  }
2861 
2862  /* Swap the adjacent elements of the face, if needed. Note that
2863  also the sequence of the corner points must be altered in order
2864  to obey the right hand rule. */
2865  if( swapElements ) {
2866  swap(localFaces[i].elemID0, localFaces[i].elemID1);
2867  swap(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0, localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1);
2868  swap(localFaces[i].nPolySol0, localFaces[i].nPolySol1);
2869  swap(localFaces[i].nDOFsElem0, localFaces[i].nDOFsElem1);
2870  swap(localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].elemType1);
2871  swap(localFaces[i].faceID0, localFaces[i].faceID1);
2872 
2873  if(localFaces[i].nCornerPoints == 2)
2874  swap(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0], localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1]);
2875  else
2876  swap(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0], localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2]);
2877 
2878  localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = !localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner;
2879  }
2880  }
2881 
2882  /*--- For triangular faces with a pyramid as an adjacent element, it must be
2883  made sure that the first corner point does not coincide with the top of
2884  the pyramid. Otherwise it is impossible to carry the transformation to
2885  the standard pyramid element. ---*/
2886  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2887 
2888  /* Check for a triangular face. */
2889  if(localFaces[i].nCornerPoints == 3) {
2890 
2891  /* Determine if the corner points correspond to a corner point of a
2892  pyramid. A pyramid can in principle occur on both sides of the face. */
2893  bool cornerIsTopPyramid[] = {false, false, false};
2894 
2895  if(localFaces[i].elemType0 == PYRAMID) {
2896  unsigned long topPyramid = volElem[localFaces[i].elemID0].nodeIDsGrid.back();
2897  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[0] = true;
2898  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[1] = true;
2899  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[2] = true;
2900  }
2901 
2902  if(localFaces[i].elemType1 == PYRAMID) {
2903  unsigned long topPyramid = volElem[localFaces[i].elemID1].nodeIDsGrid.back();
2904  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[0] = true;
2905  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[1] = true;
2906  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[2] = true;
2907  }
2908 
2909  /* Check if the first element corresponds to the top of a pyramid. */
2910  if( cornerIsTopPyramid[0] ) {
2911 
2912  /* The sequence of the points of the face must be altered. It is done in
2913  such a way that the orientation remains the same. Store the original
2914  point numbering. */
2915  unsigned long tmp[] = {localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0],
2916  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1],
2917  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2]};
2918 
2919  /* Determine the situation. */
2920  if( !cornerIsTopPyramid[1] ) {
2921 
2922  /* cornerPoint[1] is not a top of a pyramid. Hence this will become
2923  the point 0 of the triangle. */
2924  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = tmp[1];
2925  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = tmp[2];
2926  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = tmp[0];
2927  }
2928  else {
2929 
2930  /* Only cornerPoint[2] is not a top of a pyramid. Hence this will
2931  become point 0 of the triangle. */
2932  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = tmp[2];
2933  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = tmp[0];
2934  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = tmp[1];
2935  }
2936  }
2937  else if(cornerIsTopPyramid[1] && !cornerIsTopPyramid[2]) {
2938 
2939  /* cornerPoint[1] is a top of a pyramid and the other two corners
2940  are not. Change the sequence, such that cornerPoint[2] will become
2941  point 0 of the triangle. */
2942  unsigned long tmp[] = {localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0],
2943  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1],
2944  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2]};
2945  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = tmp[2];
2946  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = tmp[0];
2947  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = tmp[1];
2948  }
2949  }
2950  }
2951 
2952  /*--- Determine the number of matching and non-matching internal faces.
2953  For the matching faces, determine these numbers per time level
2954  and also make a distinction between internal faces and faces that
2955  involve a halo element. ---*/
2956  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
2957  nMatchingFacesInternal.assign(nTimeLevels+1, 0);
2958  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem.assign(nTimeLevels+1, 0);
2959 
2960  unsigned long nNonMatchingFaces = 0;
2961  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2962  if(localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -1) {
2963  const unsigned long e0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
2964  const unsigned long e1 = localFaces[i].elemID1;
2965 
2966  if(e1 < nVolElemTot) {
2967  const unsigned short timeLevel = min(volElem[e0].timeLevel,
2968  volElem[e1].timeLevel);
2969  if(e1 < nVolElemOwned) ++nMatchingFacesInternal[timeLevel+1];
2970  else ++nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[timeLevel+1];
2971  }
2972  else ++nNonMatchingFaces;
2973  }
2974  }
2975 
2976  if( nNonMatchingFaces ) {
2977  ostringstream message;
2978  message << nNonMatchingFaces << " non-matching internal faces found.\n"
2979  << "This is not supported yet." << endl;
2980  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2981  }
2982 
2983  /* Put nMatchingFacesInternal and nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem in
2984  cumulative storage format. */
2985  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
2986  nMatchingFacesInternal[i+1] += nMatchingFacesInternal[i];
2987 
2988  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[0] = nMatchingFacesInternal[nTimeLevels];
2989  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
2990  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i+1] += nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i];
2991 
2992  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2993  /*--- Step 3: Create the local face based data structure for the internal ---*/
2994  /*--- faces. These are needed for the computation of the surface ---*/
2995  /*--- integral in DG-FEM. ---*/
2996  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2997 
2998  /* Allocate the memory for the matching faces. */
2999  matchingFaces.resize(nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[nTimeLevels]);
3000 
3001  /*--- Loop over the volume elements to determine the maximum number
3002  of DOFs for the volume elements. Allocate the memory for the
3003  vector used to store the DOFs of the element. ---*/
3004  unsigned short nDOFsVolMax = 0;
3005  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3006  nDOFsVolMax = max(nDOFsVolMax, volElem[i].nDOFsGrid);
3007  nDOFsVolMax = max(nDOFsVolMax, volElem[i].nDOFsSol);
3008  }
3009 
3010  vector<unsigned long> DOFsElem(nDOFsVolMax);
3011 
3012  /*--- Loop over localFaces to create the connectivity information, which
3013  is stored in matchingFaces. ---*/
3014  unsigned long ii = 0;
3015  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
3016  if(localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -1 && localFaces[i].elemID1 < nVolElemTot) {
3017 
3018  /*--- Determine the number of DOFs on both sides of the face for both the
3019  grid and solution. This value depends on the face type. ---*/
3020  unsigned short sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = 0, sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = 0;
3021  unsigned short sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = 0, sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = 0;
3022 
3023  unsigned short VTK_Type = 0; // To avoid a compiler warning.
3024  switch( localFaces[i].nCornerPoints ) {
3025  case 2:
3026  /* Face is a line. */
3027  VTK_Type = LINE;
3028  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1;
3029  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1 + 1;
3030  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1;
3031  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = localFaces[i].nPolySol1 + 1;
3032  break;
3033 
3034  case 3:
3035  /* Face is a triangle. */
3036  VTK_Type = TRIANGLE;
3037  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+2)/2;
3038  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1+2)/2;
3039  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +2)/2;
3040  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol1 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol1 +2)/2;
3041  break;
3042 
3043  case 4:
3044  /* Face is a quadrilateral. */
3045  VTK_Type = QUADRILATERAL;
3046  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1);
3047  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1+1);
3048  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1);
3049  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol1 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol1 +1);
3050  break;
3051  }
3052 
3053  /* Abbreviate the adjacent element ID's and store them in matchingFaces. */
3054  const unsigned long v0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
3055  const unsigned long v1 = localFaces[i].elemID1;
3056 
3057  matchingFaces[ii].elemID0 = v0;
3058  matchingFaces[ii].elemID1 = v1;
3059 
3060  /* Allocate the memory for the connectivities of the face. */
3061  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide0.resize(sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0);
3062  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide1.resize(sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1);
3063  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide0.resize(sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0);
3064  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide1.resize(sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1);
3065 
3066  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide0.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid);
3067  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide1.resize(volElem[v1].nDOFsGrid);
3068  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide0.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsSol);
3069  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide1.resize(volElem[v1].nDOFsSol);
3070 
3071  /*--- Create the connectivities of the adjacent elements in the correct
3072  sequence as well as the connectivities of the face. The
3073  connectivities of both sides of the face are determined for the
3074  grid and solution. First for side 0. ---*/
3075  bool swapFaceInElementSide0;
3076  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v0].nDOFsSol; ++j)
3077  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j;
3078 
3079  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3080  volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3081  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolySol,
3082  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide0,
3083  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide0.data(),
3084  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide0.data());
3085 
3086  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid; ++j)
3087  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid[j];
3088 
3089  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3090  volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3091  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3092  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide0,
3093  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide0.data(),
3094  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide0.data());
3095 
3096  /*--- And also for side 1 of the face. ---*/
3097  bool swapFaceInElementSide1;
3098  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v1].nDOFsSol; ++j)
3099  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v1].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j;
3100 
3101  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3102  volElem[v1].VTK_Type, volElem[v1].nPolyGrid,
3103  volElem[v1].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v1].nPolySol,
3104  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide1,
3105  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide1.data(),
3106  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide1.data());
3107 
3108  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v1].nDOFsGrid; ++j)
3109  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v1].nodeIDsGrid[j];
3110 
3111  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3112  volElem[v1].VTK_Type, volElem[v1].nPolyGrid,
3113  volElem[v1].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v1].nPolyGrid,
3114  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide1,
3115  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide1.data(),
3116  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide1.data());
3117 
3118  /*--- Search in the standard elements for faces for a matching
3119  standard element. If not found, create a new standard element.
3120  Note that both the grid and the solution representation must
3121  match with the standard element. ---*/
3122  unsigned long j;
3123  for(j=0; j<standardMatchingFacesSol.size(); ++j) {
3124  if(standardMatchingFacesSol[j].SameStandardMatchingFace(VTK_Type,
3125  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3126  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3127  localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3128  localFaces[i].elemType1,
3129  localFaces[i].nPolySol1,
3130  swapFaceInElementSide0,
3131  swapFaceInElementSide1) &&
3132  standardMatchingFacesGrid[j].SameStandardMatchingFace(VTK_Type,
3133  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3134  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3135  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3136  localFaces[i].elemType1,
3137  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1,
3138  swapFaceInElementSide0,
3139  swapFaceInElementSide1) ) {
3140  matchingFaces[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3141  break;
3142  }
3143  }
3144 
3145  /* Create the new standard elements if no match was found. */
3146  if(j == standardMatchingFacesSol.size()) {
3147 
3148  standardMatchingFacesSol.push_back(CFEMStandardInternalFace(VTK_Type,
3149  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3150  localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3151  localFaces[i].elemType1,
3152  localFaces[i].nPolySol1,
3153  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3154  swapFaceInElementSide0,
3155  swapFaceInElementSide1,
3156  config) );
3157 
3158  standardMatchingFacesGrid.push_back(CFEMStandardInternalFace(VTK_Type,
3159  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3160  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3161  localFaces[i].elemType1,
3162  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1,
3163  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3164  swapFaceInElementSide0,
3165  swapFaceInElementSide1,
3166  config,
3167  standardMatchingFacesSol[j].GetOrderExact()) );
3168  matchingFaces[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3169  }
3170 
3171  /* Update the counter ii for the next internal matching face. */
3172  ++ii;
3173  }
3174  }
3175 
3176  /* Carry out an additional sorting of matchingFaces, such that faces with the
3177  same standard face are contiguous in memory as much as possible. This allows
3178  for a simultaneous treatment of faces, which increases the gemm performance.
3179  Note that this sorting takes place for each time level, because the grouping
3180  of faces per time level is essential for the correct functioning of the code.
3181  The same holds for the distinction between internal faces and faces that
3182  are adjacent to a halo element. */
3183  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i) {
3184  sort(matchingFaces.begin()+nMatchingFacesInternal[i],
3185  matchingFaces.begin()+nMatchingFacesInternal[i+1]);
3186 
3187  sort(matchingFaces.begin()+nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i],
3188  matchingFaces.begin()+nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i+1]);
3189  }
3190 
3191  /* Loop over the faces to flag the elements that share one or more faces
3192  with elements from a lower time level. */
3193  vector<bool> elemAdjLowTimeLevel(nVolElemTot, false);
3194  for(unsigned long i=0; i<matchingFaces.size(); ++i) {
3195  const unsigned long e0 = matchingFaces[i].elemID0;
3196  const unsigned long e1 = matchingFaces[i].elemID1;
3197 
3198  if(volElem[e0].timeLevel > volElem[e1].timeLevel) elemAdjLowTimeLevel[e0] = true;
3199  if(volElem[e1].timeLevel > volElem[e0].timeLevel) elemAdjLowTimeLevel[e1] = true;
3200  }
3201 
3202  /* Determine the list of elements per time level, which share one or more
3203  faces with elements of the lower time level. Make a distinction between
3204  owned and halo elements. */
3205  ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
3206  haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
3207 
3208  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
3209  if( elemAdjLowTimeLevel[i] )
3210  ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[volElem[i].timeLevel].push_back(i);
3211  }
3212 
3213  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3214  if( elemAdjLowTimeLevel[i] )
3215  haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[volElem[i].timeLevel].push_back(i);
3216  }
3217 
3218  /* Determine the offsets of the solution DOFs in the solution working vectors
3219  of the solver for the different time levels. These are needed when time
3220  accurate local time stepping is employed. */
3221  vector<unsigned long> counterDOFs(nTimeLevels, 0);
3222 
3223  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3224  const unsigned short lev = volElem[i].timeLevel;
3225  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel = counterDOFs[lev];
3226  counterDOFs[lev] += volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
3227 
3228  if( elemAdjLowTimeLevel[i] ) {
3229  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel = counterDOFs[lev-1];
3230  counterDOFs[lev-1] += volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
3231  }
3232  else {
3233  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel = ULONG_MAX;
3234  }
3235  }
3236 
3237  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3238  /*--- Step 4: Create the local face based data structure for the faces ---*/
3239  /*--- that belong to the physical boundaries. ---*/
3240  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3241 
3242  /* Loop over the boundary markers. ---*/
3243  unsigned long indBegMarker = 0;
3244  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3245 
3246  /* Initialize the number of surface elements per time level to zero. */
3247  boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem.assign(nTimeLevels+1, 0);
3248 
3249  /*--- The periodic boundaries are skipped, because these are not physical
3250  boundaries and are treated via the halo elements. These have already
3251  been created. ---*/
3252  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
3253 
3254  /* Determine the end index for this marker in localFaces. Note that
3255  localFaces is sorted such that the boundary faces are first and
3256  also grouped per boundary, see the functor CSortFaces. */
3257  unsigned long indEndMarker = indBegMarker;
3258  for(; indEndMarker<localFaces.size(); ++indEndMarker) {
3259  if(localFaces[indEndMarker].faceIndicator != (short) iMarker) break;
3260  }
3261 
3262  /* Easier storage of the surface elements for this boundary. */
3263  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
3264 
3265  /*--- Loop over range in localFaces for this boundary marker and create
3266  the connectivity information, which is stored in surfElem. ---*/
3267  for(unsigned long i=indBegMarker; i<indEndMarker; ++i) {
3268 
3269  /* Determine the time level of the adjacent element and increment
3270  the number of surface elements for this time level. The +1 is there,
3271  because this vector will be put in cumulative storage format
3272  afterwards. */
3273  ii = i - indBegMarker;
3274  const unsigned short timeLevel = volElem[surfElem[ii].volElemID].timeLevel;
3275  ++boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[timeLevel+1];
3276 
3277  /*--- Determine the number of DOFs of the face for both the grid
3278  and solution. This value depends on the face type. ---*/
3279  unsigned short sizeDOFsGridFace = 0, sizeDOFsSolFace = 0;
3280 
3281  unsigned short VTK_Type = 0; // To avoid a compiler warning.
3282  switch( localFaces[i].nCornerPoints ) {
3283  case 2:
3284  /* Face is a line. */
3285  VTK_Type = LINE;
3286  sizeDOFsGridFace = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1;
3287  sizeDOFsSolFace = localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1;
3288  break;
3289 
3290  case 3:
3291  /* Face is a triangle. */
3292  VTK_Type = TRIANGLE;
3293  sizeDOFsGridFace = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+2)/2;
3294  sizeDOFsSolFace = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +2)/2;
3295  break;
3296 
3297  case 4:
3298  /* Face is a quadrilateral. */
3299  VTK_Type = QUADRILATERAL;
3300  sizeDOFsGridFace = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1);
3301  sizeDOFsSolFace = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1);
3302  break;
3303  }
3304 
3305  /* Abbreviate the adjacent element ID. */
3306  const unsigned long v0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
3307 
3308  /* Allocate the memory for the connectivities of the face. */
3309  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridFace.resize(sizeDOFsGridFace);
3310  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolFace.resize(sizeDOFsSolFace);
3311 
3312  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridElement.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid);
3313  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolElement.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsSol);
3314 
3315  /*--- Create the connectivities of the adjacent element in the correct
3316  sequence as well as the connectivities of the face. The
3317  connectivities are determined for the grid and solution. ---*/
3318  bool swapFaceInElement;
3319  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v0].nDOFsSol; ++j)
3320  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j;
3321 
3322  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3323  volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3324  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolySol,
3325  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElement,
3326  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolFace.data(),
3327  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolElement.data());
3328 
3329  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid; ++j)
3330  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid[j];
3331 
3332  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3333  volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3334  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3335  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElement,
3336  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridFace.data(),
3337  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridElement.data());
3338 
3339  /*--- Search in the standard elements for boundary faces for a matching
3340  standard element. If not found, create a new standard element.
3341  Note that both the grid and the solution representation must
3342  match with the standard element. ---*/
3343  unsigned long j;
3344  for(j=0; j<standardBoundaryFacesSol.size(); ++j) {
3345  if(standardBoundaryFacesSol[j].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type,
3346  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3347  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3348  localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3349  swapFaceInElement) &&
3350  standardBoundaryFacesGrid[j].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type,
3351  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3352  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3353  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3354  swapFaceInElement) ) {
3355  surfElem[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3356  break;
3357  }
3358  }
3359 
3360  /* Create the new standard elements if no match was found. */
3361  if(j == standardBoundaryFacesSol.size()) {
3362 
3363  standardBoundaryFacesSol.push_back(CFEMStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type,
3364  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3365  localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3366  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3367  swapFaceInElement,
3368  config) );
3369 
3370  standardBoundaryFacesGrid.push_back(CFEMStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type,
3371  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3372  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3373  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3374  swapFaceInElement,
3375  config,
3376  standardBoundaryFacesSol[j].GetOrderExact()) );
3377  surfElem[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3378  }
3379  }
3380 
3381  /* Set indBegMarker to indEndMarker for the next marker. */
3382  indBegMarker = indEndMarker;
3383 
3384  /* Put boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem in cumulative storage. */
3385  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
3386  boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i+1] += boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i];
3387 
3388  /* Carry out another sort of the surface elements, such that surface elements
3389  belonging to the same standard element are contiguous in memory. In this
3390  way a simultaneous treatment of several surface elements is possible, which
3391  increases the performance. Note that this renumbering must happen within
3392  each time level. */
3393  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
3394  sort(surfElem.begin()+boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i],
3395  surfElem.begin()+boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i+1],
3396  CSortBoundaryFaces());
3397  }
3398  }
3399 }
3400 
3401 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateStandardVolumeElements(CConfig *config) {
3402 
3403  /*--- Loop over the volume elements and create new standard elements if needed.
3404  Note that a new standard element is created when either the solution
3405  element or the grid element does not match. Note further that for the
3406  standard element of the grid the order for the integration of the
3407  solution is used, such that the metric terms are computed in the correct
3408  integration points in case the polynomial order of the solution differs
3409  from that of the grid. ---*/
3410  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3411 
3412  /* Check the existing standard elements in the list. */
3413  unsigned long j;
3414  for(j=0; j<standardElementsSol.size(); ++j) {
3415  if(standardElementsSol[j].SameStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type,
3416  volElem[i].nPolySol,
3417  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant) &&
3418  standardElementsGrid[j].SameStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type,
3419  volElem[i].nPolyGrid,
3420  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant) ) {
3421  volElem[i].indStandardElement = j;
3422  break;
3423  }
3424  }
3425 
3426  /* Create the new standard elements if no match was found. */
3427  if(j == standardElementsSol.size()) {
3428 
3429  standardElementsSol.push_back(CFEMStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type,
3430  volElem[i].nPolySol,
3431  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant,
3432  config) );
3433 
3434  standardElementsGrid.push_back(CFEMStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type,
3435  volElem[i].nPolyGrid,
3436  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant,
3437  config,
3438  standardElementsSol[j].GetOrderExact(),
3439  standardElementsSol[j].GetRDOFs(),
3440  standardElementsSol[j].GetSDOFs(),
3441  standardElementsSol[j].GetTDOFs()) );
3442  volElem[i].indStandardElement = j;
3443  }
3444  }
3445 }
3446 
3447 void CMeshFEM_DG::SetSendReceive(const CConfig *config) {
3448 
3449  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3450  /*--- Step 1: Determine the ranks from which this rank has to receive data ---*/
3451  /*--- during the actual communication of halo data, as well as the ---*/
3452  /* data that must be communicated. ---*/
3453  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3454 
3455  /* Determine for every element the local offset of the solution DOFs.
3456  The if statement in the line below is to avoid problems when the
3457  partition is empty. */
3458  if( nVolElemTot ) volElem[0].offsetDOFsSolLocal = 0;
3459  for(unsigned long i=1; i<nVolElemTot; ++i)
3460  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolLocal = volElem[i-1].offsetDOFsSolLocal
3461  + volElem[i-1].nDOFsSol;
3462 
3463  /* Determine the ranks from which this rank will receive halo data. */
3464  vector<int> recvFromRank(size, 0);
3465  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i)
3466  recvFromRank[volElem[i].rankOriginal] = 1;
3467 
3468  map<int,int> rankToIndRecvBuf;
3469  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
3470  if( recvFromRank[i] ) {
3471  int ind = (int)rankToIndRecvBuf.size();
3472  rankToIndRecvBuf[i] = ind;
3473  }
3474  }
3475 
3476  ranksRecv.resize(rankToIndRecvBuf.size());
3477  map<int,int>::const_iterator MI = rankToIndRecvBuf.begin();
3478  for(unsigned long i=0; i<rankToIndRecvBuf.size(); ++i, ++MI)
3479  ranksRecv[i] = MI->first;
3480 
3481  /* Define and determine the buffers to send the global indices of my halo
3482  elements to the appropriate ranks and the vectors which store the
3483  elements that I will receive from these ranks. */
3484  vector<vector<unsigned long> > longBuf(rankToIndRecvBuf.size(), vector<unsigned long>(0));
3485  entitiesRecv.resize(rankToIndRecvBuf.size());
3486 
3487  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3488  MI = rankToIndRecvBuf.find(volElem[i].rankOriginal);
3489  longBuf[MI->second].push_back(volElem[i].elemIDGlobal);
3490 
3491  entitiesRecv[MI->second].push_back(i);
3492  }
3493 
3494  /* Determine the mapping from global element ID to local owned element ID. */
3495  map<unsigned long,unsigned long> globalElemIDToLocalInd;
3496  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
3497  globalElemIDToLocalInd[volElem[i].elemIDGlobal] = i;
3498 
3499 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
3500 
3501  /*--- Parallel mode. First determine the number of ranks to which this
3502  rank has to send halo data during the actual exchange. ---*/
3503  int nRankSend;
3504  vector<int> sizeReduce(size, 1);
3505 
3506  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(recvFromRank.data(), &nRankSend, sizeReduce.data(),
3507  MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3508 
3509  /* Resize ranksSend and the first index of entitiesSend to the number of
3510  ranks to which this rank has to send data. */
3511  ranksSend.resize(nRankSend);
3512  entitiesSend.resize(nRankSend);
3513 
3514  /*--- Send all the data using non-blocking sends. ---*/
3515  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> commReqs(ranksRecv.size());
3516 
3517  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
3518  int dest = ranksRecv[i];
3519  SU2_MPI::Isend(longBuf[i].data(), longBuf[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG,
3520  dest, dest, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &commReqs[i]);
3521  }
3522 
3523  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data about the
3524  global element ID's that I must send. */
3525  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
3526 
3527  /* Block until a message arrivesi and determine the source. */
3528  SU2_MPI::Status status;
3529  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
3530  ranksSend[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
3531 
3532  /* Determine the size of the message, allocate the memory for the
3533  receive buffer and receive the message. */
3534  int sizeMess;
3535  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
3536 
3537  entitiesSend[i].resize(sizeMess);
3538  SU2_MPI::Recv(entitiesSend[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG,
3539  ranksSend[i], rank, SU2_MPI::GetComm(), &status);
3540 
3541  /* Convert the global indices currently stored in entitiesSend[i]
3542  to local indices. */
3543  for(int j=0; j<sizeMess; ++j) {
3544  map<unsigned long,unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
3545  LMI = globalElemIDToLocalInd.find(entitiesSend[i][j]);
3546 
3547  if(LMI == globalElemIDToLocalInd.end())
3548  SU2_MPI::Error("This should not happen", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3549 
3550  entitiesSend[i][j] = LMI->second;
3551  }
3552  }
3553 
3554  /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the rank, because
3555  wild cards have been used. */
3556  SU2_MPI::Waitall(ranksRecv.size(), commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
3557  SU2_MPI::Barrier(SU2_MPI::GetComm());
3558 
3559 #else
3560  /* Sequential mode. Resize ranksSend and the first index of entitiesSend to
3561  the number of ranks to which this rank has to send data. This number is
3562  only non-zero when periodic boundaries are present in the grid. */
3563  ranksSend.resize(ranksRecv.size());
3564  entitiesSend.resize(ranksRecv.size());
3565 
3566  /* Convert the global element ID's of longBuf to local indices, which are
3567  stored in entitiesSend[0]. Note that an additional test for longBuf.size()
3568  is necessary to avoid problems. */
3569  if( longBuf.size() ) {
3570 
3571  entitiesSend[0].resize(longBuf[0].size());
3572 
3573  for(unsigned long i=0; i<longBuf[0].size(); ++i) {
3574  map<unsigned long,unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
3575  LMI = globalElemIDToLocalInd.find(longBuf[0][i]);
3576 
3577  if(LMI == globalElemIDToLocalInd.end())
3578  SU2_MPI::Error("This should not happen", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3579 
3580  entitiesSend[0][i] = LMI->second;
3581  }
3582  }
3583 
3584 #endif
3585 
3586  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3587  /*--- Step 2: Determine the rotational periodic transformations as well as ---*/
3588  /*--- the halo elements for which these must be applied. ---*/
3589  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3590 
3591  /*--- Loop over the markers and determine the mapping for the rotationally
3592  periodic transformations. The mapping is from the marker to the first
3593  index in the vectors to store the rotationally periodic halo elements. ---*/
3594  map<short,unsigned short> mapRotationalPeriodicToInd;
3595 
3596  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3597  if(config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == PERIODIC_BOUNDARY) {
3598 
3599  auto angles = config->GetPeriodicRotAngles(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker));
3600  if(fabs(angles[0]) > 1.e-5 || fabs(angles[1]) > 1.e-5 || fabs(angles[2]) > 1.e-5) {
3601 
3602  unsigned short curSize = mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.size();
3603  mapRotationalPeriodicToInd[iMarker] = curSize;
3604  }
3605  }
3606  }
3607 
3608  /* Store the rotationally periodic indices in rotPerMarkers. */
3609  rotPerMarkers.reserve(mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.size());
3610  for(map<short,unsigned short>::iterator SMI =mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.begin();
3611  SMI!=mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.end(); ++SMI)
3612  rotPerMarkers.push_back(SMI->first);
3613 
3614  /* Resize the first index of rotPerHalos to the correct size. */
3615  rotPerHalos.resize(mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.size());
3616 
3617  /*--- Loop over the volume elements and store the indices of the rotationally
3618  periodic halo elements in rotPerHalos. ---*/
3619  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3620  if(volElem[i].periodIndexToDonor > -1) {
3621  map<short,unsigned short>::const_iterator SMI;
3622  SMI = mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.find(volElem[i].periodIndexToDonor);
3623 
3624  if(SMI != mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.end())
3625  rotPerHalos[SMI->second].push_back(i);
3626  }
3627  }
3628 }
3629 
3630 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesFace(
3631  const unsigned short VTK_TypeFace,
3632  const unsigned long *cornerPointsFace,
3633  const unsigned short VTK_TypeElem,
3634  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3635  const vector<unsigned long> &elemNodeIDsGrid,
3636  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
3637  const unsigned long *connElem,
3638  bool &swapFaceInElement,
3639  unsigned long *modConnFace,
3640  unsigned long *modConnElem) {
3641 
3642  /*--- Set swapFaceInElement to false. This variable is only relevant for
3643  triangular faces of a pyramid and quadrilateral faces of a prism.
3644  Only for these situations this variable will be passed to the
3645  appropriate functions. ---*/
3646  swapFaceInElement = false;
3647 
3648  /*--- Make a distinction between the types of the volume element and call
3649  the appropriate function to do the actual job. ---*/
3650  switch( VTK_TypeElem ) {
3651  case TRIANGLE:
3652  CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentTriangle(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3653  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3654  connElem, modConnFace,
3655  modConnElem);
3656  break;
3657 
3658  case QUADRILATERAL:
3659  CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentQuadrilateral(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3660  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3661  connElem, modConnFace,
3662  modConnElem);
3663  break;
3664 
3665  case TETRAHEDRON:
3666  CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentTetrahedron(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3667  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3668  connElem, modConnFace,
3669  modConnElem);
3670  break;
3671 
3672  case PYRAMID: {
3673  switch( VTK_TypeFace ) {
3674  case TRIANGLE:
3675  CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPyramid(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3676  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3677  connElem, swapFaceInElement,
3678  modConnFace, modConnElem);
3679  break;
3680 
3681  case QUADRILATERAL:
3682  CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPyramid(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3683  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3684  connElem, modConnFace,
3685  modConnElem);
3686  break;
3687  }
3688 
3689  break;
3690  }
3691 
3692  case PRISM: {
3693  switch( VTK_TypeFace ) {
3694  case TRIANGLE:
3695  CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPrism(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3696  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3697  connElem, modConnFace,
3698  modConnElem);
3699  break;
3700 
3701  case QUADRILATERAL:
3702  CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPrism(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3703  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3704  connElem, swapFaceInElement,
3705  modConnFace, modConnElem);
3706  break;
3707  }
3708 
3709  break;
3710  }
3711 
3712  case HEXAHEDRON:
3713  CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentHexahedron(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3714  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3715  connElem, modConnFace,
3716  modConnElem);
3717  break;
3718  }
3719 }
3720 
3721 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentQuadrilateral(
3722  const unsigned long *cornerPointsLine,
3723  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3724  const vector<unsigned long> &quadNodeIDsGrid,
3725  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
3726  const unsigned long *connQuad,
3727  unsigned long *modConnLine,
3728  unsigned long *modConnQuad) {
3729 
3730  /* Determine the indices of the four corner points of the quadrilateral. */
3731  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
3732  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
3733  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1) -1;
3734  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
3735 
3736  /* Easier storage of the two corner points of the line in the new numbering. */
3737  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsLine[0];
