3738  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsLine[1];
3739 
3740  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
3741  quadNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
3742  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j and jj = d + e*i + f*j, where ii,jj are the
3743  indices of the new numbering and i,j the indices of the numbering used
3744  in quadNodeIDsGrid (and connQuad). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f
3745  depend on how the corner points of the line coincide with the corner points
3746  of the quad. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
3747  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
3748  it is checked for security. ---*/
3749  signed short a=0, b=0, c=0, d=0, e=0, f=0;
3750  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
3751 
3752  if(vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3753  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 0 of the quad connectivity.
3754  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3755  if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind1]){
3756  /* The new numbering is the same as the original numbering. */
3757  a = d = 0; b = f = 1; c = e = 0;
3758  }
3759  else if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) {
3760  /* The i and j numbering are swapped. This is a left handed transformation. */
3761  a = d = 0; b = f = 0; c = e = 1;
3762  }
3763  else {
3764  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3765  }
3766  }
3767  else if(vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3768  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 1 of the quad connectivity.
3769  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3770  if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind2]){
3771  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to the j-direction
3772  of the original numbering, while the new j-direction is the negative
3773  i-direction of the original numbering. */
3774  a = 0; d = nPolyConn; b = f = 0; c = 1; e = -1;
3775  }
3776  else if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3777  /* The i-direction is negated, while the j-direction coincides.
3778  This is a left handed transformation. */
3779  a = nPolyConn; d = 0; b = -1; f = 1; c = e = 0;
3780  }
3781  else {
3782  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3783  }
3784  }
3785  else if(vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3786  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 2 of the quad connectivity.
3787  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3788  if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind3]){
3789  /* Both the i- and j-direction are negated. */
3790  a = d = nPolyConn; b = f = -1; c = e = 0;
3791  }
3792  else if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3793  /* The new i-direction is the original negative j-direction, while the
3794  new j-direction is the original negative i-direction. This is a
3795  left handed transformation. */
3796  a = d = nPolyConn; b = f = 0; c = e = -1;
3797  }
3798  else {
3799  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3800  }
3801  }
3802  else if(vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) {
3803  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 3 of the quad connectivity.
3804  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3805  if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind0]){
3806  /* The new i-direction is the original negative j-direction, while the
3807  new j-direction is the original i-direction. */
3808  a = nPolyConn; d = 0; b = f = 0; c = -1; e = 1;
3809  }
3810  else if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind2]){
3811  /* The i-directions coincide while the j-direction is negated.
3812  This is a left handed transformation. */
3813  a = 0; d = nPolyConn; b = 1; f = -1; c = e = 0;
3814  }
3815  else {
3816  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3817  }
3818  }
3819  else {
3820  /* Vert0 does not match with any of the corner vertices of the quad. */
3821  verticesDontMatch = true;
3822  }
3823 
3824  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
3825  if( verticesDontMatch )
3826  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3827 
3828  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original quad to create the connectivity
3829  of the quad that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
3830  unsigned short ind = 0;
3831  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
3832  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i, ++ind) {
3833 
3834  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it to
3835  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnQuad. ---*/
3836  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c;
3837  unsigned short jj = d + i*e + j*f;
3838  unsigned short iind = jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii;
3839 
3840  modConnQuad[iind] = connQuad[ind];
3841  }
3842  }
3843 
3844  /*--- The line corresponds to face 0 of the quadrilateral. Hence the first
3845  nPolyConn+1 entries in modConnQuad are the DOFs of the line. Copy
3846  these entries from modConnQuad. ---*/
3847  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i)
3848  modConnLine[i] = modConnQuad[i];
3849 }
3850 
3851 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentTriangle(
3852  const unsigned long *cornerPointsLine,
3853  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3854  const vector<unsigned long> &triaNodeIDsGrid,
3855  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
3856  const unsigned long *connTria,
3857  unsigned long *modConnLine,
3858  unsigned long *modConnTria) {
3859 
3860  /* Determine the indices of the 3 corner vertices of the triangle. */
3861  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
3862  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
3863  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)/2 -1;
3864 
3865  /* Easier storage of the two corner points of the line in the new numbering. */
3866  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsLine[0];
3867  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsLine[1];
3868 
3869  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
3870  triaNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
3871  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j and jj = d + e*i + f*j, where ii,jj are the
3872  indices of the new numbering and i,j the indices of the numbering used
3873  in triaNodeIDsGrid (and connTria). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f
3874  depend on how the corner points of the line coincide with the corner points
3875  of the triangle. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
3876  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
3877  it is checked for security. ---*/
3878  signed short a=0, b=0, c=0, d=0, e=0, f=0;
3879  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
3880 
3881  if(vert0 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3882  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 0 of the triangle connectivity.
3883  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3884  if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]){
3885  /* The new numbering is the same as the original numbering. */
3886  a = 0; b = 1; c = 0; d = 0; e = 0; f = 1;
3887  }
3888  else if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3889  /* The i and j numbering are swapped. This is a left handed transformation. */
3890  a = 0; b = 0; c = 1; d = 0; e = 1; f = 0;
3891  }
3892  else {
3893  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3894  }
3895  }
3896  else if(vert0 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3897  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 1 of the triangle connectivity.
3898  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3899  if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]){
3900  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to the j-direction
3901  of the original numbering, while the new j-direction corresponds to
3902  a combination of the original i- and j-direction. */
3903  a = 0; b = 0; c = 1; d = nPolyConn; e = -1; f = -1;
3904  }
3905  else if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3906  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to a combination of
3907  the original i- and j-direction, while the new j-direction corresponds
3908  to the j-direction of the original numbering. This is a left
3909  handed transformation. */
3910  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; c = -1; d = 0; e = 0; f = 1;
3911  }
3912  else {
3913  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3914  }
3915  }
3916  else if(vert0 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3917  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 2 of the triangle connectivity.
3918  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3919  if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]){
3920  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to a combination of
3921  the original i- and j-direction, while the new j-direction corresponds
3922  to the i-direction of the original numbering. */
3923  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; c = -1; d = 0; e = 1; f = 0;
3924  }
3925  else if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3926  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to the i-direction of
3927  the original numbering, while the new j-direction corresponds to a
3928  combination of the original i- and j-direction. This is a left handed
3929  transformation. */
3930  a = 0; b = 1; c = 0; d = nPolyConn; e = -1; f = -1;
3931  }
3932  else {
3933  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3934  }
3935  }
3936 
3937  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
3938  if( verticesDontMatch )
3939  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3940 
3941  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original triangle to create the connectivity
3942  of the triangle that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
3943  unsigned short ind = 0;
3944  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
3945  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=(nPolyConn-j); ++i, ++ind) {
3946 
3947  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it to
3948  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnTria. ---*/
3949  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c;
3950  unsigned short jj = d + i*e + j*f;
3951 
3952  unsigned short iind = jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii - jj*(jj-1)/2;
3953 
3954  modConnTria[iind] = connTria[ind];
3955  }
3956  }
3957 
3958  /*--- The line corresponds to face 0 of the triangle. Hence the first
3959  nPolyConn+1 entries in modConnTria are the DOFs of the line. Copy
3960  these entries from modConnTria. ---*/
3961  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i)
3962  modConnLine[i] = modConnTria[i];
3963 }
3964 
3965 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentHexahedron(
3966  const unsigned long *cornerPointsQuad,
3967  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3968  const vector<unsigned long> &hexaNodeIDsGrid,
3969  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
3970  const unsigned long *connHexa,
3971  unsigned long *modConnQuad,
3972  unsigned long *modConnHexa) {
3973 
3974  /* Determine the indices of the eight corner points of the hexahedron. */
3975  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
3976  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
3977  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1) -1;
3978  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
3979  const unsigned short ind4 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1)*nPolyGrid;
3980  const unsigned short ind5 = ind1 + ind4;
3981  const unsigned short ind6 = ind2 + ind4;
3982  const unsigned short ind7 = ind3 + ind4;
3983 
3984  /* Easier storage of the four corner points of the quad in the new numbering. */
3985  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsQuad[0];
3986  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsQuad[1];
3987  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsQuad[2];
3988  const unsigned long vert3 = cornerPointsQuad[3];
3989 
3990  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
3991  hexaNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
3992  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j + d*k, jj = e + f*i + g*j + h*k and
3993  kk = l + m*i + n*j + o*k, where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new
3994  numbering and i,j,k the indices of the numbering used in in hexaNodeIDsGrid
3995  (and connHexa). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,l,m,n,o
3996  depend on how the corner points of the quad coincide with the corner points
3997  of the hexahedron. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
3998  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
3999  it is checked for security. ---*/
4000  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0,
4001  l = 0, m = 0, n = 0, o = 0;
4002  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4003 
4004  if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4005  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4006  b = g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4007  }
4008  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
4009  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4010  c = f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4011  }
4012  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4013  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = k.
4014  b = h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4015  }
4016  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = k.
4017  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4018  d = f = n = 1; // kk = j.
4019  }
4020  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
4021  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = k.
4022  c = h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4023  }
4024  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = k.
4025  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4026  d = g = m = 1; // kk = i.
4027  }
4028 
4029  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4030  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4031  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4032  }
4033  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4034  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4035  e = nPolyConn; f = -1; c = o = 1; // kk = k.
4036  }
4037  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4038  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = k.
4039  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4040  }
4041  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = k.
4042  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4043  e = nPolyConn; f = -1; d = n = 1; // kk = j.
4044  }
4045  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4046  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = k.
4047  l = nPolyConn; m = -1; c = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4048  }
4049  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = k.
4050  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4051  l = nPolyConn; m = -1; d = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4052  }
4053 
4054  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4055  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4056  a = e = nPolyConn; c = f = -1; o = 1; // kk = k.
4057  }
4058  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4059  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4060  a = e = nPolyConn; b = g = -1; o = 1; // kk = k.
4061  }
4062  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4063  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = k.
4064  a = l = nPolyConn; c = m = -1; h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4065  }
4066  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = k.
4067  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4068  e = l = nPolyConn; g = m = -1; d = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4069  }
4070  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4071  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = k.
4072  a = l = nPolyConn; b = n = -1; h = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4073  }
4074  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = k.
4075  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4076  e = l = nPolyConn; f = n = -1; d = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4077  }
4078 
4079  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4080  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4081  a = nPolyConn; c = -1; f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4082  }
4083  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4084  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4085  e = nPolyConn; g = -1; b = o = 1; // kk = k.
4086  }
4087  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4088  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = k.
4089  a = nPolyConn; c = -1; h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4090  }
4091  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = k.
4092  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4093  e = nPolyConn; g = -1; d = m = 1; // kk = i.
4094  }
4095  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4096  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = k.
4097  l = nPolyConn; n = -1; b = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4098  }
4099  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = k.
4100  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4101  l = nPolyConn; n = -1; d = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4102  }
4103 
4104  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = i.
4105  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = j.
4106  l = nPolyConn; o = -1; b = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4107  }
4108  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = j.
4109  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4110  l = nPolyConn; o = -1; c = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4111  }
4112  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = i.
4113  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4114  e = nPolyConn; h = -1; b = n = 1; // kk = j.
4115  }
4116  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4117  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4118  a = nPolyConn; d = -1; f = n = 1; // kk = j.
4119  }
4120  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = j.
4121  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4122  e = nPolyConn; h = -1; c = m = 1; // kk = i.
4123  }
4124  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4125  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = j.
4126  a = nPolyConn; d = -1; g = m = 1; // kk = i.
4127  }
4128 
4129  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = j.
4130  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4131  e = l = nPolyConn; f = o = -1; c = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4132  }
4133  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4134  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = j.
4135  a = l = nPolyConn; b = o = -1; g = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4136  }
4137  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = j.
4138  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4139  e = l = nPolyConn; h = m = -1; c = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4140  }
4141  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4142  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = j.
4143  a = l = nPolyConn; d = m = -1; g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4144  }
4145  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4146  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4147  a = e = nPolyConn; d = f = -1; n = 1; // kk = j.
4148  }
4149  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4150  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4151  a = e = nPolyConn; b = h = -1; n = 1; // kk = j.
4152  }
4153 
4154  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4155  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4156  a = e = l = nPolyConn; b = g = o = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4157  }
4158  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4159  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4160  a = e = l = nPolyConn; c = f = o = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4161  }
4162  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4163  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4164  a = e = l = nPolyConn; b = h = n = -1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4165  }
4166  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4167  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4168  a = e = l = nPolyConn; d = f = n = -1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4169  }
4170  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4171  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4172  a = e = l = nPolyConn; d = g = m = -1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4173  }
4174  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4175  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4176  a = e = l = nPolyConn; c = h = m = -1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4177  }
4178 
4179  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4180  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = i.
4181  a = l = nPolyConn; c = o = -1; f = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4182  }
4183  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = i.
4184  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4185  e = l = nPolyConn; g = o = -1; b = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4186  }
4187  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4188  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4189  a = e = nPolyConn; c = h = -1; m = 1; // kk = i.
4190  }
4191  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4192  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4193  a = e = nPolyConn; d = g = -1; m = 1; // kk = i.
4194  }
4195  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = i.
4196  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4197  e = l = nPolyConn; h = n = -1; b = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4198  }
4199  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4200  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = i.
4201  a = l = nPolyConn; d = n = -1; f = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4202  }
4203 
4204  else {
4205  verticesDontMatch = true;
4206  }
4207 
4208  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4209  if( verticesDontMatch )
4210  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4211 
4212  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original hexahedron to create the connectivity
4213  of the hexahedron that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4214  const unsigned short nn2 = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+1);
4215  unsigned short ind = 0;
4216  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4217  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
4218  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i, ++ind) {
4219 
4220  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4221  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnHexa. ---*/
4222  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c + k*d;
4223  unsigned short jj = e + i*f + j*g + k*h;
4224  unsigned short kk = l + i*m + j*n + k*o;
4225  unsigned short iind = kk*nn2 + jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii;
4226 
4227  modConnHexa[iind] = connHexa[ind];
4228  }
4229  }
4230  }
4231 
4232  /*--- The quad corresponds to face 0 of the hexahedron. Hence the first
4233  nn2 entries in modConnHexa are the DOFs of the quad. Copy
4234  these entries from modConnHexa. ---*/
4235  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nn2; ++i)
4236  modConnQuad[i] = modConnHexa[i];
4237 }
4238 
4239 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPrism(
4240  const unsigned long *cornerPointsQuad,
4241  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4242  const vector<unsigned long> &prismNodeIDsGrid,
4243  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4244  const unsigned long *connPrism,
4245  bool &swapFaceInElement,
4246  unsigned long *modConnQuad,
4247  unsigned long *modConnPrism) {
4248 
4249  /* Determine the indices of the six corner points of the prism. */
4250  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4251  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4252  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)/2 -1;
4253  const unsigned short ind3 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)*nPolyGrid/2;
4254  const unsigned short ind4 = ind1 + ind3;
4255  const unsigned short ind5 = ind2 + ind3;
4256 
4257  /* Easier storage of the four corner points of the quad in the new numbering. */
4258  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsQuad[0];
4259  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsQuad[1];
4260  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsQuad[2];
4261  const unsigned long vert3 = cornerPointsQuad[3];
4262 
4263  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4264  prismNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is
4265  of the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = g + h*k,
4266  where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices
4267  of the numbering used in in prismNodeIDsGrid (and connPrism). Note that
4268  the k-direction can at most be reversed compared to the original definition.
4269  This is due to the way the basis functions are defined for a prism. As a
4270  consequence also the variable swapFaceInElement is needed to cover all
4271  possible situations. The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h depend
4272  on how the corner points of the quad coincide with the corner points of the
4273  prism. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to
4274  check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked
4275  for security. ---*/
4276  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0;
4277  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4278 
4279  if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4280  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4281  b = f = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4282  }
4283  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = i.
4284  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = j.
4285  b = f = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4286  }
4287  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4288  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = i.
4289  c = e = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4290  }
4291  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
4292  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4293  c = e = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4294  }
4295 
4296  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4297  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = j.
4298  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; f = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4299  }
4300  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4301  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = j.
4302  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; f = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4303  }
4304  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4305  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4306  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; c = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4307  }
4308  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = j.
4309  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4310  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; c = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4311  }
4312 
4313  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4314  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4315  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; e = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4316  }
4317  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4318  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = i.
4319  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; e = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4320  }
4321  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4322  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4323  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; b = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4324  }
4325  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = i.
4326  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4327  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; b = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4328  }
4329 
4330  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4331  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = j.
4332  g = nPolyConn; b = f = 1; h = -1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4333  }
4334  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = i.
4335  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = j.
4336  g = nPolyConn; b = f = 1; h = -1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4337  }
4338  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4339  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = i.
4340  g = nPolyConn; c = e = 1; h = -1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4341  }
4342  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = j.
4343  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4344  g = nPolyConn; c = e = 1; h = -1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4345  }
4346 
4347  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4348  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = j.
4349  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; f = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4350  }
4351  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4352  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4353  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; f = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4354  }
4355  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4356  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4357  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; c = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4358  }
4359  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = j.
4360  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4361  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; c = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4362  }
4363 
4364  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4365  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4366  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; e = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4367  }
4368  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4369  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = i.
4370  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; e = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4371  }
4372  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4373  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4374  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; b = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4375  }
4376  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4377  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4378  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; b = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4379  }
4380 
4381  else {
4382  verticesDontMatch = true;
4383  }
4384 
4385  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4386  if( verticesDontMatch )
4387  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4388 
4389  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original prism to create the connectivity
4390  of the prism that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4391  const unsigned short kOff = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+2)/2;
4392  unsigned short ind = 0;
4393  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4394  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
4395  unsigned short uppBoundI = nPolyConn - j;
4396  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=uppBoundI; ++i, ++ind) {
4397 
4398  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4399  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPrism. ---*/
4400  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c;
4401  unsigned short jj = d + i*e + j*f;
4402  unsigned short kk = g + h*k;
4403  unsigned short iind = kk*kOff + jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii - jj*(jj-1)/2;
4404 
4405  modConnPrism[iind] = connPrism[ind];
4406  }
4407  }
4408  }
4409 
4410  /*--- Determine the connectivity of the quadrilateral face. ---*/
4411  if( swapFaceInElement ) {
4412 
4413  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the quad must be swapped
4414  w.r.t. to the parametric coordinates of the face of the prism.
4415  This means that the coordinate r of the quad runs from the base
4416  triangle to the top triangle of the prism. This corresponds to
4417  the k-direction of the prism. Hence the s-direction of the quad
4418  corresponds to the i-direction of the prism. ---*/
4419  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4420  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i) {
4421  const unsigned short iind = i*(nPolyConn+1) + k;
4422  modConnQuad[iind] = modConnPrism[k*kOff+i];
4423  }
4424  }
4425  }
4426  else {
4427  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the quad correspond to the
4428  parametric coordinates in i- and k-direction of the face of the
4429  prism. So an easy copy can be made. ---*/
4430  unsigned short iind = 0;
4431  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4432  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i, ++iind) {
4433  modConnQuad[iind] = modConnPrism[k*kOff+i];
4434  }
4435  }
4436  }
4437 }
4438 
4439 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPyramid(
4440  const unsigned long *cornerPointsQuad,
4441  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4442  const vector<unsigned long> &pyraNodeIDsGrid,
4443  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4444  const unsigned long *connPyra,
4445  unsigned long *modConnQuad,
4446  unsigned long *modConnPyra) {
4447 
4448  /* Determine the indices of the four corner points of the quadrilateral
4449  base of the pyramid. Note that the top of the pyramid is not needed
4450  in the comparison, because only triangular faces are attached to it. */
4451  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4452  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4453  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1) -1;
4454  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
4455 
4456  /* Easier storage of the four corner points of the quad in the new numbering. */
4457  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsQuad[0];
4458  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsQuad[1];
4459  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsQuad[2];
4460  const unsigned long vert3 = cornerPointsQuad[3];
4461 
4462  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4463  pyraNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4464  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = k, where
4465  ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices of
4466  the numbering used in in pyraNodeIDsGrid (and connPyra). The values of
4467  the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f depend on how the corner points of the quad
4468  coincide with the corner points of the quadrilateral base of the pyramid.
4469  This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to check
4470  if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked for
4471  security. Note that this mapping is less complicated than for a prism or
4472  hexahedron, because a pyramid only has one quadrilateral face and hence
4473  the k-direction has to match. ---*/
4474  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0;
4475  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4476 
4477  if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4478  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4479  b = f = 1;
4480  }
4481  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
4482  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4483  c = e = 1;
4484  }
4485 
4486  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4487  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4488  d = nPolyConn; c = 1; e = -1;
4489  }
4490  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4491  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4492  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; f = 1;
4493  }
4494 
4495  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4496  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4497  a = d = nPolyConn; b = f = -1;
4498  }
4499  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4500  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4501  a = d = nPolyConn; c = e = -1;
4502  }
4503 
4504  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4505  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4506  a = nPolyConn; c = -1; e = 1;
4507  }
4508  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4509  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4510  d = nPolyConn; b = 1; f = -1;
4511  }
4512 
4513  else {
4514  verticesDontMatch = true;
4515  }
4516 
4517  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4518  if( verticesDontMatch )
4519  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4520 
4521  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original pyramid to create the connectivity
4522  of the pyramid that corresponds to the new numbering. Note that the
4523  outer k-loop is the same for both numberings. ---*/
4524  unsigned short mPoly = nPolyConn;
4525  unsigned short offLevel = 0;
4526 
4527  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4528  unsigned short ind = offLevel;
4529 
4530  /* The variables of a and d in the transformation are actually flexible. */
4531  /* Create the correct values of a and d for the current k-level. */
4532  const signed short aa = a ? mPoly : 0;
4533  const signed short dd = d ? mPoly : 0;
4534 
4535  /* Loop over the DOFs of the current quadrilateral. */
4536  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=mPoly; ++j) {
4537  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=mPoly; ++i, ++ind) {
4538 
4539  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it
4540  to a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPyra. ---*/
4541  unsigned short ii = aa + i*b + j*c;
4542  unsigned short jj = dd + i*e + j*f;
4543  unsigned short iind = offLevel + jj*(mPoly+1) + ii;
4544 
4545  modConnPyra[iind] = connPyra[ind];
4546  }
4547  }
4548 
4549  /* Update offLevel for the next quadrilateral level of the pyramid. */
4550  offLevel += (mPoly+1)*(mPoly+1);
4551  }
4552 
4553  /*--- The quad corresponds to face 0 of the pyramid. Hence the first
4554  nn2 entries in modConnPyra are the DOFs of the quad. Copy
4555  these entries from modConnPyra. ---*/
4556  const unsigned short nn2 = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+1);
4557  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nn2; ++i)
4558  modConnQuad[i] = modConnPyra[i];
4559 }
4560 
4561 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPrism(
4562  const unsigned long *cornerPointsTria,
4563  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4564  const vector<unsigned long> &prismNodeIDsGrid,
4565  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4566  const unsigned long *connPrism,
4567  unsigned long *modConnTria,
4568  unsigned long *modConnPrism) {
4569 
4570  /* Determine the indices of the six corner points of the prism. */
4571  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4572  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4573  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)/2 -1;
4574  const unsigned short ind3 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)*nPolyGrid/2;
4575  const unsigned short ind4 = ind1 + ind3;
4576  const unsigned short ind5 = ind2 + ind3;
4577 
4578  /* Easier storage of the three corner points of the triangle in the new numbering. */
4579  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsTria[0];
4580  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsTria[1];
4581  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsTria[2];
4582 
4583  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4584  prismNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is
4585  of the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = g + h*k,
4586  where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices
4587  of the numbering used in in prismNodeIDsGrid (and connPrism). Note that
4588  the k-direction can at most be reversed compared to the original definition.
4589  This is due to the way the basis functions are defined for a prism.
4590  The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h depend on how the corner
4591  points of the triangle coincide with the corner points of the prism. This
4592  is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to check if vertices
4593  do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked for security. ---*/
4594  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0;
4595  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4596 
4597  if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4598  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4599  b = f = h = 1; // kk = k.
4600  }
4601  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4602  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4603  c = e = h = 1; // kk = k.
4604  }
4605 
4606  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4607  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4608  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; f = h = 1; // kk = k.
4609  }
4610  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4611  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4612  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; c = h = 1; // kk = k.
4613  }
4614 
4615  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4616  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4617  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; e = h = 1; // kk = k.
4618  }
4619  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4620  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4621  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; b = h = 1; // kk = k.
4622  }
4623 
4624  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4625  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = j.
4626  g = nPolyConn; b = f = 1; h = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4627  }
4628  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4629  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = i.
4630  g = nPolyConn; c = e = 1; h = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4631  }
4632 
4633  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4634  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = j.
4635  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; f = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4636  }
4637  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4638  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4639  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; c = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4640  }
4641 
4642  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4643  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = i.
4644  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; e = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4645  }
4646  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4647  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4648  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; b = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4649  }
4650 
4651  else {
4652  verticesDontMatch = true;
4653  }
4654 
4655  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4656  if( verticesDontMatch )
4657  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4658 
4659  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original prism to create the connectivity
4660  of the prism that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4661  const unsigned short kOff = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+2)/2;
4662  unsigned short ind = 0;
4663  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4664  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
4665  unsigned short uppBoundI = nPolyConn - j;
4666  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=uppBoundI; ++i, ++ind) {
4667 
4668  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4669  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPrism. ---*/
4670  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c;
4671  unsigned short jj = d + i*e + j*f;
4672  unsigned short kk = g + h*k;
4673  unsigned short iind = kk*kOff + jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii - jj*(jj-1)/2;
4674 
4675  modConnPrism[iind] = connPrism[ind];
4676  }
4677  }
4678  }
4679 
4680  /*--- The triangle corresponds to face 0 of the prism. Hence the first
4681  kOff entries in modConnPrism are the DOFs of the triangle. Copy
4682  these entries from modConnPrism. ---*/
4683  for(unsigned short i=0; i<kOff; ++i)
4684  modConnTria[i] = modConnPrism[i];
4685 }
4686 
4687 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPyramid(
4688  const unsigned long *cornerPointsTria,
4689  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4690  const vector<unsigned long> &pyraNodeIDsGrid,
4691  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4692  const unsigned long *connPyra,
4693  bool &swapFaceInElement,
4694  unsigned long *modConnTria,
4695  unsigned long *modConnPyra) {
4696 
4697  /* Determine the indices of the five corner points of the pyramid. */
4698  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4699  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4700  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1) -1;
4701  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
4702  const unsigned short ind4 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)*(2*nPolyGrid+3)/6 -1;
4703 
4704  /* Check if the top of the pyramid coincides with either corner point 1 or
4705  corner point 2 of the triangle. Set swapFaceInElement accordingly. */
4706  if( cornerPointsTria[1] == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) swapFaceInElement = true;
4707  else if(cornerPointsTria[2] == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) swapFaceInElement = false;
4708  else
4709  SU2_MPI::Error(string("Top of the pyramid does not coincide with either corner point 1 or 2.\n") +
4710  string("This should not happen"), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4711 
4712  /* Easier storage of the two other corner points of the triangle in the new numbering.
4713  vert0 always corresponds to cornerPointsTria[0], while vert1 contains the other
4714  point that is not equal to the top of the pyramid. This depends on swapFaceInElement. */
4715  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsTria[0];
4716  const unsigned long vert1 = swapFaceInElement ? cornerPointsTria[2] : cornerPointsTria[1];
4717 
4718  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4719  pyraNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4720  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = k, where
4721  ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices of
4722  the numbering used in in pyraNodeIDsGrid (and connPyra). The values of
4723  the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f depend on how the corner points of the triangle
4724  coincide with the corner points of the triangular face of the pyramid.
4725  This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to check
4726  if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked for
4727  security. ---*/
4728  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0;
4729  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4730 
4731  if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // ii = i.
4732  b = f = 1; // jj = j.
4733  }
4734  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // ii = j.
4735  c = e = 1; // jj = i.
4736  }
4737 
4738  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // ii = j.
4739  d = nPolyConn; c = 1; e = -1; // jj = nPoly-i.
4740  }
4741  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // ii = nPoly-i.
4742  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; f = 1; // jj = j.
4743  }
4744 
4745  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // ii = nPoly-i.
4746  a = d = nPolyConn; b = f = -1; // jj = nPoly-j.
4747  }
4748  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // ii = nPoly-j.
4749  a = d = nPolyConn; c = e = -1; // jj = nPoly-i.
4750  }
4751 
4752  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // ii = nPoly-j.
4753  a = nPolyConn; c = -1; e = 1; // jj = i.
4754  }
4755  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // ii = i.
4756  d = nPolyConn; b = 1; f = -1; // jj = nPoly-j.
4757  }
4758 
4759  else {
4760  verticesDontMatch = true;
4761  }
4762 
4763  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4764  if( verticesDontMatch )
4765  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4766 
4767  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original pyramid to create the connectivity
4768  of the pyramid that corresponds to the new numbering. Note that the
4769  outer k-loop is the same for both numberings. ---*/
4770  unsigned short mPoly = nPolyConn;
4771  unsigned short offLevel = 0;
4772 
4773  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4774  unsigned short ind = offLevel;
4775 
4776  /* The variables of a and d in the transformation are actually flexible. */
4777  /* Create the correct values of a and d for the current k-level. */
4778  const signed short aa = a ? mPoly : 0;
4779  const signed short dd = d ? mPoly : 0;
4780 
4781  /* Loop over the DOFs of the current quadrilateral. */
4782  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=mPoly; ++j) {
4783  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=mPoly; ++i, ++ind) {
4784 
4785  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it
4786  to a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPyra. ---*/
4787  unsigned short ii = aa + i*b + j*c;
4788  unsigned short jj = dd + i*e + j*f;
4789  unsigned short iind = offLevel + jj*(mPoly+1) + ii;
4790 
4791  modConnPyra[iind] = connPyra[ind];
4792  }
4793  }
4794 
4795  /* Update offLevel for the next quadrilateral level of the pyramid. */
4796  offLevel += (mPoly+1)*(mPoly+1);
4797  }
4798 
4799  /*--- Determine the connectivity of the triangular face. ---*/
4800  if( swapFaceInElement ) {
4801 
4802  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the triangle must be swapped
4803  w.r.t. to the parametric coordinates of the face of the pyramid.
4804  This means that the coordinate r of the triangle runs from the base
4805  to the top of the pyramid. This corresponds to the k-direction of the
4806  pyramid. Hence the s-direction of the triangle corresponds to the
4807  i-direction of the pyramid. ---*/
4808  mPoly = nPolyConn;
4809  offLevel = 0;
4810  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4811  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=mPoly; ++i) {
4812  unsigned short iind = i*(nPolyConn+1) + k - i*(i-1)/2;
4813  modConnTria[iind] = modConnPyra[offLevel+i];
4814  }
4815  offLevel += (mPoly+1)*(mPoly+1);
4816  }
4817  }
4818  else {
4819  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the triangle correspond to the
4820  parametric coordinates in i- and k-direction of the face of the
4821  pyramid. So an easy copy can be made. ---*/
4822  mPoly = nPolyConn;
4823  offLevel = 0;
4824  unsigned short iind = 0;
4825  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4826  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=mPoly; ++i, ++iind) {
4827  modConnTria[iind] = modConnPyra[offLevel+i];
4828  }
4829  offLevel += (mPoly+1)*(mPoly+1);
4830  }
4831  }
4832 }
4833 
4834 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentTetrahedron(
4835  const unsigned long *cornerPointsTria,
4836  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4837  const vector<unsigned long> &tetNodeIDsGrid,
4838  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4839  const unsigned long *connTet,
4840  unsigned long *modConnTria,
4841  unsigned long *modConnTet) {
4842 
4843  /* Determine the indices of the four corner points of the tetrahedron. */
4844  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4845  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4846  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)/2 -1;
4847  const unsigned short ind3 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)*(nPolyGrid+3)/6 -1;
4848 
4849  /* Easier storage of the three corner points of the triangle in the new numbering. */
4850  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsTria[0];
4851  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsTria[1];
4852  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsTria[2];
4853 
4854  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4855  tetNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4856  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j + d*k, jj = e + f*i + g*j + h*k and
4857  kk = l + m*i + n*j + o*k, where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new
4858  numbering and i,j,k the indices of the numbering used in in tetNodeIDsGrid
4859  (and connTet). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,l,m,n,o
4860  depend on how the corner points of the triangle coincide with the corner points
4861  of the tetrahedron. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
4862  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
4863  it is checked for security. ---*/
4864  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0,
4865  l = 0, m = 0, n = 0, o = 0;
4866  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4867 
4868  if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4869  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4870  b = g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4871  }
4872  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4873  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4874  c = f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4875  }
4876  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4877  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4878  b = h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4879  }
4880  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4881  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4882  d = f = n = 1; // kk = j.
4883  }
4884  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4885  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4886  c = h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4887  }
4888  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4889  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4890  d = g = m = 1; // kk = i.
4891  }
4892 
4893  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4894  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4895  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4896  }
4897  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4898  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4899  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; c = o = 1; // kk = k.
4900  }
4901  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4902  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4903  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4904  }
4905  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4906  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4907  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; d = n = 1; // kk = j.
4908  }
4909  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4910  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4911  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; c = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4912  }
4913  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4914  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4915  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; d = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4916  }
4917 
4918  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4919  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4920  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4921  }
4922  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4923  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4924  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; b = o = 1; // kk = k.
4925  }
4926  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4927  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4928  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4929  }
4930  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4931  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4932  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; d = m = 1; // kk = i.
4933  }
4934  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4935  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4936  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4937  }
4938  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4939  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4940  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; b = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4941  }
4942  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4943  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4944  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; d = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4945  }
4946 
4947  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4948  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4949  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; f = n = 1; // kk = j.
4950  }
4951  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4952  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4953  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; b = n = 1; // kk = j.
4954  }
4955  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4956  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4957  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; g = m = 1; // kk = i.
4958  }
4959  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4960  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4961  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; c = m = 1; // kk = i.
4962  }
4963  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4964  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4965  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; b = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4966  }
4967  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4968  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4969  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; c = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4970  }
4971 
4972  else {
4973  verticesDontMatch = true;
4974  }
4975 
4976  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4977  if( verticesDontMatch )
4978  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4979 
4980  /*--- Some constants to convert the (ii,jj,kk) indices to a 1D index. ---*/
4981  const unsigned short abv1 = (11 + 12*nPolyConn + 3*nPolyConn*nPolyConn);
4982  const unsigned short abv2 = (2*nPolyConn + 3)*3;
4983  const unsigned short abv3 = (nPolyConn + 2)*3;
4984 
4985  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original tetrahedron to create the connectivity
4986  of the tetrahedron that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4987  unsigned short ind = 0;
4988  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4989  unsigned short uppBoundJ = nPolyConn - k;
4990  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=uppBoundJ; ++j) {
4991  unsigned short uppBoundI = nPolyConn - k - j;
4992  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=uppBoundI; ++i, ++ind) {
4993 
4994  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4995  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnTet. ---*/
4996  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c + k*d;
4997  unsigned short jj = e + i*f + j*g + k*h;
4998  unsigned short kk = l + i*m + j*n + k*o;
4999  unsigned short iind = (abv1*kk + abv2*jj + 6*ii - abv3*kk*kk
5000  - 6*kk*jj - 3*jj*jj + kk*kk*kk)/6;
5001 
5002  modConnTet[iind] = connTet[ind];
5003  }
5004  }
5005  }
5006 
5007  /*--- The triangle corresponds to face 0 of the tetrahedron. Hence the first
5008  nn2 entries in modConnTet are the DOFs of the triangle. Copy these
5009  entries from modConnTet. ---*/
5010  const unsigned short nn2 = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+2)/2;
5011  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nn2; ++i)
5012  modConnTria[i] = modConnTet[i];
5013 }
5014 
5015 void CMeshFEM_DG::MetricTermsMatchingFaces(CConfig *config) {
5016 
5017  /* Determine whether or not the viscous terms are needed. */
5018  bool viscousTerms = (config->GetKind_Solver() != MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_EULER && config->GetKind_Solver() != MAIN_SOLVER::DISC_ADJ_FEM_EULER);
5019 
5020  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
5021  for(unsigned long i=0; i<matchingFaces.size(); ++i) {
5022 
5023  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5024  /*--- Step 1: Allocate the memory for the face metric terms. ---*/
5025  /*--- Depending on the case, not all of this memory is needed. ---*/
5026  /*--- - Unit normals + area (nDim+1 per integration point) ---*/
5027  /*--- - drdx, dsdx, etc. for both sides (nDim*nDim per ---*/
5028  /*--- integration point) ---*/
5029  /*--- - grid velocities in the integration points. ---*/
5030  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5031 
5032  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
5033  relevant information from it. */
5034  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[i].indStandardElement;
5035  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5036 
5037  /* Allocate the memory for the vectors to store the different face
5038  metric terms. */
5039  matchingFaces[i].metricNormalsFace.resize(nInt*(nDim+1));
5040 
5041  if( viscousTerms ) {
5042  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace0.resize(nInt*nDim*nDim);
5043  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace1.resize(nInt*nDim*nDim);
5044  }
5045 
5046  /* Allocate the memory for the grid velocities and initialize them to the
5047  default value of zero. */
5048  matchingFaces[i].gridVelocities.assign(nInt*nDim, 0.0);
5049 
5050  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5051  /*--- Step 2: Determine the actual metric data in the integration points ---*/
5052  /*--- of the faces. ---*/
5053  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5054 
5055  /* Call the function ComputeNormalsFace to compute the unit normals and
5056  its corresponding area in the integration points. The data from side 0
5057  is used, but the data from side 1 should give the same result. */
5058  unsigned short nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
5059  const su2double *dr = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetDrBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
5060  const su2double *ds = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetDsBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
5061 
5062  ComputeNormalsFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr, ds, matchingFaces[i].DOFsGridFaceSide0.data(),
5063  matchingFaces[i].metricNormalsFace.data());
5064 
5065  /* Check whether the viscous terms are needed in the discretization. */
5066  if( viscousTerms ) {
5067 
5068  /* Compute the derivatives of the parametric coordinates w.r.t. the
5069  Cartesian coordinates, i.e. drdx, drdy, etc. in the integration points
5070  on side 0 of the face. */
5071  nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsElemSide0();
5072  dr = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisElemIntegrationSide0();
5073 
5074  ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr,
5075  matchingFaces[i].DOFsGridElementSide0.data(),
5076  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace0.data(),
5077  config);
5078 
5079  /* Compute the derivatives of the parametric coordinates w.r.t. the
5080  Cartesian coordinates, i.e. drdx, drdy, etc. in the integration points
5081  on side 1 of the face. */
5082  nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsElemSide1();
5083  dr = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisElemIntegrationSide1();
5084 
5085  ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr,
5086  matchingFaces[i].DOFsGridElementSide1.data(),
5087  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace1.data(),
5088  config);
5089  }
5090  }
5091 }
5092 
5093 void CMeshFEM_DG::LengthScaleVolumeElements(void) {
5094 
5095  /* Initialize the length scale of the elements to zero. */
5096  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i)
5097  volElem[i].lenScale = 0.0;
5098 
5099  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5100  /*--- Step 1: Determine the maximum value of the Jacobians of the ---*/
5101  /*--- surrounding faces of the elements. ---*/
5102  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5103 
5104  /*--- First the physical boundaries. Loop over them. ---*/
5105  for(unsigned short j=0; j<boundaries.size(); ++j) {
5106  if( !boundaries[j].periodicBoundary ) {
5107  for(unsigned long i=0; i<boundaries[j].surfElem.size(); ++i) {
5108 
5109  /* Easier storage of corresponding volume element and the metric data
5110  for the normals of this surface element, determine the number of
5111  integration points for this surface element and loop over them. */
5112  const unsigned long volInd = boundaries[j].surfElem[i].volElemID;
5113  const su2double *normals = boundaries[j].surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace.data();
5114  const unsigned short ind = boundaries[j].surfElem[i].indStandardElement;
5115  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5116 
5117  /* Loop over the integration points and determine the maximum area
5118  scale for this face. This is stored in the variable lenScale of
5119  the corresponding volume element. */
5120  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nInt; ++k)
5121  volElem[volInd].lenScale = max(volElem[volInd].lenScale,
5122  normals[k*(nDim+1)+nDim]);
5123  }
5124  }
5125  }
5126 
5127  /*--- Loop over the matching internal faces to update the maximum Jacobian
5128  of the surrounding faces. ---*/
5129  for(unsigned long i=0; i<matchingFaces.size(); ++i) {
5130 
5131  /* Easier storage of the ID's of the two adjacent elements, determine the
5132  corresponding standard face element, the number of integration points
5133  and store the metric data of the face a bit easier. */
5134  const unsigned long v0 = matchingFaces[i].elemID0;
5135  const unsigned long v1 = matchingFaces[i].elemID1;
5136  const su2double *normals = matchingFaces[i].metricNormalsFace.data();
5137  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[i].indStandardElement;
5138  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5139 
5140  /* Loop over the integration points and determine the maximum area
5141  scale for this face. This is stored in the variable lenScale of
5142  the neigbhoring volume elements. */
5143  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nInt; ++k) {
5144  const su2double area = normals[k*(nDim+1)+nDim];
5145  volElem[v0].lenScale = max(volElem[v0].lenScale, area);
5146  volElem[v1].lenScale = max(volElem[v1].lenScale, area);
5147  }
5148  }
5149 
5150  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5151  /*--- Step 2: Communicate the currently stored data of the halo ---*/
5152  /*--- elements to the ranks where the original is stored. ---*/
5153  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5154 
5155 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5156 
5157  /*--- Define the buffers needed for the communication. ---*/
5158  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> sendRequests(ranksSend.size());
5159  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> recvRequests(ranksRecv.size());
5160 
5161  vector<vector<su2double> > sendBuf(ranksSend.size());
5162  vector<vector<su2double> > recvBuf(ranksRecv.size());
5163 
5164  /*--- Send the data using non-blocking sends. Exclude self communication.
5165  Note that the inverse communication pattern must be used for this
5166  purpose. ---*/
5167  unsigned long nRecvRequests = 0;
5168  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
5169  if(ranksRecv[i] != rank) {
5170 
5171  /* Allocate the memory for communication buffer. */
5172  recvBuf[i].resize(entitiesRecv[i].size());
5173 
5174  /* Fill the buffer to be sent, which is the receive
5175  information of the original communication pattern. */
5176  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesRecv[i].size(); ++j)
5177  recvBuf[i][j] = volElem[entitiesRecv[i][j]].lenScale;
5178 
5179  /* Send the data. */
5180  SU2_MPI::Isend(recvBuf[i].data(), recvBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
5181  ranksRecv[i], ranksRecv[i]+10, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
5182  &recvRequests[nRecvRequests++]);
5183  }
5184  }
5185 
5186  /*--- Post the receives using non-blocking receives. Exclude self communication.
5187  Also here the inverse communication pattern must be used. ---*/
5188  unsigned long nSendRequests = 0;
5189  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
5190  if(ranksSend[i] != rank) {
5191 
5192  /* Allocate the memory for communication buffer and post the receive. */
5193  sendBuf[i].resize(entitiesSend[i].size());
5194 
5195  SU2_MPI::Irecv(sendBuf[i].data(), sendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
5196  ranksSend[i], rank+10, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
5197  &sendRequests[nSendRequests++]);
5198  }
5199  }
5200 
5201 #endif
5202 
5203  /*--- Carry out the self communication, if needed. Note that this part
5204  is outside the MPI part. First determine if self communication
5205  takes place at all. ---*/
5206  bool selfComm = false;
5207  unsigned long selfRecvInd, selfSendInd = 0;
5208  for(selfRecvInd=0; selfRecvInd<ranksRecv.size(); ++selfRecvInd) {
5209  if(ranksRecv[selfRecvInd] == rank) {
5210  selfComm = true;
5211  break;
5212  }
5213  }
5214 
5215  /*--- Determine the send index for self communication and update the
5216  data of the owners with the halo data, if self communication
5217  takes place. ---*/
5218  if( selfComm ) {
5219  for(selfSendInd=0; selfSendInd<ranksSend.size(); ++selfSendInd) {
5220  if(ranksSend[selfSendInd] == rank) break;
5221  }
5222 
5223  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesSend[selfSendInd].size(); ++j) {
5224  const unsigned long v0 = entitiesSend[selfSendInd][j];
5225  const unsigned long v1 = entitiesRecv[selfRecvInd][j];
5226 
5227  volElem[v0].lenScale = max(volElem[v0].lenScale, volElem[v1].lenScale);
5228  }
5229  }
5230 
5231 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5232 
5233  /*--- Complete the nonblocking communication. ---*/
5234  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRecvRequests, recvRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5235  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nSendRequests, sendRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5236 
5237  /*--- Update the variable currently stored in lenScale for the
5238  owned elements. ---*/
5239  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
5240  if(ranksSend[i] != rank) {
5241  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesSend[i].size(); ++j) {
5242  const unsigned long ind = entitiesSend[i][j];
5243  volElem[ind].lenScale = max(volElem[ind].lenScale, sendBuf[i][j]);
5244  }
5245  }
5246  }
5247 
5248 #endif
5249 
5250  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5251  /*--- Step 3: Determine the minimum value of the Jacobians of the ---*/
5252  /*--- elements and from that the length scale of the ---*/
5253  /*--- owned elements. ---*/
5254  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5255 
5256  /* Determine the number of metric terms per integration point.
5257  This depends on the number of spatial dimensions of the problem. */
5258  const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = nDim*nDim + 1;
5259 
5260  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5261  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5262 
5263  /* Easier storage of the metric terms and determine the number of
5264  integration points for this element. */
5265  const su2double *metric = volElem[i].metricTerms.data();
5266  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5267  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5268 
5269  /* Loop over the integration points and determine the minimum Jacobian
5270  for this element. Note that the Jacobian is the first variable stored
5271  in the metric terms of the integration points. */
5272  su2double minJacElem = metric[0];
5273  for(unsigned short k=1; k<nInt; ++k)
5274  minJacElem = min(minJacElem, metric[k*nMetricPerPoint]);
5275 
5276  /* Determine the length scale of the element, for which the length
5277  scale of the reference element, 2.0, must be taken into account. */
5278  const su2double maxJacFaces = volElem[i].lenScale;
5279  volElem[i].lenScale = 2.0*minJacElem/maxJacFaces;
5280  }
5281 
5282  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5283  /*--- Step 4: Set the length scale for the halo elements. ---*/
5284  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5285 
5286 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5287 
5288  /*--- Send the data using non-blocking sends. Exclude self communication. ---*/
5289  nSendRequests = 0;
5290  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
5291  if(ranksSend[i] != rank) {
5292 
5293  /* Fill the send buffer. */
5294  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesSend[i].size(); ++j)
5295  sendBuf[i][j] = volElem[entitiesSend[i][j]].lenScale;
5296 
5297  /* Send the data. */
5298  SU2_MPI::Isend(sendBuf[i].data(), sendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
5299  ranksSend[i], ranksSend[i]+20, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
5300  &sendRequests[nSendRequests++]);
5301  }
5302  }
5303 
5304  /*--- Post the receives using non-blocking receives.
5305  Exclude self communication. ---*/
5306  nRecvRequests = 0;
5307  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
5308  if(ranksRecv[i] != rank) {
5309 
5310  /* Post the nonblocking receive. */
5311  SU2_MPI::Irecv(recvBuf[i].data(), recvBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
5312  ranksRecv[i], rank+20, SU2_MPI::GetComm(),
5313  &recvRequests[nRecvRequests++]);
5314  }
5315  }
5316 
5317 #endif
5318 
5319  /*--- Carry out the self communication, if needed. Note that this part
5320  is outside the MPI part. ---*/
5321  if( selfComm ) {
5322  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesSend[selfSendInd].size(); ++j) {
5323  const unsigned long v0 = entitiesSend[selfSendInd][j];
5324  const unsigned long v1 = entitiesRecv[selfRecvInd][j];
5325  volElem[v1].lenScale = volElem[v0].lenScale;
5326  }
5327  }
5328 
5329 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5330 
5331  /*--- Complete the nonblocking communication. ---*/
5332  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nSendRequests, sendRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5333  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRecvRequests, recvRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5334 
5335  /*--- Copy the data from the receive buffers into the volElem. ---*/
5336  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
5337  if(ranksRecv[i] != rank) {
5338  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesRecv[i].size(); ++j)
5339  volElem[entitiesRecv[i][j]].lenScale = recvBuf[i][j];
5340  }
5341  }
5342 
5343 #endif
5344 }
5345 
5346 void CMeshFEM_DG::MetricTermsSurfaceElements(CConfig *config) {
5347 
5348  /*--- Compute the metric terms of the internal matching faces. ---*/
5349  MetricTermsMatchingFaces(config);
5350 
5351  /*--- Loop over the physical boundaries and compute the metric
5352  terms of the boundary. ---*/
5353  for(unsigned short i=0; i<boundaries.size(); ++i) {
5354  if( !boundaries[i].periodicBoundary )
5355  MetricTermsBoundaryFaces(&boundaries[i], config);
5356  }
5357 }
5358 
5359 void CMeshFEM_DG::MetricTermsVolumeElements(CConfig *config) {
5360 
5361  /* Find out whether or not the full, inverse of the full and the lumped mass
5362  matrices are needed. In principle always the full mass matrix is used,
5363  unless the user explicitly indices to use the lumped mass matrix for
5364  steady and dual time stepping. Note that for the DG_FEM the mass matrix
5365  is local to the elements. Finally, when the non-aliased predictor is used
5366  for ADER-DG for the Navier-Stokes equations, the derivatives of the
