5367  metric terms are needed for the computation of the 2nd derivatives. */
5368  const bool UseLumpedMassMatrix = config->GetUse_Lumped_MassMatrix_DGFEM();
5369 
5370  bool FullMassMatrix = false, FullInverseMassMatrix = false;
5371  bool LumpedMassMatrix = false, DerMetricTerms = false;
5372 
5373  if(config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::STEADY ||
5374  config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::ROTATIONAL_FRAME) {
5375  if( UseLumpedMassMatrix) LumpedMassMatrix = true;
5376  else FullInverseMassMatrix = true;
5377  }
5378  else if(config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::DT_STEPPING_1ST ||
5379  config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::DT_STEPPING_2ND ||
5380  config->GetTime_Marching() == TIME_MARCHING::HARMONIC_BALANCE) {
5381  if( UseLumpedMassMatrix ) FullMassMatrix = LumpedMassMatrix = true;
5382  else FullInverseMassMatrix = true;
5383  }
5384  else {
5385 
5386  /* Time accurate explicit time integration scheme. */
5387  FullMassMatrix = LumpedMassMatrix = false;
5388  FullInverseMassMatrix = true;
5389 
5390  /* For ADER-DG, check if the derivative of the metric terms are needed. */
5391  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) {
5392  MAIN_SOLVER solver = config->GetKind_Solver();
5393  if(solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_NAVIER_STOKES || solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_RANS || solver == MAIN_SOLVER::FEM_LES) {
5394  if(config->GetKind_ADER_Predictor() == ADER_NON_ALIASED_PREDICTOR)
5395  DerMetricTerms = true;
5396  }
5397  }
5398  }
5399 
5400  /* Determine the number of metric terms per integration point.
5401  This depends on the number of spatial dimensions of the problem.
5402  Also determine the additional number of metric terms per integration
5403  point for the computation of the second derivatives. */
5404  const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = nDim*nDim + 1;
5405  const unsigned short nMetric2ndDerPerPoint = nDim*(nDim + nDim*(nDim-1)/2);
5406 
5407  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5408  /*--- Step 1: Determine the metric terms, drdx, drdy, drdz, dsdx, etc. ---*/
5409  /*--- and the Jacobian in the integration points and solution ---*/
5410  /*--- DOFs of the owned volume elements. ---*/
5411  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5412 
5413  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5414  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5415 
5416  /* Easier storage of the index of the corresponding standard element
5417  and determine the number of integration points as well as the number
5418  of DOFs for the grid and solution. */
5419  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5420  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
5421  const unsigned short nDOFsGrid = volElem[i].nDOFsGrid;
5422  const unsigned short nDOFsSol = volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
5423 
5424  /* Allocate the memory for the grid velocities. They are initialized to
5425  zero as default value, i.e. not moving. */
5426  volElem[i].gridVelocities.assign(nDim*nInt, 0.0);
5427  volElem[i].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.assign(nDim*nDOFsSol, 0.0);
5428 
5429  /* Allocate the memory for the metric terms of this element. */
5430  volElem[i].metricTerms.resize(nMetricPerPoint*nInt);
5431  volElem[i].metricTermsSolDOFs.resize(nMetricPerPoint*nDOFsSol);
5432 
5433  /* Get the pointer to the matrix storage of the basis functions
5434  and its derivatives. The first nDOFsGrid*nInt entries of this matrix
5435  correspond to the interpolation data to the integration points
5436  and are not needed. Hence this part is skipped. */
5437  const su2double *matBasisInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5438  const su2double *matDerBasisInt = matBasisInt + nDOFsGrid*nInt;
5439 
5440  /* Also get the pointer to the matrix storage of the derivatives of the
5441  basis functions in the sol DOFs. */
5442  const su2double *matDerBasisSolDOFs = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisFunctionsSolDOFs();
5443 
5444  /* Allocate the memory for the result vectors. */
5445  vector<su2double> helpVecResultInt(nInt*nDim*nDim);
5446  vector<su2double> helpVecResultDOFsSol(nDOFsSol*nDim*nDim);
5447  su2double *vecResultInt = helpVecResultInt.data();
5448  su2double *vecResultDOFsSol = helpVecResultDOFsSol.data();
5449 
5450  /* Compute the gradient of the coordinates w.r.t. the parametric
5451  coordinates for this element in the integration points. */
5452  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nInt, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisInt,
5453  volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid.data(),
5454  vecResultInt, config);
5455 
5456  /* Compute the gradient of the coordinates w.r.t. the parametric
5457  coordinates for this element in the solution DOFs. */
5458  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nDOFsSol, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisSolDOFs,
5459  volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid.data(),
5460  vecResultDOFsSol, config);
5461 
5462  /* Convert the values of dxdr, dydr, etc. to the required metric terms
5463  for both the integration points and the solution DOFs. */
5464  VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(nInt, vecResultInt,
5465  volElem[i].metricTerms);
5466 
5467  VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(nDOFsSol, vecResultDOFsSol,
5468  volElem[i].metricTermsSolDOFs);
5469 
5470  /* Check for negative Jacobians in the integrations points and at the
5471  location of the solution DOFs. */
5472  bool negJacobian = false;
5473  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
5474  if(volElem[i].metricTerms[nMetricPerPoint*j] <= 0.0) negJacobian = true;
5475  }
5476 
5477  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFsSol; ++j) {
5478  if(volElem[i].metricTermsSolDOFs[nMetricPerPoint*j] <= 0.0) negJacobian = true;
5479  }
5480 
5481  if( negJacobian )
5482  SU2_MPI::Error("Negative Jacobian found.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5483  }
5484 
5485  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5486  /*--- Step 2: Determine the derivatives of the metric terms in the ---*/
5487  /*--- integration points, if needed. ---*/
5488  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5489 
5490  if( DerMetricTerms ) {
5491 
5492  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5493  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5494 
5495  /* Easier storage of the index of the corresponding standard element
5496  and determine the number of integration points as well as the number
5497  of DOFs for the grid. */
5498  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5499  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
5500  const unsigned short nDOFsGrid = volElem[i].nDOFsGrid;
5501 
5502  /* Get the pointer to the matrix storage of the basis functions
5503  and its derivatives. The first nDOFsGrid*nInt entries of this matrix
5504  correspond to the interpolation data to the integration points
5505  and are not needed. Hence this part is skipped. */
5506  const su2double *matBasisInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5507  const su2double *matDerBasisInt = matBasisInt + nDOFsGrid*nInt;
5508 
5509  /* Also get the pointer to the matrix storage of the derivatives of the
5510  basis functions in the owned DOFs, i.e. the grid DOFs. */
5511  const su2double *matDerBasisGridDOFs = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisFunctionsOwnDOFs();
5512 
5513  /* Compute the gradient of the coordinates w.r.t. the parametric
5514  coordinates for this element in the solution DOFs. */
5515  vector<su2double> helpVecResultGridDOFs(nDOFsGrid*nDim*nDim);
5516  su2double *vecResultGridDOFs = helpVecResultGridDOFs.data();
5517 
5518  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nDOFsGrid, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisGridDOFs,
5519  volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid.data(),
5520  vecResultGridDOFs, config);
5521 
5522  /* Convert the values of dxdr, dydr, etc. to the required metric terms
5523  in the grid DOFs. */
5524  vector<su2double> metricGridDOFs(nDOFsGrid*nMetricPerPoint);
5525  VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(nDOFsGrid, vecResultGridDOFs,
5526  metricGridDOFs);
5527 
5528  /*--- The metric terms currently stored in metricGridDOFs are scaled
5529  with the Jacobian and also the Jacobian is part of the metric
5530  terms. For the derivatives of the metric terms, the Jacobian
5531  is not needed, but the original unscaled terms are needed.
5532  This is done in the loop below. ---*/
5533  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFsGrid; ++j) {
5534  su2double *metOld = metricGridDOFs.data() + j*nMetricPerPoint;
5535  su2double *metNew = metricGridDOFs.data() + j*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5536 
5537  const su2double JacInv = 1.0/metOld[0];
5538  for(unsigned short k=1; k<nMetricPerPoint; ++k)
5539  metNew[k-1] = JacInv*metOld[k];
5540  }
5541 
5542  /* Compute the derivatives of the metric terms w.r.t. the
5543  parametric coordinates in the integration points.
5544  First allocate the memory to store the results. */
5545  vector<su2double> helpVecDerMetrics(nDim*nInt*(nMetricPerPoint-1));
5546  su2double *vecDerMetrics = helpVecDerMetrics.data();
5547 
5548  /* Carry out the matrix multiplication. The last argument is NULL, such
5549  that this gemm call is ignored in the profiling. Replace by config if
5550  it should be included. */
5551  blasFunctions->gemm(nDim*nInt, nMetricPerPoint-1, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisInt,
5552  metricGridDOFs.data(), vecDerMetrics, nullptr);
5553 
5554  /* Allocate the memory for the additional metric terms needed to
5555  compute the second derivatives. */
5556  volElem[i].metricTerms2ndDer.resize(nInt*nMetric2ndDerPerPoint);
5557 
5558  /*--- Loop over the integration points to compute the additional metric
5559  terms needed for the second derivatives. This is a combination of
5560  the original metric terms and derivatives of these terms.
5561  Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. ---*/
5562  switch( nDim ) {
5563  case 2: {
5564 
5565  /* 2D computation. Loop over the integration points. */
5566  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
5567 
5568  /* Set the pointers where the data for this integration
5569  point starts. */
5570  const su2double *metric = volElem[i].metricTerms.data()
5571  + j*nMetricPerPoint;
5572  const su2double *rDerMetric = vecDerMetrics + j*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5573  const su2double *sDerMetric = rDerMetric + nInt*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5574  su2double *metric2ndDer = volElem[i].metricTerms2ndDer.data()
5575  + j*nMetric2ndDerPerPoint;
5576 
5577  /* More readable abbreviations for the metric terms
5578  and its derivatives. */
5579  const su2double JacInv = 1.0/metric[0];
5580  const su2double drdx = JacInv*metric[1], drdy = JacInv*metric[2];
5581  const su2double dsdx = JacInv*metric[3], dsdy = JacInv*metric[4];
5582 
5583  const su2double ddrdx_dr = rDerMetric[0], ddrdy_dr = rDerMetric[1];
5584  const su2double ddsdx_dr = rDerMetric[2], ddsdy_dr = rDerMetric[3];
5585 
5586  const su2double ddrdx_ds = sDerMetric[0], ddrdy_ds = sDerMetric[1];
5587  const su2double ddsdx_ds = sDerMetric[2], ddsdy_ds = sDerMetric[3];
5588 
5589  /* Compute the metric terms needed to compute the Cartesian 2nd
5590  derivatives. Note that for the cross derivatives an average of
5591  the two possibilities is taken. */
5592  metric2ndDer[0] = drdx*ddrdx_dr + dsdx*ddrdx_ds;
5593  metric2ndDer[1] = drdx*ddsdx_dr + dsdx*ddsdx_ds;
5594 
5595  metric2ndDer[2] = 0.5*(drdx*ddrdy_dr + dsdx*ddrdy_ds
5596  + drdy*ddrdx_dr + dsdy*ddrdx_ds);
5597  metric2ndDer[3] = 0.5*(drdx*ddsdy_dr + dsdx*ddsdy_ds
5598  + drdy*ddsdx_dr + dsdy*ddsdx_ds);
5599 
5600  metric2ndDer[4] = drdy*ddrdy_dr + dsdy*ddrdy_ds;
5601  metric2ndDer[5] = drdy*ddsdy_dr + dsdy*ddsdy_ds;
5602  }
5603 
5604  break;
5605  }
5606 
5607  case 3: {
5608 
5609  /* 3D computation. Loop over the integration points. */
5610  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
5611 
5612  /* Set the pointers where the data for this integration
5613  point starts. */
5614  const su2double *metric = volElem[i].metricTerms.data()
5615  + j*nMetricPerPoint;
5616  const su2double *rDerMetric = vecDerMetrics + j*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5617  const su2double *sDerMetric = rDerMetric + nInt*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5618  const su2double *tDerMetric = sDerMetric + nInt*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5619  su2double *metric2ndDer = volElem[i].metricTerms2ndDer.data()
5620  + j*nMetric2ndDerPerPoint;
5621 
5622  /* More readable abbreviations for the metric terms
5623  and its derivatives. */
5624  const su2double JacInv = 1.0/metric[0];
5625  const su2double drdx = JacInv*metric[1], drdy = JacInv*metric[2], drdz = JacInv*metric[3];
5626  const su2double dsdx = JacInv*metric[4], dsdy = JacInv*metric[5], dsdz = JacInv*metric[6];
5627  const su2double dtdx = JacInv*metric[7], dtdy = JacInv*metric[8], dtdz = JacInv*metric[9];
5628 
5629  const su2double ddrdx_dr = rDerMetric[0], ddrdy_dr = rDerMetric[1], ddrdz_dr = rDerMetric[2];
5630  const su2double ddsdx_dr = rDerMetric[3], ddsdy_dr = rDerMetric[4], ddsdz_dr = rDerMetric[5];
5631  const su2double ddtdx_dr = rDerMetric[6], ddtdy_dr = rDerMetric[7], ddtdz_dr = rDerMetric[8];
5632 
5633  const su2double ddrdx_ds = sDerMetric[0], ddrdy_ds = sDerMetric[1], ddrdz_ds = sDerMetric[2];
5634  const su2double ddsdx_ds = sDerMetric[3], ddsdy_ds = sDerMetric[4], ddsdz_ds = sDerMetric[5];
5635  const su2double ddtdx_ds = sDerMetric[6], ddtdy_ds = sDerMetric[7], ddtdz_ds = sDerMetric[8];
5636 
5637  const su2double ddrdx_dt = tDerMetric[0], ddrdy_dt = tDerMetric[1], ddrdz_dt = tDerMetric[2];
5638  const su2double ddsdx_dt = tDerMetric[3], ddsdy_dt = tDerMetric[4], ddsdz_dt = tDerMetric[5];
5639  const su2double ddtdx_dt = tDerMetric[6], ddtdy_dt = tDerMetric[7], ddtdz_dt = tDerMetric[8];
5640 
5641  /* Compute the metric terms needed to compute the Cartesian 2nd
5642  derivatives. Note that for the cross derivatives an average of
5643  the two possibilities is taken. */
5644  metric2ndDer[0] = drdx*ddrdx_dr + dsdx*ddrdx_ds + dtdx*ddrdx_dt;
5645  metric2ndDer[1] = drdx*ddsdx_dr + dsdx*ddsdx_ds + dtdx*ddsdx_dt;
5646  metric2ndDer[2] = drdx*ddtdx_dr + dsdx*ddtdx_ds + dtdx*ddtdx_dt;
5647 
5648  metric2ndDer[3] = 0.5*(drdx*ddrdy_dr + dsdx*ddrdy_ds + dtdx*ddrdy_dt
5649  + drdy*ddrdx_dr + dsdy*ddrdx_ds + dtdy*ddrdx_dt);
5650  metric2ndDer[4] = 0.5*(drdx*ddsdy_dr + dsdx*ddsdy_ds + dtdx*ddsdy_dt
5651  + drdy*ddsdx_dr + dsdy*ddsdx_ds + dtdy*ddsdx_dt);
5652  metric2ndDer[5] = 0.5*(drdx*ddtdy_dr + dsdx*ddtdy_ds + dtdx*ddtdy_dt
5653  + drdy*ddtdx_dr + dsdy*ddtdx_ds + dtdy*ddtdx_dt);
5654 
5655  metric2ndDer[6] = drdy*ddrdy_dr + dsdy*ddrdy_ds + dtdy*ddrdy_dt;
5656  metric2ndDer[7] = drdy*ddsdy_dr + dsdy*ddsdy_ds + dtdy*ddsdy_dt;
5657  metric2ndDer[8] = drdy*ddtdy_dr + dsdy*ddtdy_ds + dtdy*ddtdy_dt;
5658 
5659  metric2ndDer[9] = 0.5*(drdx*ddrdz_dr + dsdx*ddrdz_ds + dtdx*ddrdz_dt
5660  + drdz*ddrdx_dr + dsdz*ddrdx_ds + dtdz*ddrdx_dt);
5661  metric2ndDer[10] = 0.5*(drdx*ddsdz_dr + dsdx*ddsdz_ds + dtdx*ddsdz_dt
5662  + drdz*ddsdx_dr + dsdz*ddsdx_ds + dtdz*ddsdx_dt);
5663  metric2ndDer[11] = 0.5*(drdx*ddtdz_dr + dsdx*ddtdz_ds + dtdx*ddtdz_dt
5664  + drdz*ddtdx_dr + dsdz*ddtdx_ds + dtdz*ddtdx_dt);
5665 
5666  metric2ndDer[12] = 0.5*(drdy*ddrdz_dr + dsdy*ddrdz_ds + dtdy*ddrdz_dt
5667  + drdz*ddrdy_dr + dsdz*ddrdy_ds + dtdz*ddrdy_dt);
5668  metric2ndDer[13] = 0.5*(drdy*ddsdz_dr + dsdy*ddsdz_ds + dtdy*ddsdz_dt
5669  + drdz*ddsdy_dr + dsdz*ddsdy_ds + dtdz*ddsdy_dt);
5670  metric2ndDer[14] = 0.5*(drdy*ddtdz_dr + dsdy*ddtdz_ds + dtdy*ddtdz_dt
5671  + drdz*ddtdy_dr + dsdz*ddtdy_ds + dtdz*ddtdy_dt);
5672 
5673  metric2ndDer[15] = drdz*ddrdz_dr + dsdz*ddrdz_ds + dtdz*ddrdz_dt;
5674  metric2ndDer[16] = drdz*ddsdz_dr + dsdz*ddsdz_ds + dtdz*ddsdz_dt;
5675  metric2ndDer[17] = drdz*ddtdz_dr + dsdz*ddtdz_ds + dtdz*ddtdz_dt;
5676  }
5677 
5678  break;
5679  }
5680  }
5681  }
5682  }
5683 
5684  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5685  /*--- Step 3: Determine the mass matrix (or its inverse) and/or the ---*/
5686  /*--- lumped mass matrix. ---*/
5687  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5688 
5689  /* Determine the time coefficients in the iteration matrix of the ADER-DG
5690  predictor step. */
5691  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG)
5692  TimeCoefficientsPredictorADER_DG(config);
5693 
5694  /* Define the double vector to define the values of the mass matrix
5695  contributions of the standard element in the integration points. */
5696  vector<vector<su2double> > valMMInt;
5697  valMMInt.resize(standardElementsSol.size());
5698 
5699  /* Loop over the different standard elements. */
5700  for(unsigned long i=0; i<standardElementsSol.size(); ++i) {
5701 
5702  /* Get the required data from the standard element. */
5703  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[i].GetNIntegration();
5704  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardElementsSol[i].GetNDOFs();
5705  const su2double *lag = standardElementsSol[i].GetBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5706  const su2double *w = standardElementsSol[i].GetWeightsIntegration();
5707 
5708  /* Allocate the memory for valMMInt[i]. */
5709  valMMInt[i].resize(nDOFs*nDOFs*nInt);
5710 
5711  /* Create the values of valMMInt[i], which is a matrix of size
5712  nDOFs2XnInt stored in row major order. */
5713  unsigned int ll = 0;
5714  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
5715  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFs; ++j)
5716  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nInt; ++l, ++ll)
5717  valMMInt[i][ll] = w[l]*lag[l*nDOFs+k]*lag[l*nDOFs+j];
5718  }
5719 
5720  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5721  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5722 
5723  /* Easier storage of the index of the corresponding standard element and
5724  get the necessary information from it. */
5725  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5726  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5727  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
5728  const unsigned int nDOFs2 = nDOFs*nDOFs;
5729  const su2double *valInt = valMMInt[ind].data();
5730 
5731  /* Copy the data of the Jacobian in the integration points in
5732  a separate vector. */
5733  vector<su2double> JacVec(nInt);
5734  su2double *Jac = JacVec.data();
5735 
5736  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nInt; ++l)
5737  Jac[l] = volElem[i].metricTerms[l*nMetricPerPoint];
5738 
5739  /* Allocate the memory for working vector for the construction
5740  of the mass matrix. */
5741  vector<su2double> massMat(nDOFs2);
5742 
5743  /* Create the mass matrix, which is a BLAS gemv operation. */
5744  blasFunctions->gemv(nDOFs2, nInt, valInt, Jac, massMat.data());
5745 
5746  /* Store the full mass matrix in volElem[i], if needed. */
5747  if( FullMassMatrix ) volElem[i].massMatrix = massMat;
5748 
5749  /*--- Check if the lumped mass matrix is needed. ---*/
5750  if( LumpedMassMatrix ) {
5751 
5752  /* Allocate the memory for the lumped mass matrix and initialize them to zero.. */
5753  volElem[i].lumpedMassMatrix.assign(nDOFs, 0.0);
5754 
5755  /* Loop over the DOFs to compute the elements of the local lumped mass
5756  matrix. It is the sum of the absolute values of the row. */
5757  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFs; ++j) {
5758  const su2double *val = massMat.data() + j*nDOFs;
5759  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
5760  volElem[i].lumpedMassMatrix[j] += fabs(val[k]);
5761  }
5762  }
5763 
5764  /*--- Check if the inverse of mass matrix is needed. ---*/
5765  if( FullInverseMassMatrix ) {
5766 
5767  /*--- Check if LAPACK/MKL can be used to compute the inverse. ---*/
5768 
5769 #if (defined(HAVE_MKL) || defined(HAVE_LAPACK)) && !(defined(CODI_REVERSE_TYPE) || defined(CODI_FORWARD_TYPE))
5770 
5771  /* The inverse can be computed using the Lapack routines dpotrf
5772  and dpotri. As the mass matrix is positive definite, a
5773  Cholesky decomposition is used, which is much more efficient
5774  than a standard inverse. */
5775  char uplo = 'L';
5776  int NN = nDOFs, errorCode;
5777  dpotrf_(&uplo, &NN, massMat.data(), &NN, &errorCode);
5778  if(errorCode != 0) {
5779  ostringstream message;
5780  if(errorCode < 0) {
5781  message << "Something wrong when calling dpotrf. Error code: "
5782  << errorCode;
5783  }
5784  else {
5785  message << "Mass matrix not positive definite. " << endl;
5786  message << "This is most likely caused by a too low accuracy of the quadrature rule," << endl;
5787  message << "possibly combined with a low quality element." << endl;
5788  message << "Increase the accuracy of the quadrature rule.";
5789  }
5790 
5791  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5792  }
5793 
5794  dpotri_(&uplo, &NN, massMat.data(), &NN, &errorCode);
5795  if(errorCode != 0) {
5796  ostringstream message;
5797  if(errorCode < 0) {
5798  message << "Something wrong when calling dpotri. Error code: "
5799  << errorCode;
5800  }
5801  else {
5802  message << "Mass matrix is singular. " << endl;
5803  message << "The is most likely caused by a too low accuracy of the quadrature rule, " << endl;
5804  message << "possibly combined with a low quality element." << endl;
5805  message << "Increase the accuracy of the quadrature rule.";
5806  }
5807 
5808  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5809  }
5810 
5811  /* The Lapack routines for a Cholesky decomposition only store the upper
5812  part of the matrix. Copy the data to the lower part. */
5813  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k) {
5814  for(unsigned short j=(k+1); j<nDOFs; ++j) {
5815  massMat[j*nDOFs+k] = massMat[k*nDOFs+j];
5816  }
5817  }
5818 #else
5819  /* No support for Lapack. Hence an internal routine is used.
5820  This does not do all the checking the Lapack routines do. */
5821  CFEMStandardElementBase::InverseMatrix(nDOFs, massMat);
5822 #endif
5823  /* Store the inverse of the mass matrix in volElem[i]. */
5824  volElem[i].invMassMatrix = massMat;
5825  }
5826  }
5827 }
5828 
5829 void CMeshFEM_DG::TimeCoefficientsPredictorADER_DG(CConfig *config) {
5830 
5831  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5832  /*--- Determine the coefficients that appear in the iteration matrix of ---*/
5833  /*--- the prediction step of ADER-DG. ---*/
5834  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5835 
5836  /* Determine the number of time DOFs in the predictor step of ADER as well
5837  as their location on the interval [-1..1]. */
5838  const unsigned short nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
5839  const su2double *TimeDOFs = config->GetTimeDOFsADER_DG();
5840 
5841  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix and its inverse in the time DOFs. */
5842  vector<su2double> rTimeDOFs(nTimeDOFs);
5843  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i) rTimeDOFs[i] = TimeDOFs[i];
5844 
5845  vector<su2double> V(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs);
5846  CFEMStandardElementBase timeElement;
5847  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeDOFs, V);
5848 
5849  vector<su2double> VInv = V;
5850  timeElement.InverseMatrix(nTimeDOFs, VInv);
5851 
5852  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix for r = 1, i.e. the end of the interval. */
5853  vector<su2double> rEnd(1); rEnd[0] = 1.0;
5854  vector<su2double> VEnd(nTimeDOFs);
5855  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rEnd, VEnd);
5856 
5857  /*--- Determine the matrix products VEnd*VInv to get the correct expression
5858  for the values of the Lagrangian interpolation functions for r = 1. ---*/
5859  vector<su2double> lEnd(nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5860  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5861  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k)
5862  lEnd[j] += VEnd[k]*VInv[j*nTimeDOFs+k];
5863  }
5864 
5865  /*--- To reduce the error due to round off, make sure that the row sum is 1.
5866  Also check if the difference is not too large to be solely caused by
5867  roundoff. ---*/
5868  su2double val = 0.0;
5869  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) val += lEnd[j];
5870 
5871  if(fabs(val-1.0) > 1.e-6)
5872  SU2_MPI::Error( "Difference is too large to be caused by roundoff", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5873 
5874  val = 1.0/val;
5875  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) lEnd[j] *= val;
5876 
5877  /*--- Compute the mass matrix in time, which is the inverse of V^T V. Note that
5878  this definition is different from the one used in Hesthaven, because their
5879  V is our V^T. Furthermore note that the mass matrix should be a diagonal
5880  matrix, due to the choice of the DOFs (Gauss Legendre points). ---*/
5881  vector<su2double> MassTime(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5882  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5883  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i) {
5884  const unsigned short ji = j*nTimeDOFs + i;
5885  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k)
5886  MassTime[ji] += V[k*nTimeDOFs+j]*V[k*nTimeDOFs+i];
5887  }
5888  }
5889 
5890  timeElement.InverseMatrix(nTimeDOFs, MassTime);
5891 
5892  /* Compute the gradient of the Vandermonde matrix in the time DOFs. */
5893  vector<su2double> VDr(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs);
5894  timeElement.GradVandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeDOFs, VDr);
5895 
5896  /* Compute the product VDr VInv. Store the result in V. Note that in both
5897  matrices the transpose is stored compared to the definition of Hesthaven. */
5898  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5899  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i) {
5900  const unsigned short ji = j*nTimeDOFs + i;
5901  V[ji] = 0.0;
5902  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k)
5903  V[ji] += VDr[k*nTimeDOFs+j]*VInv[i*nTimeDOFs+k];
5904  }
5905  }
5906 
5907  /* Compute the time stiffness matrix S = M Dr. */
5908  vector<su2double> S(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5909  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5910  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i) {
5911  const unsigned short ji = j*nTimeDOFs + i;
5912  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k)
5913  S[ji] += MassTime[j*nTimeDOFs+k]*V[k*nTimeDOFs+i];
5914  }
5915  }
5916 
5917  /* Compute the time coefficients of the iteration matrix in the predictor step. */
5918  timeCoefADER_DG.assign(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5919  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5920  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
5921  timeCoefADER_DG[j*nTimeDOFs+i] = lEnd[j]*lEnd[i] - S[i*nTimeDOFs+j];
5922  }
5923 
5924  /* Determine the inverse of timeCoefADER_DG, because this is needed in the
5925  iteration matrix of the predictor step of ADER-DG. */
5926  timeElement.InverseMatrix(nTimeDOFs, timeCoefADER_DG);
5927 
5928  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5929  /*--- Determine the interpolation matrix from the time DOFs of ADER-DG ---*/
5930  /*--- to the time integration points. Note that in many cases this ---*/
5931  /*--- interpolation matrix is the identity matrix, i.e. the DOFs and the ---*/
5932  /*--- integration points coincide. ---*/
5933  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5934 
5935  /* Determine the number of time integration points of ADER as well
5936  as their location on the interval [-1..1]. */
5937  unsigned short nTimeIntegrationPoints = config->GetnTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
5938  const su2double *TimeIntegrationPoints = config->GetTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
5939 
5940  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix for the time integration points. */
5941  vector<su2double> rTimeIntPoints(nTimeIntegrationPoints);
5942  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i)
5943  rTimeIntPoints[i] = TimeIntegrationPoints[i];
5944 
5945  V.resize(nTimeIntegrationPoints*nTimeDOFs);
5946  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeIntPoints, V);
5947 
5948  /* Allocate the memory for the time interpolation coefficients and initialize
5949  them to zero. */
5950  timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG.assign(nTimeIntegrationPoints*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5951 
5952  /* Determine the matrix products V*VInv to get the correct expression for
5953  mTimeInterpolDOFToIntegration. Note that from mathematical point of view the
5954  transpose of V*VInv is stored, because in this way the interpolation data
5955  for a time integration point is contiguous in memory. */
5956  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5957  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) {
5958  const unsigned short ii = i*nTimeDOFs + j;
5959 
5960  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
5961  const unsigned short indV = k*nTimeIntegrationPoints + i;
5962  const unsigned short indVInv = j*nTimeDOFs + k;
5963 
5964  timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[ii] += V[indV]*VInv[indVInv];
5965  }
5966  }
5967  }
5968 
5969  /*--- To reduce the error due to round off, make sure that the row sum is 1.
5970  Also check if the difference is not too large to be solely caused by
5971  roundoff. ---*/
5972  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++j) {
5973  const unsigned short jj = j*nTimeDOFs;
5974 
5975  val = 0.0;
5976  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
5977  val += timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj+i];
5978 
5979  if(fabs(val-1.0) > 1.e-6)
5980  SU2_MPI::Error( "Difference is too large to be caused by roundoff", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5981 
5982  val = 1.0/val;
5983  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
5984  timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj+i] *= val;
5985  }
5986 
5987  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5988  /*--- Determine the interpolation matrix from the time DOFs of ADER-DG ---*/
5989  /*--- of adjacent elements of a higher time level to the time ---*/
5990  /*--- integration points. ---*/
5991  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5992 
5993  /* Determine the location of the time integration points from the
5994  perspective of an adjacent element with twice the time step. Note that
5995  the time step of this adjacent element covers two fine time steps and
5996  hence the number of integration points double and the position is
5997  determined via the transformation xxi = 0.5(xi-1) and xi varies between
5998  -1 and 3. */
5999  rTimeIntPoints.resize(2*nTimeIntegrationPoints);
6000  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i)
6001  rTimeIntPoints[i] = 0.5*(TimeIntegrationPoints[i]-1.0);
6002 
6003  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) {
6004  const unsigned short ii = i + nTimeIntegrationPoints;
6005  rTimeIntPoints[ii] = 0.5*(TimeIntegrationPoints[i]+1.0);
6006  }
6007 
6008  nTimeIntegrationPoints *= 2;
6009 
6010  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix for these time integration points. */
6011  V.resize(nTimeIntegrationPoints*nTimeDOFs);
6012  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeIntPoints, V);
6013 
6014  /* Allocate the memory for the time interpolation coefficients and initialize
6015  them to zero. */
6016  timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG.assign(nTimeIntegrationPoints*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
6017 
6018  /* Determine the matrix products V*VInv to get the correct expression for
6019  mTimeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegration. Note that from mathematical point of view
6020  the transpose of V*VInv is stored, because in this way the interpolation
6021  data for a time integration point is contiguous in memory. */
6022  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
6023  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) {
6024  const unsigned short ii = i*nTimeDOFs + j;
6025 
6026  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
6027  const unsigned short indV = k*nTimeIntegrationPoints + i;
6028  const unsigned short indVInv = j*nTimeDOFs + k;
6029 
6030  timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[ii] += V[indV]*VInv[indVInv];
6031  }
6032  }
6033  }
6034 
6035  /*--- To reduce the error due to round off, make sure that the row sum is 1.
6036  Also check if the difference is not too large to be solely caused by
6037  roundoff. ---*/
6038  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++j) {
6039  const unsigned short jj = j*nTimeDOFs;
6040 
6041  val = 0.0;
6042  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
6043  val += timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj+i];
6044 
6045  if(fabs(val-1.0) > 1.e-6)
6046  SU2_MPI::Error( "Difference is too large to be caused by roundoff", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6047 
6048  val = 1.0/val;
6049  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
6050  timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj+i] *= val;
6051  }
6052 }
6053 
6054 void CMeshFEM_DG::VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(
6055  const unsigned short nEntities,
6056  const su2double *gradCoor,
6057  vector<su2double> &metricTerms) {
6058 
6059  /*--- Convert the dxdr, dydr, etc., stored in coorGradients, to the
6060  required metric terms. Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. ---*/
6061  switch( nDim ) {
6062  case 2: {
6063 
6064  /* 2D computation. Store the offset between the r and s derivatives. */
6065  const unsigned short off = 2*nEntities;
6066 
6067  /* Loop over the entities and store the metric terms. */
6068  unsigned short ii = 0;
6069  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nEntities; ++j) {
6070  const unsigned short jx = 2*j; const unsigned short jy = jx+1;
6071  const su2double dxdr = gradCoor[jx], dydr = gradCoor[jy];
6072  const su2double dxds = gradCoor[jx+off], dyds = gradCoor[jy+off];
6073 
6074  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr*dyds - dxds*dydr; // J
6075  metricTerms[ii++] = dyds; // J drdx
6076  metricTerms[ii++] = -dxds; // J drdy
6077  metricTerms[ii++] = -dydr; // J dsdx
6078  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr; // J dsdy
6079  }
6080 
6081  break;
6082  }
6083 
6084  case 3: {
6085  /* 3D computation. Store the offset between the r and s and r and t derivatives. */
6086  unsigned short offS = 3*nEntities, offT = 6*nEntities;
6087 
6088  /* Loop over the entities and store the metric terms. */
6089  unsigned short ii = 0;
6090  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nEntities; ++j) {
6091  const unsigned short jx = 3*j; const unsigned short jy = jx+1, jz = jx+2;
6092  const su2double dxdr = gradCoor[jx], dydr = gradCoor[jy], dzdr = gradCoor[jz];
6093  const su2double dxds = gradCoor[jx+offS], dyds = gradCoor[jy+offS], dzds = gradCoor[jz+offS];
6094  const su2double dxdt = gradCoor[jx+offT], dydt = gradCoor[jy+offT], dzdt = gradCoor[jz+offT];
6095 
6096  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr*(dyds*dzdt - dzds*dydt)
6097  - dxds*(dydr*dzdt - dzdr*dydt)
6098  + dxdt*(dydr*dzds - dzdr*dyds); // J
6099 
6100  metricTerms[ii++] = dyds*dzdt - dzds*dydt; // J drdx
6101  metricTerms[ii++] = dzds*dxdt - dxds*dzdt; // J drdy
6102  metricTerms[ii++] = dxds*dydt - dyds*dxdt; // J drdz
6103 
6104  metricTerms[ii++] = dzdr*dydt - dydr*dzdt; // J dsdx
6105  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr*dzdt - dzdr*dxdt; // J dsdy
6106  metricTerms[ii++] = dydr*dxdt - dxdr*dydt; // J dsdz
6107 
6108  metricTerms[ii++] = dydr*dzds - dzdr*dyds; // J dtdx
6109  metricTerms[ii++] = dzdr*dxds - dxdr*dzds; // J dtdy
6110  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr*dyds - dydr*dxds; // J dtdz
6111  }
6112 
6113  break;
6114  }
6115  }
6116 }
6117 
6118 void CMeshFEM_DG::WallFunctionPreprocessing(CConfig *config) {
6119 
6120  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6121  /*--- Step 1: Check whether wall functions are used at all. ---*/
6122  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6123 
6124  bool wallFunctions = false;
6125  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
6126 
6127  switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
6128  case ISOTHERMAL:
6129  case HEAT_FLUX: {
6130  const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
6131  if(config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != WALL_FUNCTIONS::NONE)
6132  wallFunctions = true;
6133  break;
6134  }
6135  default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6136  break;
6137  }
6138  }
6139 
6140  /* If no wall functions are used, nothing needs to be done and a
6141  return can be made. */
6142  if( !wallFunctions ) return;
6143 
6144  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6145  /*--- Step 2. Build the local ADT of the volume elements. The halo ---*/
6146  /*--- elements are included such that also direct neighbors are ---*/
6147  /*--- guaranteed to be found as donor element. Note that the ADT ---*/
6148  /*--- is built with the linear subelements. This is done to ---*/
6149  /*--- avoid relatively many expensive Newton solves for high ---*/
6150  /*--- order elements. ---*/
6151  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6152 
6153  /* Define the vectors, which store the mapping from the subelement to the
6154  parent element, subelement ID within the parent element, the element
6155  type and the connectivity of the subelements. */
6156  vector<unsigned long> parentElement;
6157  vector<unsigned short> subElementIDInParent;
6158  vector<unsigned short> VTK_TypeElem;
6159  vector<unsigned long> elemConn;
6160 
6161  /* Loop over the locally stored volume elements (including halo elements)
6162  to create the connectivity of the subelements. */
6163  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemTot; ++l) {
6164 
6165  /* Determine the necessary data from the corresponding standard element. */
6166  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
6167 
6168  unsigned short VTK_Type[] = {standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type1(),
6169  standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type2()};
6170  unsigned short nSubElems[] = {0, 0};
6171  unsigned short nDOFsPerSubElem[] = {0, 0};
6172  const unsigned short *connSubElems[] = {nullptr, nullptr};
6173 
6174  if(VTK_Type[0] != NONE) {
6175  nSubElems[0] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNSubElemsType1();
6176  nDOFsPerSubElem[0] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNDOFsPerSubElem(VTK_Type[0]);
6177  connSubElems[0] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType1();
6178  }
6179 
6180  if(VTK_Type[1] != NONE) {
6181  nSubElems[1] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNSubElemsType2();
6182  nDOFsPerSubElem[1] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNDOFsPerSubElem(VTK_Type[1]);
6183  connSubElems[1] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType2();
6184  }
6185 
6186  /* Abbreviate the grid DOFs of this element a bit easier. */
6187  const unsigned long *DOFs = volElem[l].nodeIDsGrid.data();
6188 
6189  /* Loop over the number of subelements and store the required data. */
6190  unsigned short jj = 0;
6191  for(unsigned short i=0; i<2; ++i) {
6192  unsigned short kk = 0;
6193  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nSubElems[i]; ++j, ++jj) {
6194  parentElement.push_back(l);
6195  subElementIDInParent.push_back(jj);
6196  VTK_TypeElem.push_back(VTK_Type[i]);
6197 
6198  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFsPerSubElem[i]; ++k, ++kk)
6199  elemConn.push_back(DOFs[connSubElems[i][kk]]);
6200  }
6201  }
6202  }
6203 
6204  /* Copy the coordinates in a vector that can be used by the ADT. */
6205  vector<su2double> volCoor;
6206  volCoor.reserve(nDim*meshPoints.size());
6207 
6208  for(unsigned long l=0; l<meshPoints.size(); ++l) {
6209  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDim; ++k)
6210  volCoor.push_back(meshPoints[l].coor[k]);
6211  }
6212 
6213  /* Build the local ADT. */
6214  CADTElemClass localVolumeADT(nDim, volCoor, elemConn, VTK_TypeElem,
6215  subElementIDInParent, parentElement, false);
6216 
6217  /* Release the memory of the vectors used to build the ADT. To make sure
6218  that all the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. */
6219  vector<unsigned short>().swap(subElementIDInParent);
6220  vector<unsigned short>().swap(VTK_TypeElem);
6221  vector<unsigned long>().swap(parentElement);
6222  vector<unsigned long>().swap(elemConn);
6223  vector<su2double>().swap(volCoor);
6224 
6225  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6226  /*--- Step 3. Search for donor elements at the exchange locations in ---*/
6227  /*--- the local elements. ---*/
6228  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6229 
6230  /* Loop over the markers and select the ones for which a wall function
6231  treatment must be carried out. */
6232  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
6233 
6234  switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
6235  case ISOTHERMAL:
6236  case HEAT_FLUX: {
6237  const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
6238  if(config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != WALL_FUNCTIONS::NONE) {
6239 
6240  /* An LES wall model is used for this boundary marker. Determine
6241  which wall model and allocate the memory for the member variable. */
6242  switch (config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) ) {
6243  case WALL_FUNCTIONS::EQUILIBRIUM_MODEL: {
6244  if(rank == MASTER_NODE)
6245  cout << "Marker " << Marker_Tag << " uses an Equilibrium Wall Model." << endl;
6246 
6247  boundaries[iMarker].wallModel = new CWallModel1DEQ(config, Marker_Tag);
6248  break;
6249  }
6250  case WALL_FUNCTIONS::LOGARITHMIC_MODEL: {
6251  if(rank == MASTER_NODE)
6252  cout << "Marker " << Marker_Tag << " uses the Reichardt and Kader analytical laws for the Wall Model." << endl;
6253 
6254  boundaries[iMarker].wallModel = new CWallModelLogLaw(config, Marker_Tag);
6255  break;
6256  }
6257  default: {
6258  SU2_MPI::Error("Wall function not present yet", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6259  }
6260  }
6261 
6262  /* Retrieve the double information for this wall model. The height
6263  of the exchange location is the first element of this array. */
6264  const su2double *doubleInfo = config->GetWallFunction_DoubleInfo(Marker_Tag);
6265 
6266  /* Easier storage of the surface elements and loop over them. */
6267  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
6268  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6269 
6270  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
6271  relevant information from it. Note that the standard element
6272  of the solution must be taken and not of the grid. */
6273  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6274  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6275 
6276  /* Allocate the memory for the memory to store the donors and
6277  the parametric weights. The donor elements are stored in an
6278  CUnsignedLong2T, such that they can be sorted. */
6279  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> donorElements(nInt);
6280  vector<su2double> parCoorInDonor(nInt*nDim);
6281 
6282  /* Loop over the integration points. */
6283  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6284 
6285  /* Easier storage of the normals and coordinates of this
6286  integration point. */
6287  const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data()
6288  + i*(nDim+1);
6289  const su2double *Coord = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data()
6290  + i*nDim;
6291 
6292  /* Determine the coordinates of the exchange location. Note that the normals
6293  point out of the domain, so the normals must be subtracted. */
6294  su2double coorExchange[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}; // To avoid a compiler warning.
6295  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6296  coorExchange[iDim] = Coord[iDim] - doubleInfo[0]*normals[iDim];
6297 
6298  /* Search for the element, which contains the exchange location. */
6299  unsigned short subElem;
6300  unsigned long parElem;
6301  int rank;
6302  su2double parCoor[3], weightsInterpol[8];
6303  if( localVolumeADT.DetermineContainingElement(coorExchange, subElem,
6304  parElem, rank, parCoor,
6305  weightsInterpol) ) {
6306 
6307  /* Subelement found that contains the exchange location. However,
6308  what is needed is the location in the high order parent element.
6309  Determine this. */
6310  HighOrderContainmentSearch(coorExchange, parElem, subElem,
6311  weightsInterpol, parCoor);
6312 
6313  /* Store the info in donorElements and parCoorInDonor. */
6314  donorElements[i].long0 = parElem;
6315  donorElements[i].long1 = i;
6316  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6317  parCoorInDonor[nDim*i+iDim] = parCoor[iDim];
6318  }
6319  else {
6320 
6321  /* No subelement found that contains the exchange location.
6322  The partitioning is done such that this should not happen.
6323  Print an error message and exit. */
6324  SU2_MPI::Error("Exchange location not found in ADT",
6325  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6326  }
6327  }
6328 
6329  /* Sort donorElements in increasing order, such that the
6330  integration points with the same donor are grouped together. */
6331  sort(donorElements.begin(), donorElements.end());
6332 
6333  /* Store the donor information in the member variables of surfElem. */
6334  surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.push_back(donorElements[0].long0);
6335  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor.push_back(0);
6336  surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor.resize(nInt);
6337  surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor[0] = donorElements[0].long1;
6338 
6339  for(unsigned short i=1; i<nInt; ++i) {
6340  if(donorElements[i].long0 != surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.back()) {
6341  surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.push_back(donorElements[i].long0);
6342  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor.push_back(i);
6343  }
6344  surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor[i] = donorElements[i].long1;
6345  }
6346 
6347  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor.push_back(nInt);
6348 
6349  /* Determine whether or not halo information is needed to apply
6350  the boundary conditions for this surface. If needed, set
6351  haloInfoNeededForBC of the boundary to true. As DonorsWallFunction
6352  is sorted in increasing order, it suffices to check the last element. */
6353  if(surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.back() >= nVolElemOwned)
6354  boundaries[iMarker].haloInfoNeededForBC = true;
6355 
6356  /* Allocate the memory of the first index of the interpolation
6357  matrices for the donordata. */
6358  surfElem[l].matWallFunctionDonor.resize(surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.size());
6359 
6360  /* Loop over the different donors for the wall function data. */
6361  for(unsigned long j=0; j<surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.size(); ++j) {
6362 
6363  /* Easier storage of the donor and the vector for the
6364  interpolation data for this donor. */
6365  const unsigned long donor = surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction[j];
6366  vector<su2double> &matDonor = surfElem[l].matWallFunctionDonor[j];
6367 
6368  /* Determine the number of DOFs in the donor element. Note that
6369  the standard element of the solution must be used for this
6370  purpose. */
6371  const unsigned short ind = volElem[donor].indStandardElement;
6372  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNDOFs();
6373 
6374  /* Allocate the memory for the vector used to compute the
6375  Lagrangian interpolation functions in the parametric coordinates,
6376  i.e. the interpolation weights, and for matDonor, which stores
6377  all these weights. */
6378  const unsigned short nIntThisDonor = surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j+1]
6379  - surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j];
6380  vector<su2double> lagBasis(nDOFs);
6381  matDonor.reserve(nIntThisDonor*nDOFs);
6382 
6383  /* Loop over the integration points for this donor element. */
6384  for(unsigned short i=surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j];
6385  i<surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j+1]; ++i) {
6386 
6387  /* Determine the pointer to the parametric coordinates of the
6388  donor point of this integration point. */
6389  const unsigned short ii = surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor[i];
6390  const su2double *parCoor = parCoorInDonor.data() + ii*nDim;
6391 
6392  /* Determine the interpolation weights for this point and
6393  store it in matDonor. */
6394  standardElementsSol[ind].BasisFunctionsInPoint(parCoor, lagBasis);
6395  matDonor.insert(matDonor.end(), lagBasis.begin(), lagBasis.end());
6396  }
6397  }
6398  }
6399  }
6400 
6401  break;
6402  }
6403  default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6404  break;
6405  }
6406  }
6407 }
6408 
6409 void CMeshFEM_DG::HighOrderContainmentSearch(const su2double *coor,
6410  const unsigned long parElem,
6411  const unsigned short subElem,
6412  const su2double *weightsSubElem,
6413  su2double *parCoor) {
6414 
6415  /* Definition of the maximum number of iterations in the Newton solver
6416  and the tolerance level. */
6417  const unsigned short maxIt = 50;
6418  const su2double tolNewton = 1.e-10;
6419 
6420  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6421  /* Step 1: Create an initial guess for the parametric coordinates from */
6422  /* interpolation in the linear sub-element of the parent element. */
6423  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6424 
6425  /* Abbreviate the index in the standard element a bit easier. */
6426  const unsigned short ind = volElem[parElem].indStandardElement;
6427 
6428  /* Define the variables to store the number of DOFs and the connectivity
6429  of the sub element in which the given coordinate resides. */
6430  unsigned short nDOFsPerSubElem = 0;
6431  const unsigned short *connSubElems;
6432 
6433  /* Check if the sub element is of the first sub-element type. */
6434  const unsigned short nSubElemType1 = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNSubElemsType1();
6435  if(subElem < nSubElemType1) {
6436 
6437  /* Determine the element type and set nDOFsPerSubElem. */
6438  switch( standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type1() ) {
6439  case TRIANGLE: nDOFsPerSubElem = 3; break;
6440  case QUADRILATERAL: nDOFsPerSubElem = 4; break;
6441  case TETRAHEDRON: nDOFsPerSubElem = 4; break;
6442  case PYRAMID: nDOFsPerSubElem = 5; break;
6443  case PRISM: nDOFsPerSubElem = 6; break;
6444  case HEXAHEDRON: nDOFsPerSubElem = 8; break;
6445  default: break; /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6446  }
6447 
6448  /* Set the connectivity for the correct subelement. */
6449  connSubElems = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType1()
6450  + subElem*nDOFsPerSubElem;
6451  }
6452  else {
6453 
6454  /* The sub-element is of the second sub-element type. Determine the
6455  element type and set nDOFsPerSubElem. */
6456  switch( standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type2() ) {
6457  case TRIANGLE: nDOFsPerSubElem = 3; break;
6458  case QUADRILATERAL: nDOFsPerSubElem = 4; break;
6459  case TETRAHEDRON: nDOFsPerSubElem = 4; break;
6460  case PYRAMID: nDOFsPerSubElem = 5; break;
6461  case PRISM: nDOFsPerSubElem = 6; break;
6462  case HEXAHEDRON: nDOFsPerSubElem = 8; break;
6463  default: break; /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6464  }
6465 
6466  /* Set the connectivity for the correct subelement. */
6467  connSubElems = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType2()
6468  + (subElem-nSubElemType1)*nDOFsPerSubElem;
6469  }
6470 
6471  /* Get the parametric coordinates of the DOFs from the standard element. */
6472  const vector<su2double> *locDOFs[] = {standardElementsGrid[ind].GetRDOFs(),
6473  standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSDOFs(),
6474  standardElementsGrid[ind].GetTDOFs()};
6475 
6476  /* Create the initial guess of the parametric coordinates by interpolation
6477  in the sub-element. */
6478  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim) {
6479  parCoor[iDim] = 0.0;
6480  const su2double *coorDOFs = locDOFs[iDim]->data();
6481  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsPerSubElem; ++i)
6482  parCoor[iDim] += weightsSubElem[i]*coorDOFs[connSubElems[i]];
6483  }
6484 
6485  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6486  /* Step 2: The Newton algorithm to compute the parametric coordinates in */
6487  /* the high order element. */
6488  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6489 
6490  /* Determine the number of DOFs of the standard element and allocate the
6491  memory to store the basis functions and its derivatives. */
6492  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNDOFs();
6493 
6494  vector<su2double> lagBasis(nDOFs);
6495  vector<vector<su2double> > dLagBasis(nDim, vector<su2double>(nDOFs));
6496 
6497  /* Abbreviate the grid DOFs of this element a bit easier. */
6498  const unsigned long *DOFs = volElem[parElem].nodeIDsGrid.data();
6499 
6500  /* Loop over the maximum number of iterations. */
6501  unsigned short itCount;
6502  for(itCount=0; itCount<maxIt; ++itCount) {
6503 
6504  /* Compute the Lagrangian basis functions and its derivatives in
6505  the current parametric coordinate. */
6506  standardElementsGrid[ind].BasisFunctionsAndDerivativesInPoint(parCoor, lagBasis,
6507  dLagBasis);
6508 
6509  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D in order to have the most
6510  efficient code. */
6511  bool converged = false;
6512  switch( nDim ) {
6513  case 2: {
6514  /* Two dimensional computation. Compute the values of the function
6515  and minus the Jacobian matrix. */
6516  su2double f0 = coor[0], f1 = coor[1];
6517  su2double a00 = 0.0, a01 = 0.0, a10 = 0.0, a11 = 0.0;
6518  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6519  const su2double x = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[0];
6520  const su2double y = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[1];
6521 
6522  f0 -= x*lagBasis[i]; f1 -= y*lagBasis[i];
6523 
6524  a00 += x*dLagBasis[0][i]; a01 += x*dLagBasis[1][i];
6525  a10 += y*dLagBasis[0][i]; a11 += y*dLagBasis[1][i];
6526  }
6527 
6528  /* Compute the updates of the parametric values. As minus the
6529  Jacobian is computed, the updates should be added to parCoor. */
6530  const su2double detInv = 1.0/(a00*a11 - a01*a10);
6531  const su2double dr = detInv*(f0*a11 - f1*a01);
6532  const su2double ds = detInv*(f1*a00 - f0*a10);
6533 
6534  parCoor[0] += dr;
6535  parCoor[1] += ds;
6536 
6537  /* Check for convergence. */
6538  if(fabs(dr) <= tolNewton && fabs(ds) <= tolNewton) converged = true;
6539  break;
6540  }
6541 
6542  case 3: {
6543  /* Three dimensional computation. Compute the values of the function
6544  and minus the Jacobian matrix. */
6545  su2double f0 = coor[0], f1 = coor[1], f2 = coor[2];
6546  su2double a00 = 0.0, a01 = 0.0, a02 = 0.0;
6547  su2double a10 = 0.0, a11 = 0.0, a12 = 0.0;
6548  su2double a20 = 0.0, a21 = 0.0, a22 = 0.0;
6549 
6550  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6551  const su2double x = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[0];
6552  const su2double y = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[1];
6553  const su2double z = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[2];
6554 
6555  f0 -= x*lagBasis[i]; f1 -= y*lagBasis[i]; f2 -= z*lagBasis[i];
6556 
6557  a00 += x*dLagBasis[0][i]; a01 += x*dLagBasis[1][i]; a02 += x*dLagBasis[2][i];
6558  a10 += y*dLagBasis[0][i]; a11 += y*dLagBasis[1][i]; a12 += y*dLagBasis[2][i];
6559  a20 += z*dLagBasis[0][i]; a21 += z*dLagBasis[1][i]; a22 += z*dLagBasis[2][i];
6560  }
6561 
6562  /* Compute the updates of the parametric values. As minus the
6563  Jacobian is computed, the updates should be added to parCoor. */
6564  const su2double detInv = 1.0/(a00*a11*a22 - a00*a12*a21 - a01*a10*a22
6565  + a01*a12*a20 + a02*a10*a21 - a02*a11*a20);
6566  const su2double dr = detInv*(a01*a12*f2 - a01*a22*f1 - a02*a11*f2
6567  + a02*a21*f1 + a11*a22*f0 - a12*a21*f0);
6568  const su2double ds = -detInv*(a00*a12*f2 - a00*a22*f1 - a02*a10*f2
6569  + a02*a20*f1 + a10*a22*f0 - a12*a20*f0);
6570  const su2double dt = detInv*(a00*a11*f2 - a00*a21*f1 - a01*a10*f2
6571  + a01*a20*f1 + a10*a21*f0 - a11*a20*f0);
6572  parCoor[0] += dr;
6573  parCoor[1] += ds;
6574  parCoor[2] += dt;
6575 
6576  /* Check for convergence. */
6577  if(fabs(dr) <= tolNewton && fabs(ds) <= tolNewton && fabs(dt) <= tolNewton)
6578  converged = true;
6579  break;
6580  }
6581  }
6582 
6583  /* Break the loop if the Newton algorithm converged. */
6584  if( converged ) break;
6585  }
6586 
6587  /* Terminate if the Newton algorithm did not converge. */
6588  if(itCount == maxIt)
6589  SU2_MPI::Error("Newton did not converge", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6590 }
6591 
6592 void CMeshFEM_DG::InitStaticMeshMovement(const CConfig *config,
6593  const unsigned short Kind_Grid_Movement,
6594  const unsigned short iZone) {
6595 
6596  /*--- Get the reference values for the non-dimensionalization of the
6597  prescribed velocities. ---*/
6598  const su2double L_Ref = config->GetLength_Ref();
6599  const su2double Omega_Ref = config->GetOmega_Ref();
6600  const su2double Vel_Ref = config->GetVelocity_Ref();
6601 
6602  /*--- Make a distinction between the possibilities. ---*/
6603  switch( Kind_Grid_Movement ) {
6604 
6605  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6606 
6607  case ROTATING_FRAME: {
6608 
6609  /* Get the rotation rate and rotation center from config. */
6610  const su2double Center[] = {config->GetMotion_Origin(0),
6611  config->GetMotion_Origin(1),
6612  config->GetMotion_Origin(2)};
6613  const su2double Omega[] = {config->GetRotation_Rate(0)/Omega_Ref,
6614  config->GetRotation_Rate(1)/Omega_Ref,
6615  config->GetRotation_Rate(2)/Omega_Ref};
6616 
6617  /* Array used to store the distance to the rotation center. */
6618  su2double dist[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6619 
6620  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
6621  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
6622 
6623  /* Get the number of DOFs and integration points for this element. */
6624  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
6625  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6626  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
6627 
6628  /* Determine the grid velocities in the integration points. */
6629  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6630  const su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
6631  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6632 
6633  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6634  dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6635 
6636  gridVel[0] = Omega[1]*dist[2] - Omega[2]*dist[1];
6637  gridVel[1] = Omega[2]*dist[0] - Omega[0]*dist[2];
6638  if(nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0]*dist[1] - Omega[1]*dist[0];
6639  }
6640 
6641  /* Determine the grid velocities in the solution DOFs. */
6642  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6643  const su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
6644  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
6645 
6646  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6647  dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6648 
6649  gridVel[0] = Omega[1]*dist[2] - Omega[2]*dist[1];
6650  gridVel[1] = Omega[2]*dist[0] - Omega[0]*dist[2];
6651  if(nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0]*dist[1] - Omega[1]*dist[0];
6652  }
6653  }
6654 
6655  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
6656  for(unsigned long l=0; l<matchingFaces.size(); ++l) {
6657 
6658  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6659  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[l].indStandardElement;
6660  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6661 
6662  /* Determine the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6663  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6664  const su2double *coor = matchingFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
6665  su2double *gridVel = matchingFaces[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6666 
6667  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6668  dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6669 
6670  gridVel[0] = Omega[1]*dist[2] - Omega[2]*dist[1];
6671  gridVel[1] = Omega[2]*dist[0] - Omega[0]*dist[2];
6672  if(nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0]*dist[1] - Omega[1]*dist[0];
6673  }
6674  }
6675 
6676  /* Loop over the physical boundaries. Exclude periodic boundaries. */
6677  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<boundaries.size(); ++iMarker) {
6678  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
6679 
6680  /* Abbreviate the surface elements a bit easier. */
6681  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
6682 
6683  /* Check if this is a shroud boundary. */
6684  bool shroudBoundary = false;
6685  for(unsigned short iShroud=0; iShroud<config->GetnMarker_Shroud(); ++iShroud) {
6686  if(boundaries[iMarker].markerTag == config->GetMarker_Shroud(iShroud)) {
6687  shroudBoundary = true;
6688  break;
6689  }
6690  }
6691 
6692  /* Loop over the boundary faces of this marker. */
6693  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6694 
6695  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6696  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6697  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
6698 
6699  /* For a shroud boundary the grid velocities must be set to zero. */
6700  if( shroudBoundary ) {
6701  for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nInt*nDim); ++i)
6702  surfElem[l].gridVelocities[i] = 0.0;
6703  }
6704  else {
6705 
6706  /* Normal boundary. Determine the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6707  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6708  const su2double *coor = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
6709  su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6710 
6711  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6712  dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6713 
6714  gridVel[0] = Omega[1]*dist[2] - Omega[2]*dist[1];
6715  gridVel[1] = Omega[2]*dist[0] - Omega[0]*dist[2];
6716  if(nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0]*dist[1] - Omega[1]*dist[0];
6717  }
6718  }
6719  }
6720  }
6721  }
6722 
6723  break;
6724  }
6725 
6726  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6727 
6728  case STEADY_TRANSLATION: {
6729 
6730  /* Get the translation velocity from config. */
6731  const su2double vTrans[] = {config->GetTranslation_Rate(0)/Vel_Ref,
6732  config->GetTranslation_Rate(1)/Vel_Ref,
6733  config->GetTranslation_Rate(2)/Vel_Ref};
6734 
6735  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
6736  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
6737 
6738  /* Get the number of DOFs and integration points for this element. */
6739  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
6740  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6741  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
6742 
6743  /* Set the grid velocity in both the integration points and
6744  the sol DOFs. */
6745  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6746  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6747  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6748  gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6749  }
6750 
6751  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6752  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
6753  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6754  gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6755  }
6756  }
6757 
6758  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
6759  for(unsigned long l=0; l<matchingFaces.size(); ++l) {
6760 
6761  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6762  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[l].indStandardElement;
6763  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6764 
6765  /* Set the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6766  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6767  su2double *gridVel = matchingFaces[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6768  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6769  gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6770  }
6771  }
6772 
6773  /* Loop over the physical boundaries. Exclude periodic boundaries. */
6774  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<boundaries.size(); ++iMarker) {
6775  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
6776 
6777  /* Abbreviate the surface elements a bit easier. */
6778  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
6779 
6780  /* Loop over the boundary faces of this marker. */
6781  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6782 
6783  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6784  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6785  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
6786 
6787  /* Set the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6788  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6789  su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6790  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6791  gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6792  }
6793  }
6794  }
6795  }
6796 
6797  break;
6798  }
6799 
6800  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6801 
6802  default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6803  break;
6804  }
6805 
6806  if (config->GetSurface_Movement(MOVING_WALL)){
6807  /*--- Loop over the physical boundaries. Skip the periodic boundaries. ---*/
6808  for(unsigned short i=0; i<boundaries.size(); ++i) {
6809  if( !boundaries[i].periodicBoundary ) {
6810 
6811  /* Check if for this boundary a motion has been specified. */
6812  if (config->GetMarker_All_Moving(i) == YES) {
6813 
6814  /* Determine the prescribed translation velocity, rotation rate
6815  and rotation center. */
6816  const su2double Center[] = {config->GetMotion_Origin(0),
6817  config->GetMotion_Origin(1),
6818  config->GetMotion_Origin(2)};
6819  const su2double Omega[] = {config->GetRotation_Rate(0)/Omega_Ref,
6820  config->GetRotation_Rate(1)/Omega_Ref,
6821  config->GetRotation_Rate(2)/Omega_Ref};
6822  const su2double vTrans[] = {config->GetTranslation_Rate(0)/Vel_Ref,
6823  config->GetTranslation_Rate(1)/Vel_Ref,
6824  config->GetTranslation_Rate(2)/Vel_Ref};
6825 
6826  /* Easier storage of the surface elements and loop over them. */
6827  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[i].surfElem;
6828 
6829  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6830 
6831  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
6832  relevant information from it. Note that the standard element
6833  of the solution must be taken and not of the grid. */
6834  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6835  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6836 
6837  /* Loop over the number of integration points. */
6838  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
6839 
6840  /* Set the pointers for the coordinates and grid velocities
6841  for this integration points. */
6842  const su2double *Coord = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + j*nDim;
6843  su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + j*nDim;
6844 
6845  /* Calculate non-dim. position from rotation center. */
6846  su2double r[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6847  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6848  r[iDim] = (Coord[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6849 
6850  /* Cross Product of angular velocity and distance from center to
6851  get the rotational velocity. Note that we are adding on the
6852  velocity due to pure translation as well. Note that for the
6853  2D case only Omega[2] can be non-zero. */
6854  su2double velGrid[] = {vTrans[0] + Omega[1]*r[2] - Omega[2]*r[1],
6855  vTrans[1] + Omega[2]*r[0] - Omega[0]*r[2],
6856  vTrans[2] + Omega[0]*r[1] - Omega[1]*r[0]};
6857 
6858  /* Store the grid velocities. */
6859  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6860  gridVel[iDim] = velGrid[iDim];
6861  }
6862  }
6863  }
6864  }
6865  }
6866  }
6867 }
6868 
6869 CDummyMeshFEM_DG::CDummyMeshFEM_DG(CConfig *config): CMeshFEM_DG() {
6870 
6871  nZone = config->GetnZone();
6872 
6873  nPoint_P2PSend = new int[size] ();
6874  nPoint_P2PRecv = new int[size] ();
6875 
6876  nVertex = new unsigned long[config->GetnMarker_All()] ();
6877 
6878  Tag_to_Marker = new string[config->GetnMarker_All()];
6879 
6880  for (unsigned short i=0; i <= config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS(); i++){
6881  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem.push_back(0);
6882  }
6883 
6884  boundaries.resize(config->GetnMarker_All());
6885 
6886  nDim = CConfig::GetnDim(config->GetMesh_FileName(), config->GetMesh_FileFormat());
6887 
6888 }
